bDw4huNN_6jWRBFjE8cUkQ.text: They use Diaya cheese which isn't my favorite, but it's a vegan fast food restaurant so Ill be back. I loved the chocolate shake, curly fries, burger is good, and I can't wait to try more food here!

CkiHbKKcaaj6725pHYEyxw.text: Very good the fact that there is a vegan fast food is just amazing. The burger is where it really shines. The popcorn chicken doesn't have much flavor. Very bland. The curly fries far outshine the regular fries. The shakes are good and it's great that they use almond milk. A few tweaks and this place would be amazing. I wish you could add grilled onions to a burger and if they had some more condiments. They only had ketchup. No mustard pickles or relish. Still overall someone making the effort for a vegan fast food is Amazing and I give chef Kenny props!

vwRD9IT7GSEOs89A_9xkPg.text: This was my first time trying a vegan burger and I was shocked at how much I liked it! The only thing I didn't care for was the cheese but it wasn't horrible just different. The service was fast and the prices were reasonable especially for a vegan restaurant. I would most definitely be returning to try other items on the menu! I'm looking forward to trying their "milk"shakes next!

FdcjJd6r5tzNzryDLrOUmQ.text: Food was amazing. Service was fantastic. Best milk shake of my life. And all of this from a non vegan.

bJTbdZIRGWt6mCxWL-Pwvg.text: The food was excellent, friendly quick service.  The dining area was pleasant.  I had the beef sandwich, monster fries and a vanilla shake which were all delicious!

mOZ9QWacotWNYNM3IW99tA.text: Opened on Durango & Centennial! Yeah!! Love everything on the menu! #crueltyfree #mymealdidntscream

eBAr0gBCzbGdRMek3dY8CQ.text: The food is exactly what is expected from a fast food place. I ordered the vegan burger with curly fries and a strawberry smoothie. The burger was good, but a little too greasy for my liking. The fries were crispy. I really enjoyed them. The strawberry smoothie was very sweet but still satisfying. However, next time I order a smoothie I will be asking for less sugar. I can't wait to try other options from the menu. I recommend VegeWay for those looking for a quick bite to eat.

LqaPMnIstZqzDfwqBFKTzg.text: Amazing! We tried the burger, popcorn chicken, and sweet potato fries. The fry sauce was unexpected and had a little kick to it. The burger was amazing! It comes in a bun with cheese, patty, lettuce, onion, and tomato. There is also a slightly sweet sauce. The popcorn chicken was my next favorite. It comes with a tartar sauce and it is cooked to perfection. The sweet potato fries were good in flavor but weren't crispy. That was a little miss for me. I will absolutely be back! Please open one in Henderson.

j7pFDlI8Y_jYUSVeF_67vA.text: This place has horrible service.  I call in to ask if they have a particular item .  The guy who answered the phone immediately says "I don't even know what you're talking about". I explain it again and he replies "this is the Jones location and it doesn't have anything to do with the other location".  Why is it so hard to just say "No,  we don't serve that item here". Boooooo VegeWay

1qnQPKHBb-vH67eqORu_Kw.text: THIS IS MY FAVORITE VEGAN FAST FOOD!!!!!  I have not tried the tacos, pop corn chicken, and chicken wrap. Their milkshakes are to die for! I am loving the holiday flavor shakes they have right now. Their special item, buffalo chicken sandwich was 7 on a scale 10 being the highest. I am obsessed with their burgers and curly fries combo meal. It is $10 rounded up. I have gotten avocado before but it makes the burger messy and hard to eat, too mushy.

8A_WcqM8CzZD-08eK6xDBw.text: Returned for a fourth time and still cannot tell it is completely vegan. Save a cow and go try one for yourself.

GYdtFgF8lLlwEtFnO9Obzg.text: The first thing I had here was the burger and the curly fries and it was amazing! I could not believe it was vegan, totally fooled me! I managed to come a second time (drive thru) and I got the burger again and decided to get a mango milkshake. The burger I scarfed down on the drive home but the mango milkshake not so much. I actually ended up tossing it :( It was wayyyy too sweet and didn't taste anything like mangos. It honestly tasted like cardboard. I think maybe the other flavors will be better. Either way, I'll still come here again, that burger is too die for!!

F01-FtQWxQSG1z0PHF5iPQ.text: This place is awesome! My newly vegan husband and I were so happy to find this place. Everything we tried was absolutely delicious. The fried zucchini, curly fries, burgers, and popcorn chicken were divine. We pigged out! Even if you're not vegan or vegetarian, you should try it!

_1BRKJIlcYfuNrcHtvtMog.text: We visit Las Vegas pretty much annually and always eat at Veggie House, usually twice.  While there we saw the ad for this place.  Visited on a Sunday at noon; was somewhat surprised to see Chef Kenny in attendance working the kitchen.    Was so good, we went back the next day.  Between our group we tried the burger, fish taco, beef sandwich, regular fries, curly fries and zucchini fries.  Everything was superb.  Particularly the beef sandwich which was very similar to a bahn mi.  Lots of the menu is fried and all was a  little greasy.  I'm unsure how healthy this is but like any fast food place, it should be more like a treat and not a daily source of nourishment.  Vegan fast food is an interesting concept and not only do I wish Chef Kenny well in this endeavor, I'm looking forward to going back next year.

C3NDpkPHYVjnm6ogeXIJ9w.text: This place takes so long it's rediculous. The food is sub par when weighed with how long it takes

mEsaB6A-7HNU9xE6K7Gfww.text: Feeling for vegan in Vegas ? This is definitely the spot. You won't be disappointed. Had the vegan fish taco and  the double vegan burger with sweet potato fries with a vanilla smoothie, ammmmaaazing.

gB5-nHV-8-4W9IwXiKdchA.text: I went there and ordered a Fish taco, zucchini my favorite and popcorn chicken. The fish taco was very good. The popcorn chicken was dry and the tempura on the chicken was hard and   Over cooked. The zucchini, my favorite was tossed In tempura and it wasn't covered all over, some pieces had no tempura at all. The wait was very long. Like a 20 plus min wait in Togo window.  The ranch was so-so. watered down and there was barely any sauce for the portion.  I really enjoy the Veggie House so I wish they would have brought some of those elements to this location.  My total for the three items was $13 and change. Not affordable when I only really ate the taco. Still hungry rummaging thru my fridge. I heard the burgers were winners so we will see. I haven't had a shake yet, I will probably give it a second chance, and try something different but these items are out.

Q0bE8zeGtZ-LbauT5uFlwg.text: My wife is the Vegan but i am trying. This place was the BOMB!!! I am sold.... This is my new fast food spot for life!!!

x_1DigSwcjlaHvR31NqIag.text: Curly fries and the popcorn chicken were excellent. Beef sandwich was decent. I was sad that I didn't have the tastebuds for the cheeseburger (specifically the cheese) though.   Positive and friendly staff.  Needs more locations!

SZbydu8NLAOG0qtat9tl9g.text: Oh yeah. Loved this place, I live on the other side of town and come here. The burgers were so good, really haven't tried anything else apart from the burger because I love it so much. The place could be a little cleaner but I can't complain. Double cheeseburger, sweet potato fries, and a chocolate shake makes my day.

fU6VBKUfe-5amFDGOUjTnw.text: Omg this place is FANTASTIC.   I've had the popcorn "chicken", burger, fish tacos, and curly fries here. I come here about twice a week and thank the lord they have a drive thru.  Everything tastes fantastic.... Even the vegan ranch and buffalo sauce. I was skeptical because it looks and tastes better than meat... But it isn't!!!! This place is incredible.  The staff here are so awesome and friendly. I can tell they love their jobs because they're always peppy and have a smile on their face.   The prices are reasonable too. Comparable to typical fast food prices. Vegeway keeps my wallet happy because typical vegan places literally rob me.  I'm curious about their nutrition facts but I don't really care because their food is delicious.... I will be back!!!!

mAw9R99dTYD6djC6h4osDQ.text: Wow chef Kenny! I have been trying to get my husband to come here for weeks but being that it's a vegan restaurant he wouldn't go. I found a groupon and figured this is my only way I'll get him to try it. He LOVED it! I was shocked at how fast he finished the burger and monster fries. He was shocked as well. The monster fries are so good comparable to animal fries at in n out. I had the cheeseburger which was delicious! I really liked how it was crispy on the outside. Chocolate shake was good too. Hubby had the Hawaiian burger and he said you would never know that it's not a real burger. Our new favorite fast food place!

QSoXyO1263ujvcLa_soW-Q.text: I love this place so much and in the beginning, everything was always perfect. But for the last couple MONTHS I've been coming, they mess up my order EVERY time. I work in the industry so I understand mess ups here and there but I come here quite frequently and it's very frustrating to have my order corrected EVERY SINGLE time. I have been coming less and less because for me, even if I ordered correctly in the beginning, it's still uncomfortable for me to have my order fixed. It makes me feel like I'm bothering you, and as a customer I should never feel that way.  I'm sad because I love Chef Kenny and his food. Please hire better staff that pay more attention.

JE-IBxuMHUEkNJYjLmghTg.text: The most delicious burger I've had since going Vegan. Had the jalapeno awesome. Fries excellent We love your food Kenny.

o21kGCDRPDvC0YZ4Uhau8g.text: My hubs has a weak spot for In-N-Out & this place blew him away!   Vegan Double & Animal fries (aka Monster fries) with milkshakes...YUM! I have also tried the vegan fish sandwich which was good but I still prefer the cheese burgers ;) The kids loved it as well

SnS_WSHspaerTuxONCgMJw.text: Horrible horrible horrible service!!! Great idea, love the plant based fast food idea, but THE WORST SERVICE AND EMPLOYEES! Don't ever go here!

kntIK6JaBuj8Wemrq6cHVQ.text: Great food shitty drive thru! Fuck your drive thru Fuck your drive thru Fuck your drive thru. Do you understand me now?

K6HyBqzS996TIuKTOs-f2w.text: Didn't even know a place like this existed until I just happened to drive by.  Went through the drive-thru since no one else was there.  Got a combo plus the fried zucchini.  Took a little longer than expected, but when I received my food it was all very fresh and very hot.  Curly fries were delicious and not greasy at all.  The "burger" was extremely tasty with that hearty, meaty feel.  The "cheese" was melty (which, if you're vegan, you know is very hard to find) and delicious - and saved me from my lactose intolerance.  I also got a side of the fried zucchini which was straight from heaven.  The vegan ranch that came with it was not-so-much: a bit watery, but the flavor itself was decent.  I will definitely come back here. I want to try the vegan milkshakes!

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Allergy Advisory at drive thru.

xXw623GyQw7V1wVg5i9ojw.text: The fact that I have gone here twice in a row for the past 3 days as I write this review probably says a lot about how much I have come to appreciate Vegeway.  Initially when they first opened, I absolutely hated their burgers and vowed to never come back after my first try - the "cheese" made me lose my appetite for it made the burger taste too sweet for my liking and just made me want to find the nearest In-N-Out as quick as possible.   Fast forward to half a year later and becoming vegan for almost 5 months, my palate has definitely changed (or the establishment has gotten better since they opened) and I was very impressed after trying the Hawaiian Burger - super tasty, juicy, onions were caramelized nicely - and the Beef Bahn Mi sandwich. The next day we came back to try the Double Vegan Burger and the chicken burger (but they mistakingly gave us the single vegan burger instead - but I guess shame on us for not double checking our drive thru order). We seriously felt like we were eating an In-N-Out burger which has officially fulfilled our craving since becoming vegan!   Prices are honestly pretty steep (prepare to spend almost $20+ on fast food but hey, this ain't no McDonald's & you do get what you pay for!). I do appreciate the various choices such as wraps, salad, popcorn chicken, etc. if you're not feeling up for burgers.   Overall, a must try if you're in the mood for a plant based alternative to your Big Mac and fries. Thanks to Chef Kenny for another delicious vegan creation!

TUSN9SNEdDj6QR0RMFeP8A.text: It's pretty awesome. Like In & Out for vegans. I couldn't imagine going to Vegas and not stopping by there at this point. You can Ben get cheese fries.   Stick to the cheeseburger and fries though. One time I ordered the Bahn Mi sandwich and it was zero fun. Also, even though it's "fast food" it takes about 20 min to get your order, so be ready for that too.

lqSzk56dsgFzN5-cExelMg.text: Hell, I'm gonna say it. I was very excited when I first heard that this place was opening since it's right next to my house. I like the concept, but after trying the burger and the tacos. I was extremely disappointed. The food is really trash, the veg. burger is so bad that upon taking the first bite it stuck to the roof of my mouth and I realized that I'm an idiot for getting 2 patties, cause with each subsequent bite i took I had to use the goddamn drink straw andmy tongue to get the sticky soy patty off the roof of my mouth. I only ate half of the $8 burger and threw it out. The fish taco that I got was alright, but nothing mindblowing. There are better fish taco places around the corner and they are way cheaper.   I'd have given this place at least 2 stars, but the service was abysmal at the drive through. There were 2 girls free with only my car at the drive-thru. They made an eye contact with me 5 times in the 2 minutes I was there, but didn't come to take the order. The lack of service and shitty food make this restaurants one of the rare ones that I give 1 star review to.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sad fish taco. Tasted like McWrap.

HGqgrhaO6MIoWaRe5Bn-NQ.text: Only was able to try the pop-corn chicken today but it was SUPER good! They should serve with bbq or Frank's for dipping sauce tho.  I was surprisingly impressed with the ranch & I'm actually very picky when it comes to ranch dressing.. I can't wait to go back.  Wish these kinds of places were all over.

Ff2-0iu4Ds8pylwGnfDhDA.text: Ehhh, I am not feeling it. I was pretty excited to try this place because of so many raving reviews I've been seeing on social media, but what a letdown. First of all, I enjoy Vegan eats and the lack of meat is not what's missing here. There was just nothing spectacular or even remotely special about this place or its food.  I selected the Double V Burger Meal with Curly Fries and a Drink ($9.89). Certainly not a cheap meal. The burger was ugly and a far cry from their photos (I thought this only happened at major fast food brands?). Their patties are misrepresented as the real product is extremely thin, plus, the fresh vegetables were almost non-existent (there was seriously a leaf of lettuce that didn't even over the size of the bun and these buns are not big). The bottom line, it didn't taste great. It wasn't bad, but I'm certain that it has nearly the same amount of calories/sodium as its non-Vegan counterpart and totally not worth it. To add to the already insulting meal, the side of fries was dismal and probably the same ones you find in the grocery store's freezer section.   If you're looking for a Vegan place based solely on the fact that you do not consume animal products, then, it's here (though there are so many better Vegan restaurants in town). However, if you're looking to eat healthier, this is NOT the place for you. Vegan does not equal healthy!

DWXrSl1sIondvPcG1h5wUw.text: Ok so today this place is getting 2 stars i would do one but I believe in redemption and one star would be cruel, so i just got done eating my food i orders the double vegan burger and orange chicken a chocolate milkshake and fries , so i will review each item then close it out!   1: The fries good as usual had some crisp to it very good!  2: the vegan milkshake was just the best thang ever please order these when you go!   3: the double vegan burger .....i had the burgers here about 4 times! Today it tasted foul left me feeling like i needed to vomit right after not settling right in my stomach at all, I don't know how you guys cooked it but tasted like old grease and high cholesterol!   4: orange chicken , i had it once before it was crispy it was orangy i was perfect .... today it lacked the flavor tasted like balls of grease and soggy cotton balls ! Not happy at all!    So here's the deal , every visit should always be better than the last visit ! I always leave bad reviews to remind people that the negative issues will always stand out before the positive issues and when a customer as in me is paying for a expected product of food it should be like the last time or better, i haven't had this place in a few weeks because I'm always busy but today had the chance and did not live up to the hype! I'd like to rate this place 5 stars and would willing to do so if they are willing for it to change! Other than that i won't say stay away because it's not bad but when you go the distance it should be great!

EDaX14gZscIajOfJ-Xkg1w.text: The Hawaiian burger is just amazing! I love the taste and flavors of the food. Also the strawberry shake hits the spot. Just one ding for the cooks, we loved the popcorn "chicken" but majority of it was just fried batter. :/ Overall great place for vegan eats

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IgW6oEWtiLvqWM2Hy5vBwg.text: And for my new Happy place! Vege-Way, located in China Town. A woman told me about this place and gave rave reviews! I chose not to look at any reviews or any ratings because I wanted to have a purely unbiased opinion.   The 100% vegan version of In & Out Burger but 10 times Better! I ordered the strawberry milkshake, chicken nuggets, curly fries, zucchini, and double burger. From the first bite into the burger to the last swallow of the shake, it was vegan heaven.   The employees were very friendly, the music and ambience was fantastic. Me and my girlfriend thoroughly enjoyed our experience in every way possible as customers.   Not only is this place beyond amazing, the prices make it easy on the pockets so you can fully enjoy your burgers and fries. Oops! and did I mention the DRIVE-THRU?! It just keeps getting better. I highly recommend visiting Vege-Way and be sure to watch the recommended videos about the meat industry.   I'd definitely LOVE to visit this place again!

eF1m-F97pDxTxwMTm9gw8w.text: This place was okay. I'm vegetarian and always look to try new veggie restaurants. This is the first vegan restaurant I've ever seen with a drive-through! So that's pretty cool. But I didn't love the food. We had the burger, curly fries, and popcorn chicken. To me the burger had a weird flavor that I didn't like at all. The popcorn chicken also wasn't what I was expecting. It seemed more like a tempura batter than what you'd expect for popcorn chicken. It mostly tasted like grease unfortunately. We did love the curly fries but you can get those anywhere. We were told that they would have a new menu starting in January, so I would be willing to give it another chance in the future.

r-FKPrw7dPoSeHPjM2JUdA.text: Part two of trying all the Vegan places in town for the daughter.   Coming here to Chef Kenny's place was an exciting event. A couple of things off the bat, "Turn the MUSIC down."  And where are all the chairs and tables?  I have to review this as a fast food place, and not just a vegan place.   1. Choices - The choices are similar to any fast food place, burgers, double burgers, burger meal deals, popcorn chicken.  There were sweet potato fries and curly fries as well as milkshakes.  Really interesting was the fish taco, a beef sandwich something like a Bahn Mi and a chicken wrap! Heck, you can even buy frozen patties to bring home... That is great.   2.  If you are- having a hankering for fast food, a burger, fries and a shake, this is a great place to come and get your fix!  3.  If you are - not only a vegan, but watching what ingredients you are putting into your body, then I would caution you that this is first and foremost a fast food place.  Fried, deep fried, heinz ketchup (vegan, but with corn syrup....) and so all the ingredients are well, as normal as you can get for a vegan.  For me, i think that having fast food and being vegan, this is a great choice.  However, I would say, as a place to go and have a great meal, this would not be my first, second or third choice.  I found the music over bearing, the decor a bit trashy and really not too thoughtful, a lack of chairs and tables, I thought the service was a bit slow, the sweet potatoes way over cooked, and the curly fries were okay.  The chocolate shake was pretty good. The hamburger was very, very cheesy, and overly cheesy.  The fish tacos were pretty darn good.  I just did not feel that this was a place I will continue to eat at. However, when the vegan daughter has a need for greasy, junk food, I am gonna take her here and be proud of it. GK says check it out, just be aware like most fast food places, it is what it is.  This place was to me the equivalent of a McDonalds or Burger King and has a way to go for that In and Out type of quality, taste and ambiance.  Thanks,

vXApp1u-tklx6vWiHQI0WQ.text: Since opening, I came in several times & noticed that their lettuce, onion & tomato didn't seem fresh. I don't eat any kind of meat, poultry, fish or dairy so I always pay close attention to the freshness of the fruits & vegetables on my food.   The  first time I came in, they ran out of cheese  which is a good thing because they use Daiya cheese which I'm not too fond of because of the sweet aftertaste. The burger is good though despite of their lettuce, tomato & onion not being fresh. The bun reminds me of in & out buns when I use to go there back in my meat eating days. My sons like the popcorn chicken. I enjoyed the fish taco & strawberry shake.   The second time, I went to the drive thru. It was an odd process. I waited for a moment & then the speaker told me to wait & then she came on & told me to order at the window. And then...and then...and thennnnnnn.....haha   Once I ordered, she said to pull around at the side. That was different. I drove around a couple times until I found a parking space. I guess that's the procedure considering how busy it was. It's nice to see a vegan place like this poppin.   Overall the family was pleased. Grease on grease on grease. Perfect for those kind of days. When the kids want a fast food burger, this is the place. Everything I conjectured it to be. It fulfills it's purpose for a greasy, fast food drive thru joint, vegan style. I love the concept of this establishment. Can't wait to try the other things on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double double vegan cheese burger
Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Everything was tasty

8gqm7BcxZG2czvOMzsFXtw.text: The food here is DE-LICIOUS! The staff is really nice and friendly and I LOVE that they have all sorts of info on why being vegan matters. Our order:  Double burger  Steak sandwich  Popcorn chicken  Monster fries  Curly fries Chocolate milkshake  Strawberry milkshake   The steak sandwich is so freaking good. The burger was really tasty too but if I had to pick, the steak sandwich wins hands down.   Both milkshakes were really good but the strawberry one was way more flavorful compared to the chocolate.  The popcorn chicken totally hit the spot. The breading is on the thicker side but doesn't overwhelm the chicken.   Monster fries were sooooooo good. Definitely not sharing those next time.   The curly fries were good but needed more seasoning, in my opinion. They were cooked really well though, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.   Everything is here is vegan but we still had to ask about cooking methods and they assured us that they do not use any animal products like lard for cooking the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double burger Strawberry milkshake (fave) Chocolate milkshake  Popcorn chicken  Monster fries (fave) Steak sandwich (fave) All vegan!

6T9x7Nxjzn1Gzrw0pzh1yg.text: I was really excited about a fast food vegan place...but disappointed after trying it out. I had high hopes for Chef Kenny because his Veggie House is amazing! This is okay if you're looking for something quick, but I probably won't return. We gave it a few tries and tried multiple items...fish sandwich probably the best. Try it out though and see for yourself.

Q6zj7rxE6AU4hWdf7h4FgA.text: Vegeway has to be the most uptight place I have ever been to about ranch. When this place first opened rach was unlimited, I was never asked to pay extra for ranch. After a few months of them being open you got one ranch with ever order and 25 cents for extra ranch, I just went here and now you have to pay 25 cents for every ranch, kind of silly. Very good food though. But the inside could be designed so much better, it just looks really run down inside. Four starts because of the inside and the ranch thing blows my mind .

WtoHS99VhymphmdoUbUz2w.text: My three star rating is not for the food, it is for the customer service. I always order through drive-thru and I have to repeat myself several times and half of the time, they get my order wrong. Also it seems like it's ran by high school students who give attitude. The last trouble I had was the wait time. I ordered two jalapeno burgers  and it must have taken nearly ten minutes. There was no one in front of me so I don't understand why it took so long,  and this isn't the first time it's happened.  As for the food,  I love the jalapeno burger, fries and popcorn chicken. Have yet to try the shakes!

hPmXvBQFmOR7GLO2pRxW1g.text: Being a vegan from Orange County I scope out my eating options whenever I travel and make a list.  This place has been on my list through a couple Las Vegas trips but this last one I stopped in not once but twice.   Since transitioning to a vegan diet I have missed having fried zucchini, one of my all time favorites.  Vegeway nailed it! I got an order both times and their ranch is good too.  I had both their popcorn chicken and their orange popcorn chicken.  Both were good however the plain popcorn chicken was better with ketchup.  The burgers were also very delicious.  It's too bad this place wasn't here when my brother lived around the corner.  I will definitely be back!

Irt67Qnx2KRLOlTzldq0FQ.text: Vegan Beef = if you love banh mi, you will love it, vegetarian, vegan or not, its yum.

b1_Ie2zw1F1RcAgB6dMWDA.text: Love that this was literally 15 minutes away from my job at Fashion Show Mall...food was ready after order in 5minutes, was hott and delicious, and worth the investment for food on the go w/my fastpace lifestyle! F'N love this restaurant! An LV staple for sure!

_qBI-VC84HKexsSXR4mv5Q.text: The best. So awesome. Vegan. Fast food. Drive thru. Vegan milkshakes. It's like an in'n'out just without the murder aspect. I only wish it was open later.

18td2WWF2nSsXPi25_hcsQ.text: Love this place! My dad is very picky about food and he also likes it that's saying a lot. Just wish there was one closer to where i live

20hvTrqii6Bc-jTBvVcN4A.text: Vegans, heed my word: Las Vegas ain't no California. Do not expect a vegan option or two on the menu of every restaurant you walk into. Hence my excitement upon hearing that there's a new all-vegan restaurant in town. First thought upon entering the joint: "I can eat ANYTHING on the menu!" I was so overwhelmed by this prospect that I did what any sensible consumer would do: asked the staff for their favorite/most popular item. The Hawaiian burger and curly fries were it, apparently. I got the burger... and was profoundly disappointed.  It dripped fat and lacked flavor. Fake cheese made exactly zero contribution to it. This particular burger deserves two, not three stars, but the extra star I'm giving this establishment represents the benefit of the doubt: maybe I got the wrong item. I am willing to give this place one more try before I make up my mind. Expect an update.

3In9_kN_ukz5JYSqXWQ8nA.text: Not that great.  It was really fun to try a vegan fast food, but honestly, the best thing we had was the milkshake. Too bad the mango was discontinued. Anyway, the burger is super average. Even grocery store burgers are better since they have some flavor and more texture. Kinda surprised the bun isn't an obvious whole grain or wheat. Overall, flavor really lacked. Kids enjoyed the fries, but they will eat those anywhere. Zucchini would be better if it was seasoned, its pretty bland, but the breading is great. Same goes for the popcorn chicken. There are enough vegan options in Vegas that we won't be back. On an upside, we loved that the staff clearly love their jobs. They were singing in the kitchen and obviously happy. That was nice to see and hear.

hheQQ4a2vx-08YdwEVX2sA.text: I love this place!! A vegan fast food restaurant with a drive through. It's a dream come True! My boyfriend keeps coming back here too and he's not even a vegetarian. The milkshakes are amazing, the burgers are delicious. We need to replace every McDonald's with a Vegeway.

y0Yj4qPWaznMzhElI4NBzQ.text: I don't know why there are any bad reviews for this place. I always love the burgers and shakes. Sure it's not the healthiest food but it's a drive through burger joint and that's not it's purpose! Great fast cruelty free food and I have never had any problems with the staff or environment .

-WP0kFXFqesF7klI_NiOsg.text: Best Vegan fast food ever! The wrap has a ton of stuff in it. Rice, vegan chicken, cucumbers, some kind of amazing sauce, yum! The vegan popcorn chicken breading is amazing. Look forward to coming back and trying the veggie burger. Hope you open a location in Henderson!

KsxJ8Lo-R3Ka9M7An604Mw.text: It's apparent the owner of this restaurant is a tight-fisted business man and not a real vegetarian chef or pioneer for healthy foods - as it tastes like they put the lowest quality ingredients they can acquire into their food. And I could see sitting in the dining area into the back of the kitchen some real junky, bulk-style food ingredients you might get at Food-4-Less, the cheapest stuff you can get. And the food was awful. Bland, flavorless... it was a chore to finish our order. And we tried out their other restaurant, Veggie House, and it too was more of the same. I took some non-vegetarians there to open their palates to new, delicious, meat-less foods while we were visiting in Las Vegas - but we were all sorely disappointed. And it doesn't make sense that Veggie House doesn't cook with garlic or onions (a strict Buddhist dietary code), however VegeWay did. So it begs the question: what exactly are this owner's ethics? Is he actually just trying to save money with garlic and onions at the other restaurant? It appears so. Just cheap cheap cheap.... that's what their food is. Not cheap in price - but cheap in quality, taste, and ethics.

kVaYdrdADfqUTF-mmm9haQ.text: One of the best vegan places I have been to. The other location is okay. But, this location is the BEST. Everyone that works there is so nice and the food is so good. It's a very welcoming environment. Also, it's very convenient for vegans when they're trying to eat out. I go here very often after work or when I have the munchies! Definitely recommend this place!

AJYckk7hBAgyOUv3dy3VdA.text: Pretty tasty! I had the spicy jalapeno burger with curly fries and was not disappointed. I love that there were fresh sliced jalapenos on the burger, I just wish they would disclose exactly what ingredients are in their patties, but I understand they don't want to give away their recipes. Can't wait to come back and try the bahn mi sandwich!

ZUFJjGW5xrdaWmn4ExVYhQ.text: This place is amazing  best vegan burger and beef hogey sandwich. I'm from California and this place is the best. Highley recommend.

-o3SR1b7mxvUpryR1CEqbw.text: Fast food at its best for Vegan eats! The food has definitely improved over the last year with new additions to their menu & possibly a change to their burger? Either way very good.

bWbaUIjq_4pWPOahJz_SIQ.text: I've been maybe five times and love it. Great veg burgers and fries and the shakes are on point. They always have new interesting things but I love the vegan burger so much I never try anything else. I will some day though.

UIOV7g1z_rCCWEAsV4hCIA.text: Burger and fries were really good! Popcorn chicken was very tasty but could use a little seasoning. The star was the fish tacos, they were delish! Mango shake didn't really care for but I won't give up and I'll try the chocolate shake next time. Overall food was hot, fresh and tasted good. Service was good but the place itself needed a little tlc in the way of cleaning and just decor. Will be back though for the chicken wrap and sweet potato fries next time!!

Yv8Nq2p_xqR2lQCTFVWUYg.text: What the heck! This food was so amazing, it's like In and Out but vegan! Popcorn chicken, Double Burger, Monster Fries, I was in heaven. Will be returning again and again. We're from Seattle, WA and have not had such good vegan fast food for a long time. Keep up the good work guys.

a6cfT-xdy_elH51_2ZvFPw.text: My recent order consisted of a burger, curly fries, milkshake and the zucchini. Normally I ask for my burger to be sans sauce but I forgot to and I have to say, I won't do that again. Their sauce is not for me. The curly fries have always been great except this time they were somewhat stale. My zucchini came with a puddle of oil and no ranch. The only item I was able to truly enjoy was the milkshake.

5Skx3RqC9XSxHDZRC6Ftyw.text: I am not a vegetarian, but I keep coming back to this Vegan fast food spot. If you didn't tell me that the vegan beef sandwich wasn't meat, I might not notice because it doesn't last very long in front of me. It's sort of reminiscent of a Vietnamese sandwich, and a good one at that. It's got crisp veggies and well seasoned "steak." The vegan burger unfortunately doesn't get the same praise. It tasted and felt slightly overcooked, and overloaded with an excess amount of lettuce.  Overall, if you are looking to try something new, or just want some vegetarian food without paying too much, it's worth the stop in.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan Beef Sandwich, Vegan Burger, and v-mak sauce.

z4LfDhWimeTw4KUQpmCLxA.text: This fast food restaurant is amazing !! Not only is it vegan but the menu is to die for ! I had to go twice this past weekend because I couldn't get enough. I totally recommend it  I will definitely go again when I'm on Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double double
Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zOSZxXb-vWHS7d3YazwsJA.text: First time here! Delicious vegan ranch for my fries and vanilla milkshake! The wait time was a little much, but aside from that - perfect! Awesome to have vegan drive thru! Will be back to try impossible burger full vegan style!

Xwcf6uCSx1zVEZYnHwG6aw.text: The food is so good. I'm not vegan but my parents told me about it and I would honestly prefer to eat here than regular fast food places that serve meat.  The inside isn't very clean so I was nervous at first to eat the food but once I tasted it I honestly didn't care how it looked. I had the monster fries, the beef sandwich, popcorn chicken and the chocolate shake. All 4 were amazing. I can't wait to go back !

gthsFjIMsKQP-Wg31XHpfQ.text: Ordered the single burger combo. I liked how the patty taste plus the vegan cheese they added. The bread was delish as well. Also ordered fried zucchini that came with vegan tzatziki sauce. I wish this place was in San Francisco. Used the drive thru the customer service was pleasant and zen-like.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger combo with Zucchini fries
Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger came with vegan cheese lettuce tomato and onions

NBG8tt2csr7b-WixNh6TXQ.text: Best vegan burger I've had!! Definitely recommend for vegans and non-vegans. I order the double burger with monster fries. Burger was deliciousssss and the fries weren't really my cup of sauce (pun intended).   I would also like to thank my mom for sponsoring this meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iMecXPam1_Wqe2jIHl3H6g.text: This little gem makes just the sort of burgers I've been hankering for since becoming a vegan. They are reminiscent of the kind you get at In-N-Out in California, though they're not marketed that way. They even make the monster fries you'd swear were at that very burger chain. My only complaint is that the menu is so limited and the service a bit slow; we were there at 7:00 pm, the only customers in the store, and it took ten minutes to get our food. Still, I will go back and I highly recommend Vege-Way to anyone wanting a delicious burger.

fPl8zBwT2u5cEAroBEsH4A.text: So far, I've tried a few things here. The veggie chicken wrap is very good, but I think they over do it on the brown rice.  I think the coleslaw they have here is pretty fresh and had a good crunch to it.  I've ordered the chicken Cajun burger, that one was chewy ant the patty kept sticking to the roof of my mouth.  I'm thinking it's a tapioca based party. The veggie burger however, was pretty good.  Great bite and taste.  I'm not vegetarian or Vegan-but I go here for the flavor of the food and a break from meat.   The wait of the food is long and that's because it's all made to order.  This doesn't upset me.  The owner/chef Kenny is usually here and is extremely Hospital and accommodating.  I recommend this place even to the meatiest of eaters.  Update 2/23/18 Dear chef Kenny,  Your worker Athena seemed pretentious and rude today. When asked about nutrition facts about the food, she replied,"I have no idea," then she gave me a box of food without bagging it and just looked at me. I had to ask for a bag and she seemed to be annoyed. I don't even want to come back because of the way she was.  Can you please tell your workers to be more considerate ?

mmULwgFZUNf0vuIPcCH0dg.text: Since I gave up red meat, I've been searching for the best veggie burger. This is far from it. But I still love it.  Now, this is in no way a gourmet burger- it's a quick and dirty fast food burger. In vegan form. And it's pretty glorious. I think even a meat eater could appreciate it. The look of the double vegan burger reminded me of an in-n-out burger. The patties are more on the mushier side, and I know many people who prefer a firmer patty. Vegan cheese is well melted and makes the burger gooey/sticky, which I kinda really enjoy. I did have to finish it with a fork... It's the closest thing I've found yet to a fast food burger, so I'm happy with it. I haven't had the chance to try other menu items besides the fish tacos, which are refreshing with their mango salsa. Way to go chef Kenny! Will have to try the popcorn "chicken" on my next visit :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double vegan burger... it gets messy!!
Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger
Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan fish taco whatttt?!

J-zyqcg8hgReA4hAbWdiKQ.text: So I called and placed an order from their website. Shortly after I went on Yelp to look for any buy one get one or free discounts etc sometimes some businesses offer. I did not find anything like that but I did find a picture of a bug that somebody posted a month ago! Yuck having been that I already ordered my food and I have been out of the country numerous times and who knows what I have eight but still it's not cool. I also read that somebody had a burger that smelled horrible and did not make them want to eat it at all so I decided to try the beef sandwich it was just OK it was a little bit dry the fries were bomb though and so was the shake. I looked in my food and didn't see any bug in there I did let the girl know about the yelp review to and she said that she had no idea and was going to let her manager know... Also when I went inside to pick up my food I noticed I was the only one in line and I noticed that the floor was really dirty like they could sweep it.... I mean in my opinion the cashier could be sweeping it in his downtime also the windows were really dirty the door to the entrance also the grills on the outside looked kind a like they needed to be wiped down I don't know these kinds of things help to not get bugs. Just saying. Will I be returning I don't think so.

PXZBaVsYxderv9Q9J-8u-g.text: I am not a fan of vege-way. I find there just isn't good. It's cheap and super greasy. Just not a pleasant experience. I won't be going back and I don't recommend it

_otXITAkFZqAO3zM8gHPxw.text: Well this was stop #4 on my Vegas Vegan Excursion and all I can say it was definitely worth the trip we made to enjoy a Vegan Burger and Curly Fries. Now alot of people have compared this establishment to IN & OUT Burger and the presentation is indeed very similar. I was a little bit disappointed with the ambiance of the place because it looked like more of a Thai or Asian establishment. Now with that being said I do realize the owner of the location is Asian and in fact there is a sign posted in the establishment advising people to go to "Veggie House" which I assume is owned by the same family.   I HIGHLY recommend the Double Double Burger.....Curly Fries.....and Drink for just under 10 bucks.....it is the best deal in the establishment in my opinion. We found out they are now serving Buffalo Chicken Sandwiches......Chicken Burgers with Ranch and Fish Sandwiches as well.....all VEGAN of course. My wife upgraded her meal for $2.50 more so she could try the Strawberry Milkshake...... I tried some of hers and it was just "OKAY". Be advised they use SOY and Almond Milk to make their Milkshakes so if you don't drink either of those milks then I wouldn't purchase the shakes.  All in all the service was great.....the food was indeed Delicious and we were literally IN and OUT (get it.....LOL) in about 30 minutes. While not in a very populated area it is still worth the trip to try out these wonderful Burgers and Fries.....Eat, Drink, and be Merry my Friends!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The owner of the establishment
Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu Board
Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kNL9brR0H43bO2T48Or6yQ.text: Highly recommend. Good prices.  I got the Hawaiian burger, curly fries, and a chocolate shake and everything was delicious +came out pretty fast. Drive through is kinda slow so just go inside and order Togo.

XeX-rHsblP3U_gnqqT0jrg.text: Cautious carnivores... Disclosure: I'm not Vegan, nor a vegetarian.   So, I've been acquainted with vegan places, as well as vegetarian.  I've also have encountered places which state Vegan, yet they make use of eggs & have the animal renet in some of their ingredients- not vegan.  Clean establishment, friendly staff and it has a drive thru! I've been to VegeWay five times- I've made more use of the driverthru:)   VegeWay's fried zucchini and the Vegan milkshake are my favorites. That milkshake is yummy! I've built a vegan burger and it was tasty! I mean the mock meat actually tasted really good.   I'm not a chicken person, so as for the VegeWay's orange and popcorn dishes I can't honestly tell you.  However! I've seen those plates pass my by and thought hmm- next time. I wish the menu was a bit more extensive, perhaps a Vegan infused menu?

AyffwuXjYCgSUy1oD4GulQ.text: You wouldn't be able to say it doesn't taste like meat cuz it totally does!!! For a vegan who craving for meat texture, this place is ya homerun!! Try the new item, Hawaiian burger if you like a bit of sweetness in your burger!

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dirty fries
Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange chicken
Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian burger

f2nPdF5cPZDnYi_nZ0GiUQ.text: I'm not vegan but was still happy with the food here, which is not always the case for me with vegan food. The burgers are quite tasty and I  enjoyed the popcorn chicken. Prices were a little higher than I expected but not terrible. A little sparse inside, but overall a pretty decent experience.

u5ciffab06oZyrEvXLZy4Q.text: I really don't know what to say... As a vegan... The fast food experience is non existent. The fact that chef Kenny brought this concept to life in Vegas alone gets 5 stars...   The place was busy! We went around 630 P.M. And it made me so happy to see it popping... We ordered two meals... Mine, I did protein style (no bun) no cheese and sauce on the side and the sweet potato fries. My friend ordered the vegan cheese burger, regular fries, and a mango milk shake. The food didn't take to long to come out... We waited maybe ten min total. It wasn't very expensive either... It was around $20.00.   My food was awesome. The burger was excellent... Grilled perfectly. The Fries were great... Nothing was greasy at all... It was hard to tell this was fast food... And I didn't feel guilty eating it.   My friend enjoyed his burger. He did not care for the vegan cheese and said next time he would order a double with no cheese. He really liked his fries as well... The mango milk shake was sweeter than he preferred but he said the chocolate and vanilla are his next tries... He was impressed and from a non vegan in and out veteran... That says a lot. I am really excited for the new location that is opening closer to my house! Thank you chef Kenny!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango shake
Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan cheese burger and regular fries
Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Protein style and sweet potato fries

oEGn2HMyCaG1D6uk-KIztA.text: When your friend asks you to try vegetarian in and out.. And you give it a shot. I was pleasantly surprised at this cute little fast food restaurant. They sell more than just burgers. Menu also includes vegan fish tacos and vegetarian popcorn chicken.   I tried the single party burger. Guac is free!!  Comes with the burger. However, it tastes like store bought Guac which I don't like instead of fresh made Guac. I think next time I'll go without it. We also got the curly fries, popcorn chicken and a mango milkshake. The mango milkshake is interesting.. It sort of tasted like a mango slushee in boba stores. The curly fries were good. Not as addicting like jack in the box ones but I'm sure these are 100x more healthy.   My fave was the popcorn chicken. It's just fried gluten but it was very satisfying. Had a nice texture and crispness to it. The burger was good. It didn't exactly taste like in and out but the essence was there. The patty is very crispy and deep fried and does have a bite to it. After the meal I was thoroughly full and didn't miss meat!

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegeway burger. With free Guac!
Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curly fries
Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sauces- Cajun and ketchup

osv2vVdawazJxxAf9valJA.text: Delicious vegan food!  I especially love the vegan shakes.  You really don't have to be a vegan to enjoy the food here.  I brought my husband who is a meat eater and he really liked it as well.  Friendly service and clean space.  I plan on returning here every time we visit Vegas!

dG0Umf9rBEOW1Y_lGEijBg.text: The burgers are amazing!!!  Seriously, best veggie burger I have ever had, anywhere. My 17yo meat-eating, In-N-Out loving son just declared, with a surprised look on his face, that it was "better than a regular burger" and demanded that I stop what I was doing and take a bite of mine immediately.   The vanilla milkshake is also something I will definitely order again. Too bad they sold out of chocolate and strawberry before I could get there tonight, but am so glad to see them so busy.  Can't wait to try everything else. I still have a 'vegan beef sandwich' (looks like a banh mi to me) waiting for me in the kitchen, but I had to sit down right away to send them some love by writing this review after trying that incredibly delicious burger :D

0mXXg7B-WrFAcvh7aH9IWA.text: We first got to try VegeWay during the soft opening, and we knew we would be returning again after the first bite.  Here are the reasons why VegeWay is dangerous: (1.) I am a mere 2 minutes from this plant-based fast food joint (2.) the burger itself has several different textures which gives it a good mouth feel (3.) POPCORN CHICKEN AND MILKSHAKES (4.) three different types of fries and I honestly enjoy them all  Keep in mind that vegan fast food is not meant to be healthy, it is still fast food. But it would definitely be a healthier option in comparison to regular fast food. VegeWay allows anyone to have the fast food experience (greasy, fatty, salty, sweet, and you drive right through) without compromising plant based choices.   It's only been a few months and they will already be opening a second location which just goes to show that there's a market for vegan fast food. Thumbs up to Chef Kenny for making it happen right here in Vegas!

epL5oCST6TnORRuO0Ol_Sw.text: Horrible place, cruel, disgraceful!  Vegeway South were committed to participate in a national fundraiser for an animal rescue organization on Saturday November 4th, 2017, being promoted for a month long by the charity to almost a million followers. The day before the fundraiser they decide to not do it and told no one they were pulling out. They accepted all that free promotion and advertising for their establishment and never donated a dime.   Folks, this is not a vegan restaurant but simply a greedy business looking to make a quick buck off people who are compassionate and care for animals. An embarrassment to the word "vegan". I hope they go out of business.

8c3Ing3eYtjAmWOIT9qjSw.text: Definitely fulfills all of my cravings! I love their cheeseburger, Hawaiian burger, or their spicy chicken sandwich. Their curly fries are bomb too! I don't recommend eating there all the time just because you can tell its not good for you and its pretty greasy. For being vegan, they have really good stuff and the staff is super nice too! Highly recommend

y0-zrE7BCsGRZGS45bEqvA.text: Absolutely one of my favorite vegan fast food places, I go quite often because it's delicious! My favorite burger to get is the jalapeno spicy burger with curly fries. Also the strawberry milkshake is the best!!!

V84vqQqoJLFCoNDNNk4XGQ.text: Wow!! I'm blown away, Best vegan burger in town for sure. Can't wait to try everything on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oooo yes baby!! Look at that beauty! Cruelty free burger
Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We love Chef Kenny!
Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef Mindy approves! By Vegan Meals By Mindy !

CG0eSgKmu8WNc9EO5xm2-Q.text: Stopped by here for lunch, not realizing it was their grand opening weekend. There was a line, but they took orders quickly. We got their double vegan burgers with curly fries and a side of popcorn chicken. We waited a while for our food. We didn't realize our order was already ready because the girl putting together our orders did not call out the right number. The popcorn chicken looked better in the picture than it tasted, but their vegan burgers were good. The vegan patty is probably one of the best ones we have had in town, since most restaurants use the boca burger, which I hate. They sell their vegan burgers frozen, so we will plan on going back there to buy some and make our own burgers at home! I would like to go back there again to try the tacos, salad, and wrap. I gave them 4 stars because they were disorganized and understaffed, given that they should have ramped up for the grand opening. Also, it bothered me that the girl preparing the orders did not have her hair up.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double vegan burger

gToKuWXkDWL_dMuu6ppraA.text: We have been plant based for one year and I'm so surprised that we just found out about this place. We went today and I wanted to order one of everything off the menu but we ended up getting the double cheeseburger and vegan meat sandwich with curly fries and a chocolate milkshake. Oh. My. Goodness. Everything was so delicious. This totally hits the spot when you need fast food in your life! After we left and ran some errands I totally wanted to go back and drive through to get more burgers, fries and a shake. I can't even believe that I can actually say that! So excited for this place. Everything was so good and the wait wasn't long at all. We will definitely be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was our whole order and it was $24.
Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double cheeseburger

DC7E5inWmbtXMy5oSf1tDw.text: Bless whoever opened this place. I have been a pescatarian for nearly 2 months and i've been craving banh mi (vietnamese sandwich). Since i'm unable to eat meat, i haven't been going to my usual spot for banh mi. However, i found this wonderful place! I believe everything at their place is vegan/vegetarian! I got the beef sandwich and i cannot emphasize how tasty it was! It was actually better than a regular natural beef banh mi! All "meat" is soy! It was so good. I cannot wait to come back tomorrow to try their cheeseburger! So if you're new to the "no meat" life and you miss the meaty burgers and sandwiches, go here! It's not expensive, it's not healthy, & it's not meat, but if you want to eat something similar to In n Out or Banh Mi, go here! Plus their vegan sauces were rich in flavor!

0ekBbGM4E3zUvqYOIenKKA.text: A very enjoyable experience where the staff are smiling and the food is wonderful. We ordered two different types of meals with fries and the fried zucchini. I am not a huge fried food fan, but this really hit the spot for sure! The fried are freshly made also. Good on ya for having a vegan fast food restaurant.

fVJAnannQUDeuopLSLP21Q.text: Vegans/vegetarians who haven't been plant based long enough to still have an occasional hankering for In-N-Out, you just found your Shangri-La. The famous In-N-Out burger is expertly replicated into an animal/earth friendly delight at Vege Way. From what I remember about In-N-Out, this version actually tastes better (perhaps that's owing to the fact that it is cruelty free). Cheese was some of the closest plant based version of a good ol' slab of greasy American cheese that I've ever tasted.   Just a few critiques of the place: part of what tops off the In-N-Out experience was the fries. While tasty, the fries at Vege Way are not close to the original. It would be nice if the fries were replicated as well. Also, a vegan offering similar to In-N-Out's animal style dressing would be a welcome option. Additionally service was very slow and many orders seemed to be messed up, but I'm chocking that up to them having been open 2 days when I was there.  All in all, I will definitely be returning many times, I'm sure.

6a3QUNQrQePord9z7vKL4g.text: I ordered the zucchini fries with ranch, which were crispy and delicious! I wasn't a fan of the ranch dip, but the zucchini was tasty! My husband ordered a double-patty 'cheeseburger' and curly fries, which I stole a bite of, and was very flavorful with a good texture! I was told this place was like 'In N Out' only vegan, but I would say its more of just a fast-food style burger joint. The food came out quickly, the curly fries were crispy and flavorful, and everything was piping hot. I highly recommend trying their food!

BCwrlLfSjWh9Bc5kFMrX7g.text: My favorite place to grab a quick vegan burger, fries & a shake! Chef Kenny is amazing at everything he does!

Be-Bz8gYuiIP5Q5PF0yxDA.text: Never dined in but i love this place. The owner even spoke with me and he was very sweet

R8XLiVumKeGaXTg9LnZQxg.text: My family has been customers of this restaurant and chef Kenny's other restaurants for quite some time and while we have had several issues with our orders being made incorrectly. I have NEVER had a problem worth complaining over our experience today was the WORST dining experience I have had in years. We often have issues with our order here we typically over look it. Today we had an issue and when I called to tell them so that my order would be remade before I got back to the store the manager told me I LEFT the burger instead of I'm sorry we didn't put your order in your bag. Once I arrived she actually tried to give me back the cold food I returned instead of offering to remake all of it since I had to drive all the way back. So I suggested that they just give me my money back. She said that's not a good reason to give you your money back. In shock that she would even speak to me like that I explained that I just took 30 minutes of my time bringing the food back and I don't understand why they wouldn't just remake the entire order once now all of my food was cold. Instead she offers me just the burger that was missing. After saying she diners understand why I would want a "fucking" refund loudly in front of other customers and slamming the bag in the trash. She proceeds to actually complain and talk negatively about me as I stand there waiting for my food to be remade with my 12 year old standing there. Needless to say I won't be coming back but I will be contacting the owner of the this restaurant because another customer who witnessed this behavior actually left do to it.

wL7vrIsYjSHAzxBfdMSBZg.text: Obviously this review is overdue because being eating here since the day they open. They say that this  taste like in and out but I honestly tell you they are better and still fast food but healthier.  They are delicious my non vegan husband eat them like they are regulars burgers no complains and they begin adding new items to the menu now they have orange chicken OMG latterly taste like chicken definitely kills the craving of real chicken in the wraps are really good, the fish tacos too, the only thing I never taste are the shakes but I hear they're really good . So far I can assure you, you will find something to eat here.  it doesn't matter if you vegan or not don't be scare give it a try.

0Q_qzJuf-SZDFNV3TA-MTA.text: Yummmm very good!! I will definitely be back! I got the chicken jalapeno basil sandwich combo everything was fresh and delicious first time eating bacon fast food

9MmAnpDJt4Hqf1ueucrC3g.text: Being a vegan in Las Vegas, you know there is not a huge list of restaurants! Chef Kenny has come to the rescue with VegeWay and VeggieHouse!  I got the popcorn chicken with sweet potato fries and a chocolate milkshake and I give it a 5/5. The only reason I'm giving Vegehouse 4/5 stars is because my girlfriend got a cheeseburger and we're really not fans of the Daya American Cheese. It has a very sweet aftertaste. It would be amazing if VegeWay found an alternative cheese. Other than that, this place is so cute, has great food and kind service. It's fast food but doesn't have the grimy feel that Burger King and those places have.  Even if you're not vegan/vegetarian, check it out! I'm so happy vegan is spreading across Vegas!

TZktoSLLcOgkQ-K3t_eb6w.text: This place is so awesome and convenient! So nice to drive 10-15 min away and get a burger, shake and popcorn chick'n that's all vegan. Finally! I give this place 4/5 stars because they use Daiya cheeze for their burgers. I'm a True fan of Follow Your Heart, which tastes so amazing! Hopefully they switch because the Daiya overpowers the burger. I ordered the burger the following week w/o the cheeze and it was better.   My two absolute favorites are the strawberry shake (mmm) and the popcorn chick'n (mmm-mmm-mmm!). Come get yours!  P.S. Don't sleep on that Cajun ketchup though. The hit!

bkPB4GJHoG_R2P1cHjRm5w.text: I always want to try this place driving by... so today was the day I go the vege way... 1.  vege burger.. not too bad.. decent. cheese is good. can't tell at all. 2 . the zucchini fries- yummy crunchy 3.  cilantro salad- decent Total = $15 bucks  I'm from California so I have been to many veggie restaurants down there and its soo good. .. so this place is only A-OK. with the quality and price. Selection is minimal.  To go fully the vege way I say no way.  I'll stick with eating meat with my veggies. No carbs.

DAHoB5tnf9CKoEuSflc4VQ.text: I've been coming here forever! Today there was a miscommunication with my order and the staff handled the situation super professionally! Food is great and so is the service! I'd recommend Vegeway for anyone, vegan or not!

R4WZ5XSbEXaJxZ5phrXvQw.text: I got a double burger and curly fries. This was the best fast food style veggie burger I've had. Very delicious and satiating. A whole lot better than the burger at The Wynn.   Fries were fries. Chocolate shake was fine. It tasted kind of like a Wendy's frosty. Icy and not really creamy.   Free self-serve pickle slices.

Z-acKOAWxZ7HfrdiqAOGyg.text: Just visiting Las Vegas, Vege-Way was a welcome meal!  It was easy to get to, but looked like a new development so I hope they get enough business!! The meal was everything it should've been!  I had a banh mi sandwich (they called it vegan beef sandwich....but it was vegan banh mi!) with sweet potato fries and my hubby had a Hawaiian burger and fried zucchini (tempura style I think!).  All of it was delicious!  Simple food, tasty, vegan & I didn't have to make it!!  Sometimes you want fast food and not have to spend an hour describing how to modify it!   I will make this a regular stop when I'm in town.

cV0OptgsHOQBsJWxVtXdsQ.text: After reading through some of the reviews on here I was excited to try this restaurant. The cashier was extremely helpful. Even when she didn't know the answer to my questions about the ingredients she went out of her way to get the correct answer. Now, to the food...Le sigh...I ordered 2 Soy-free burgers on gluten-free buns, fries and a chocolate shake. Fries were good. Shake was blah. The burgers were flavored well but BURNT. Even the bun was burnt. There were these  long tough pieces of what appeared to be some type of stem throughout the burger. Highly disappointed is what I am. I doubt I will ever return to this restaurant. This was a complete waste of time and money.

t7AY2IQcsiU6ONpd08xwAw.text: Yuck the burgers taste like Asian food. He makes these homemade and they are not good. They didn't have ketchup when I visited, how odd. The drive thru worker looked like she was on drugs.

53QMLCah-JR_L8ZOpjh-9w.text: I find myself to be a patient and understanding individual, but time and time again, this place honestly disappoints with the service and I can't let it slide anymore. I love this place for the food and that's what keeps me coming back. There have been numerous times I've sat in the drive-thru for 20+ minutes, which isn't too bad because whatever, sometimes food just takes a while to make and I get it. But one occasion (a couple months back) one of the workers completely forgot I was there in the drive-thru despite having taken my payment. He comes back 20 min later and asks me what I'm waiting for with a confused look on his face. I was utterly dumbfounded because my payment was taken yet there was no food being prepared for me. So I had to wait another 10 min or so for them to finally catch up. I don't understand how you just forget about someone in the drive-thru. Another dumb experience here is that the one of the workers charged me for a fountain drink despite having purchased the meal combo, which surprise-surprise already includes a fountain drink. But the reason I'm writing this review is for my experience that happened just now. I ordered an entire 45 minutes beforehand for take-out. I get to the restaurant, all positive that nothing could go wrong because I did everything in advance. Once I walk up to the cashier, I tell her I'm here for a pick-up and she looks all confused, goes to the kitchen looking for what I ordered. Right then and there I knew they fucked up yet again. She tells me that they never received an order but I paid through a goddamn app. So you take my money but claim to not have gotten the order? Okay. Definitely not doing business here at this point. If you want good, accurate, and speedy service, I recommend Veggy Street on Fort Apache and their food is the real deal. This place is ridiculous and don't waste your TIME and money here.

javPegAzQgfhNh6TtSHwmw.text: We were in Vegas for my birthday and had to try this spot! The fact that they had a drive thru was a plus. The food was fresh, although we got there 5 mins until closing, and the lady at the window was nice. Literally tasted like a Big Mac ( from what I can remember). Not the healthiest option at all but who wants to eat healthy on vacation? 4 stars for having to pay extra for the special sauce but will definitely be back.

1rZ-h-Gdh5CA7ImXuQQUkg.text: I wanted to give 3.5 stars to this place. I got the burger and vegan fish taco. Burger was good, taco average. Overall, the food and flavors did not stand out, as if something was missing. I may return because of the price ($10 for lunch) and distance from my office, otherwise I would not go out of my way for this.

Q3D8YK0RXmN9eze8yYNxBA.text: My vegan friend was super stoked about this place opening and demanded we check it out asap. Overall, pretty impressed with the taste and quality of food, despite it being a fast food joint. We just ordered the burgers, but theres also tacos and other shinanigans on the menu. Fried zucchini is on point, highly recommend. Also, their vegan milkshakes are bomb, the strawberry one gives me life. I wish I ordered like 8 of them.

86HjczNSoqNHMhWkCVMJrw.text: Wonderful food! I especially like the chicken nuggets which are only spicy if you use the provided buffalo sauce. Other highlights were the orange chicken and zucchini tempura. The Hawaiian burger was great but I would rather get the beef sandwich any day. So tasty!

DsvLYo_v0UXnbPgLL_h6Lg.text: My husband and I come here once a week because we honestly miss eating In N Out burgers. While their burgers don't really taste exactly the same, they are insanely good. The ambiance is not my favorite, but then again it's just a fast food joint. You order, eat and then go about your day. I have yet to try the other menu items because I just love the burgers so much I haven't ventured out to anything else. The staff is friendly and there is never a wait to find a seat. You definitely don't have to sit in a long line at the drive thru like you do at In N Out. I highly recommend this place for vegans and meat eaters alike.

G0TkUnDT3ezdk9nhx1hFLA.text: Everything I had here was incredibly delicious. I would love to have a single "con" about the place or the food but I just don't.  I brought my friend who is a carnivore here, and he completely loved the food and I quote "If every vegan dish tasted like this, I don't think anybody would have a problem going vegan"   The food is extremely delicious. I long for the weekends when I can pig out on their goodness.   My favorite dishes to date:  1- Steak Sandwich (you may choose to get without jalapenos...it is a bit too hot,but delicious)  2- VegeWay Burger  - PHENOMENAL, blows anything you had labeled "veggie burger" out of the water, the texture and flavor is just right.  3- Orange Popcorn Chicken - Tastes just like the "real thing", I bring it home and eat it with rice to relive my Chinese food days.   God bless this place, and I hope people get to find out about it, since I stumbled across it by mistake online.

CtP2T8VZsftXeY-jwqtgag.text: Best vegan fast food I've ever had. The staff is always friendly and they always have good music playing. The portions are good sizes and very filling. I recommend the white chocolate peanut butter shake it's so good.

tAdTpfFIPqjtF-CjAsqvVA.text: Grabbed some burger and fries on our way out of town. Satisfied a craving for In and Out. Everybody enjoyed the burger - vegan, vegetarian and carnivore. The curly fries were fantastic! Wish they had one in Phoenix.

I LIKE to stick to what I like but I have tried the pop corn chicken and I am not a big fan. It's crispy but a little bland and I am not a big fan of the vegan ranch that comes with it. I have yet to try the other items but I love the veggie burger so much. It tastes so good and I can't emphasize that enough.

5x_jqopd-1L-QSbwfeZPfg.text: I have been a faithful fan of Chef Kenny amazing food for years. I would originally rate this spot 5/5 as this is what I call food that can turn a meat eater Vegan.   SADLY I noticed the lately the food here has changed. From crispy delicious orange chicken to dry and spongy flavourless blah. Something has changed dramatically from the cheese to the burgers.  Its not just a one time thing as well because I go here a lot.   Maybe change in recipe?  My ratings before what has changed:  Food 5/5 amazing! Customer Service 5/5 perfect!  Now sadly :(  Food 2/5 stomach ache  Customer Service 5/5 perfect!  Hopefully things will change.

Zgv3kj2vT3ddU1wrruMP0w.text: A terrific fast food experience. Since going vegan eight years ago, I haven't eaten fast food so this was a real treat. I got the burger with curly fries and a drink and it was so tasty. The burger was perfectly sloppy, the curly fries crispy and the fountain Diet Coke (something else I never consume) was refreshing. The menu is limited, but I didn't want anything but a burger and fries so no complaints from me. I will likely visit again before our trip is over.

t2Y9NfdDSXe9cnv4QRAcfg.text: Woo! Another vegan/vegetarian place that I really enjoy!  The first time I had this my coworker got it delivered & she ordered a "cheeseburger".  It exceeded my expectations of a vegan burger by so much!  So when she ordered again I decided to get the vegan beef sandwich, which is supposed to be similar to a banh mi.  When I took a bite I could not believe how delicious is was!  It had the texture of beef, the flavor was on point, & I felt good eating it!   My boyfriend was starting to get tired of eating vegan so I suggested this place & so we ordered dinner here and got the burger, beef sandwich, popcorn chicken, & orange chicken.  To his surprise he couldn't believe it was vegan either!    Obviously there's some slight difference to the taste compared to meat BUT this place has a really good alternative

7NExdh0dXsV0ISwrCWKbYQ.text: Food is way way too starchy and gave me stomach problems all day after I ate it.  Staff also seemed to be running around in a panic as my food took like 30 .  Near my table I also saw a couple roaches roaming around.  Good concept but poorly executed and poorly managed.

iB96ciF9sJC1xE5vdJDkNA.text: Craving burgers much? I do, but visits to Vegeway minimizes the guilt of diet high in cholesterol while satisfying that craving that is bovine friendly. Even that pair of bovines advocating "Eat Mor Chikin" 20 years ago would be happy about everything served at Vegeway.  So it has been a few months since my last visit to Vegeway, it was cold and slightly breezy (perfect weather for everything except passing the time watching all the hunnies show off what they've been training off-season for) and I dropped in after a Yelp gathering for their limited time holiday inspired milkshake: Peppermint Oreo.  To be honest, it was not what I envisioned but it tasted very good and didn't even last 10 minutes on the drive home.  Fast forward to the dreaded summer heat of early June, I am already not a fan and it is only in the 90s around 11am. I was running some errands, got a little lost driving around and decided to just grab something at Vegeway for brunch, since I was only a mile or two away.  As I was about to walk in, a customer was just coming out and said "they are not opened." I was not expecting that, and although I believed him I still opted to go inside and ask when they are going to be open. Which turned out to be 11am, instead of 10:30am that is posted on Yelp (I have since sent a business update request to YELP HQ), so I just waited the 15 minutes inside and enjoy their AC and check their menu for what I would order later.  I was going to get two Double Vegan Burgers, until I saw the new item being promoted: Hawaiian Cheese Burger. So I order one of each of these burgers, a Chocolate and Vanilla Vegan Milkshake and added Vegan Popcorn Chicken (so I can charge it to my CC, because it would be super embarrassing and a hassle not being able to pay the $2 and change I still owe in cash after using up $14 in Groupon credit.  The Chocolate and Vanilla Milkshake is an easy custom order for them to whip up, and it felt extra refreshing sipping it in the dry heat. Most people probably wouldn't even notice that it is vegan, but it is.  The Hawaiian Cheeseburger comes with a ring shaped pineapple from the can, which was good. But had that pineapple been fresh or just grill it to caramelized the natural sugar inside, it would have made that burger even better.  The Double Vegan Cheeseburger was pretty substantial. Eating it Zi noticed stuff sticking to the roof of my mouth more than when I am having a regular burger, but overall it is enjoyable and I was quickly getting full.  The Popcorn Chicken was decent. The batter reminds me of the ones coating the Sweet and Sour Pork at local Chinese takeouts, which is thicker than I 'd prefer, but not horrible. The dipping sauce that it was served with, I was not a fan of, so I ate most of it at home with the sweet chili sauce often served with Thai BBQ chicken. It was good eating it that way.  Overall, it is a good healthier alternative to just eating meat all the time, and my wait was nearly non-existent and the nice friendly service just made the entire getting-lost-and-that's-how-a-nice-guy-like-me-ended-up-at-a-place-like-this kind of day that much more pleasant. Or the Vegan deity in the sky pulled some cosmic strings and steered me in the door. Either way it was a charming experience and no chikin or cows were hurt to make my visit possible.  Vegeway - ,

4kTqIMqcQK04MIQmV3uFhw.text: It's so hard to like a vegan burger, but hey they tried. Taste wise it's not bad and it is the best thing on the menu, but still not a fan. In no way am I a vegan, but like to eat less red meat when I can.   If it's your first time, try the burger meal. Stay away from the vegan chicken nuggets. I've had it twice and it's bland and oily.   Their cilantro salad is tasty and is similar to the one I tried at Veggie House.   I love that they conveniently have a drive thru. Workers are always friendly too!

amjylvhPXldelFw2f6Jg-w.text: I had a hankering for a healthier/meatless day so I hopped on yelp and found this gem. I kinda knew what to expect from the high reviews and photos. I ordered the double vegan burger and opted for fried zucchini and a water instead of their regular combo. The sandwich was delicious! The patties were a little softer than other vegan burgers I've had but super tasty. The fried zucchini had a light tempura batter and were just as good. They came with a dill creamy sauce that reminded me of tzatziki or maybe it was actually called that. They also had their version of Big Mac sauce. Man those sauces just threw my meal over the top. Prices were good and I couldn't even finish. I was so stuffed that I took leftovers to work and finished them a little later cuz I couldn't stay away. Highly recommend and will be back.

DRJCaBYOhKOaZtf9fF2Hgw.text: I really want to support vegan restaurant as a vegan myself but, this is like 3rd time they couldn't hear me from drive thru speaker (actually last time it was broken like about a year ago) i forgot all about it and came back and probably won't for a long time again) I suggest they either have combo numbers so I can just yell out the number or get a better quality speaker or hire person that is not deaf maybe

-9kyYibr9VB63Ymtdc-n4w.text: I finally got to check this place out while I was running in errand near by. It's adorable little spot with not much else around it. Everything on their menu is vegetarian friendly and they have a handful of options like burgers, fries or a banh mi sandwich. Think of it almost like McDonald's but without the meat.  This most recent visit I had the cheeseburger with curly fries. I really enjoyed the burger after adding a bit of ketchup and must say it's the closest thing I've had to that real burger taste since going pescatarian. I really enjoyed the curly fries too, they tasted just like Arby's. It is definitely greasy food though so don't think of it as being healthy by any means.   Overall I'd come back again if I was ever in the area. A+ for being vegetarian friendly and having a drive thru. I only wish there was a location closer to my side of town.

7jj956vkeZavB6nvSvMkYQ.text: What more can any vegan ask for than a vegan fast food joint with a drive through?  Admittedly, it is not clean eating, and for me is only a rare exception to eating out.  But, hey, when you're in Vegas most of the rules go out the window, right?  They have gluten free options and your standard fare: burgers, fries, chickn', and even a salad.  The worker told us they were updating their menu soon to add more things, so look out for that.  It's a fast food place, and the workers are pretty standard fast food workers, so don't expect exceptional service and you won't be disappointed.

iYd7TKyGGR7sEvw_fH3Jzg.text: I am a Vegan and I just had a double burger, fries and a shake at VegeWay in Las Vegas. I feel like I was just at an "in and out" only healthy and vegan.  The food is fresh and delicious.  Their fries are hot and crispy, the succulent double burger is just the right kind of messy and the shakes are sweet and creamy. Its fast food for us vegans!  Finally, i can go to a drive through burger stand like VegeWay and get a bag of burgers to go like everyone else, and not have to compromise my vegan diet.  If you are vegan or not and just want to eat healthy, VegeWay is well worth a visit. Why are you still reading this review? Get there now and get your burger! I am going back soon and so should you!!! Free parking in lot. Double highly recommend.

w6PtAcKaxB2dVFUlbVUjxQ.text: WOWWWW!! Third time I drive 30 minutes and they have NO CHOCOLATE  for the milk shakes!! This is very disappointing bc I'm not the only one complaint about this! And how do you have non organic Ketchup???!! What a shame to see you use don't care that the ketchup has high fructose corn syrup.... Won't be coming here again!
