I also had a bite of the hawaiian burger, which was good. I was full from this place for likr 4-5  hours after. it isnt the worst but not the best but worth a try if you are curious about eating vegan/vegetarian fast food in Vegas.

dJ8z8hVYZwiMIrRsDUoLSQ.text: It was my first time trying this place after eyes it for months. I went through the drive thru and order the cheese burger combo. The food was freshly cooked to order and not greasy. I'll be back to visit !

hMcirvbJ_o1eD1fN8u7hpQ.text: I actually went to the centennial hills location but ur was the best thing of my entire life !!! 100% love the food & staff & fact that everything here is vegan!!!   truly the bets place I have ever been to, I could go back every single day of my life

7gL3VBoTJQhU1A9DjkTG7A.text: I've been here 3 times and I think I am done with this place now. I love that there is a vegan drive tru in town and that's why I am giving this place 3 stars but the food is not great at all. Everything is so greasy and the cheese they use on the burgers tastes super weird. The burger patties need more work, also. Kind of mushy and not great. I've tried the "popcorn chicken" before and it's pretty much just soaked up in oil thick breading with a tiny peace of soy meat inside. I hope they improve in future so we can go again.

qNnQr3H40cCUvarK-cP1Yg.text: Ehhh, it was OK. Went here with a friend to try it out. It wasn't bad by any means, but just don't know if it was good enough for me to go back. The air conditioning was blasting so made it not too comfortable to sit inside. Food ok, overall experience, blah.

WDBHneHacFTw4yPDR8dPZg.text: I so badly want to love this place, two stars because it is vegan and in a pinch I will return again I'm sure. Second trip here... On the first trip shortly after they very first opened I explain to them that I needed something without soy several employees assured me what I ordered was soy free... Long story short it was not! Second visit here... No cars in front of me and the wait for a burger, fries and milk shake was so long my poor toddler literally Peed his pants in the car. After giving my food and making it clear that I was ready to go on my way I asked what about the milkshake? The kid at the drive-through with absolutely no personality or people skills said oh they're still making it close the window and took his sweet time walking over to what I could clearly see was him in fact making the milkshake. (This was after stopping and chatting for a bit with another employee). Several minutes later....Which even after over 10 minutes of waiting on my food hadn't even been started yet but "they were making it ". Hey I think I'll try the other location... This place needs to seriously step up who it hires! If you want to appeal to vegans, that means people who care about the planet. People. Animals. And what's in their food...please HIRE BETTER STAFF!

FVniZNXD9EQBOXo4IBB_Rw.text: Vege Way is the bomb! It's the vegan In-N-Out. Amazing burgers - you won't believe they're vegan!   Check out Chef Kenny's other restaurant too... Veggie House on Spring Mtn Blvd!

W9VFeCffUIB5ZBl5etyBiw.text: Wow! How nostalgic it was to go through a drive through and get the vegan equivalent of junk food I have had when I was a kid. The burgers were so tasty and fresh. I wish I had order a milkshake to see what it tasted like. I'm sure I'll be stopping by soon to try it next time. The prices are also very reasonable for vegan food. The staff were also very friendly. The only drawback to the drive through was that it's not very quick since everything is made fresh which is better than having something sitting for a while. I really enjoyed this place and can't wait to visit again.

cly4_BcUtAt-TBPV9mHL7Q.text: Drove by and saw this place and felt hungry all of a sudden. Very good choice. Small menu but well executed. Good food. I'll try to come back before I move out of state.

1hR58Vs4NuMgNrahZwEEbw.text: Curly Fries and double cheese burger was delicious! Regular fries were ok but curly are wayyyy better !! Oh and there sauce was delicious I put that all over the burger and dipped my fries in

nZ6Z2L4HCIURifmTQutOaw.text: I love you Chef Kenny.....but sorry.  FrankenFood thats what hubby calls it.  I have tried and tried to like this food but its seriously one star for me. Thinking about it even gives me a "film" coating in my mouth.   The third time I came here (today) I got the chkn wrap and seriously it weighted ten pounds. I was scared to even try it. Full of Veggie House brown rice, gooey chkn, tons of sundried tomatoes, wilty lettuce....just not good.  The burger patty is ok, but todays was dry like a hockey puck. The first time I tried one it had a melted plastic taste because of the Daiya, two more times I minus the cheese and onion and realize it just does not taste like a burger, why? no pickles. This place does not believe in pickles.  The fysh taco is good but wow its soggy and just a mess.   The first time I tried, it had a great taste, guess I was super hungry.  Chkn bites are super gross and doughy and the "ranch" tastes like oily old dill.  Milkshakes are bomb but hey the ice cream is from Perfect Scoop.   I did order curly fries and they taste exactly like the ones from Arby's I ate 20 years ago. Not a reason to come back.    Just not a fan. Centennial same experience.  And consistency is a huge issue here and at the other location!

fB1Ue8VuE9vo3jX89SotrQ.text: Vegeway is perfect. It's perfect in the same way I used to think Wendy's or McDonald's was perfect - salty, savory, fast, convenient. It's not gourmet, it's not fancy, but it's perfect.   I came by here after hiking at Red Rock Canyon with my dog. It's hard enough finding dog-friendly restaurants, let alone vegan dog-friendly restaurants, and I was so hungry. To have a drive-thru option at a vegan fast food restaurant was all I could dream of and more!  I opted for the burger meal, with curly fries and a chocolate shake. The fries were some of the best I've ever had. The burger patty seemed to be made out of beans and rice, but it was still toothsome and meaty. With all of the accoutrements, it was a damn fine burger. The chocolate shake was a little icy, but still perfectly reminiscent of the fast food shakes I had growing up. Not fancy, not high quality, but still just what you want. I actually appreciated that it wasn't too rich, so I could fully enjoy my feast.   I want so badly for Veggie Grill to open up some drive-thru locations in LA, I think it'd be a game changer. Vegeway is proof that it can work and it can be awesome.

uyUovlqlveh2hj3kW6CuHQ.text: Pretty good. I got the soy cheese burger combo with curly fries. Everything tasted pretty good and reasonably priced.

U8SYULDf8o8EHU5a0B0n8Q.text: Yummy yummy. Quick and friendly fast food. Not as fast as usual fast food but worth the wait if a few minutes. Delish vegan milkshakes too!

VAyD_t6Qe0O8wLv8Xd6q6w.text: My second favorite vegan burger place.  Vege-Way succeeds in being close to in and out burger. We brought our very skeptical non vegan friends who come here on their own. Chef Kenny bravo.

S4jNKgxCLtyMbgjn8T28Wg.text: Dude! We're did this sorcery come from? As a non-vegan who up to eat whatever. This was the bomb.com!! I mean I don't know what else to say. I guess just to say get there. Go. Go fast. Run.

GpN13CQpOlkEe0mWzjxhpg.text: We never get take-out....ever! However my meat-loving husband wanted to try this place.. my hero   Pros: 1) Simple menu but a lot of different options  2) Overall the food was delicious...      - the burgers had a little smoky taste to them :)      - the fried zuchini breading wasn't too heavy or greasy...not too much flavor though.      - curly fries were fantastic! 3) Food was made quickly but not too fast! Everything tasted very fresh.  4) Price was on point. For 2 burgers, fried zuchini and curly fries it was $17.04. Definitely more than enough food for the two of us.   Cons: 1) An ingrediant list for their patties would be nice...just to know they arent completely processed.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WxyfogHqDqVDiJ1POiWxrA.text: We were visiting from North Carolina where we unfortunately do not have many vegan spots and VegeWay was fantastic. The burgers were everything we hoped for, milkshake was great (though they were out of chocolate so it was subbed for vanilla), and the popcorn chicken with ranch was so addicting. So disappointed we were only able to eat here once on our trip but we certainly look forward to being back!

EgKr3zTuzr0IEFy9wcZNWA.text: COOOOOL. Plant-based fast food! WE'RE TOTES IN THE FUTURE YAWL  Ordered the bahn mi (beef sandwich) and sweet potato fries. So happy to finally have bahn mi!! Since I gave up eating meat nearly 3 yrs ago, I've been opting for veggie bahn mi. This beef-like substitute is a blessing to my life.  Bahn mi: served in a hotdog-like white bun that broke apart as I picked it up. Wish they served authentic Vietnamese style like a baguette (PUH-LEEEEASE with a cherry on top honor this suggestion). Other than that, taste mirrored that of an actual bahn mi. Almost creepy and too-good-to-be True.  Sweet potato fries: clean!!! What I mean by this is NOT oily and NOT salty. Seriously, my fingers were spotless after eating them.  I can see myself becoming a regular here as I love veggie restaurants and eating clean. If you are someone who is accustomed to a lot of sodium and oil to flavor your food, you will not enjoy this restaurant. Anyone looking for a cheat meal with cheap prices and whole, nourishing ingredients will love VegeWay.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bahn mi (beef sandwich) and sweet potatoes fries. Very good!

y_JaKBXsTgcDTNwhxFARMw.text: Fried zucchini and the Hawaiian burger are my absolute favorite. I love the ranch here too. I've been to a few vegan spots in town that served burgers and no one can't  top VegeWay. If your looking for good clean vegan food, come check them out!

CozQ9Kt3aDMsarr0aWCwzw.text: I came here on a Wednesday night with a couple of my friends to check this place out. I was very excited about my first visit since one of my vegan friends has been talking about it for months.  The menu is pretty small which was expected since there aren't that many options for vegans to begin with.  I ended up ordering a double burger (2/5) with monster fries (5/5). The price was fair ($11.34 for both items). The fries were absolutely delicious. They have a sauce that's similar to 1000 island dressing that took the cake for this one. The burger was just okay. The bun had no taste to it.  We also had a side of ranch dressing which was plain and watery.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uPuOZEMv0PxmPOtG2coBnQ.text: Yes it is vegan... So let's get that out of the way....:)  Service was OK... The staff were extremely friendly which would've been a 5 but the speed of the food coming out was a little on the slow side. So yes it is like fast food in the way that your order but the food definitely did not come out fast so minus 1 star. And for the timing as well... My burger came out first and it sat there for a few minutes while everything else on my order was getting fried. Timing was off since everything was hot but my burger was a tad bit cold. :( (3/5)  Ambiance was OK... It was small and the decor changed little from when this was another sandwich shop.... But it was clean just not very welcoming imho... And it was a tad bit cold in there. But the most important thing was that it was clean and that they had a person cleaning and changing out the trash can...4/5  Food was decent. I think veggie house is definitely 5 star... Vege Way not so much. I got their burger and it was decent. But the "meat" was not the best... It was a tad bit on the mushy side but the flavor was very good. Very earthy.... But I wished that they had put more of a sear on it so that it would've had a better texture. (2.5/5)  Curly fries were curly fries (5/5). Fried zucchini was decent. BUT the batter never stuck to the zucchini and it just fell off. It was cool that it was more of a tempura batter then breading but the oil was too cold because it was very very very greasy!!! Flavor was good but it was drenched in oil (2.5/5). The popcorn chicken on the other hand was fantastic! (5/5) perfectly crunchy and not too greasy either. And just like the zucchini this was more a tempura style batter... The texture of the chicken was perfect as was the batter. Very crunchy.  The ranch was also delicious for being vegan. It didn't taste like ranch to me but it had a great flavor. And I enjoyed dipping the popcorn chicken and the fried zucchini in it. (5/5)  Am I vegan...No. was this place as amazing as veggie house on spring mountain ... Sadly no... But was it decent? Yes it was. Will I be back. Most likely. The chicken was good and I really liked the batter. There are also other items on the menu that I would like to try.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Popcorn &#34;chicken&#34;...5/5... Tasted and looked liked chicken... Flavor was great and the texture was even better!
Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried zucchini..3/5... Decent flavor but very very greasy
Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double cheeseburger with extra lettuce...3/5.. Meat was kind mushy... No texture but flavor was pretty good.

Such a relief to have this convenience when I'm on this side of town   Buttttt honestly, I just wish they invested more effort in the quality of their menu items. Pretty slow on a wednesday around 6pm. I enjoyed the Spanish rock punkish music while eating my burger and fries. If youre not a fan of pineapple dont get the Hawaiian burger. The caramelised onions and pineapple together wasn't so sweet but enough juice to really savor this burger. The mango shake was lighter than expected and refreshing. I also enjoyed the sauce that came in the squeeze bottle to go with my curly fries. If you dont have time to sit inside they do have a drive thru which is a plus for a vegan restaurant.

khCZEybQz5ShQPGgcmr9Pw.text: It was okay. Ordered burgers. Only tomato, patty, onion, and either cheese? Or sauce? Hard to say. Anyway, service was fast. Took our order on a notebook. Burgers smashed to the bottom. They look nothing like photos. And also had sweet potato fries. Good but the darker ones tasted very bad. I just wish they let me know that the burgers were somewhat spicy, certain bites of it. Maybe the seasoning? Although I didn't mind, my 5 yo son threw up. He was unable to eat it. Had I known I would've ordered something else for him. I felt it was a bit pricey for what we received. Taste was...okay.

ZaGBtoJssArIR6yKRlFWfA.text: When I first saw someone review this place as a "vegan in n out" I was too excited. So here's the pro: inexpensive. Vegan food is usually pretty costly but this place, you can get out for $10. Cons: we tried the infamous burger...honestly, not the best veggie burger I've had. It didn't have any texture, it mostly tasted like beans and fell apart. The cheese, not great. It had that sticky texture that some vegan cheese has in your mouth. I was not a fan. The fries were good. I thought I'd try the milkshake that everyone raved about. It tasted like a combination of ice and those protein vanilla workout shakes you get. I don't think I'll be coming back for round 2.

6CdUmjc8QKuwW7rYZucBrA.text: Where do I start? I been. Vegan for about a month. I really thought I gave up all delicious food that I once knew to become vegan. One of my close friends told me about this place that had open. I was just able to try it today in oh my god so delicious for vegan fast food. I had a single burger I also had the popcorn chicken fried zucchini curly fries and regular fries LOL. I really wanted to try everything! All satisfied my taste buds. The burger was delicious the cheese on the burger actually was very tasty it tasted pretty close to the in and out burger. Fries were crisp and tender inside. Fried zucchini the tempura they put on it I don't know how they do but it was incredible. Popcorn chicken delicious nice texture and flavor and the sauce was amazing. My friend had a salad it looked incredible I took a picture. I did not taste it so all I know is she said she loved it. If you just became vegan or a long time vegan I would imagine this place satisfies the need for fast food. The only request and I only dream is that they build one in the north part of town so it is closer to me. Thank you Chef Kenny for creating this beautiful establishment!

XNL1BJnSqAKCGkG-NL_Nng.text: so much yes for all vegan fast food place. Service was fast, food was good, totally will come back and recommend this place to anyone!

x-lWa6sOmvr_OP1sZnvC6g.text: I got the vegan burger/burger only and it was literally the most melt-in-your-mouth, flavorful sandwich I've ever tasted. Definitely will be coming back here regularly and bringing friends. Food was fast (drive-thru), service was friendly and good prices. Good job VegeWay! Absolutely delicious.

j-EgAsKxs3-ZTm-dpEYaJg.text: This is amazing. Talk about Vegetarinism and Vegan Veganism really coming around!!! Love their burgers, curly fries and popcorn chicken. YketyrJPOsM1hg810HBqgA.text: When this place first opened it was the BEST. The idea of vegan fast food was new and amazing and you could tell the owner really cared about serving tasty vegan food. The burgers were juicy and the fries were crunchy. Now the fries taste like McDonald's fries and the patties are hard like a rock most times. They charge 25 cents for a tiny dipping sauce that they don't even fill to the top (they didn't used to charge) but I guess they've gotten greedy and changed the ingredients to the cheapest possible and absolutely must charge per sauce. What I'm saying is this placed USED to be the shit when the owner didn't care more for profit than quality. You want good vegan food? Go to violettes vegan on Durango and desert inn. Get their tempeh bacon burger and fries or anything else on the menu. if you're new to vegan food or trying to open the mind of a carnivore to a vegan diet.... do NOT GO HERE it will scare you away and I promise not all vegan tastes this shitty. much love.

zLHN_9A5msjPnuueBNhKlw.text: Amazing food and products and super fast!! The 'chicken nuggets' were a bit boring with no flavor but the burger and chicken wrap were amazing! And decent prices as well! definitely going back :)

I wish there was more flavor or sauce to make the food less bland.  I like that it is a vegan drive thru and fairly affordable compared to most vegan restaurants.

CPLasFg792RZtpUsaRWi_A.text: Dang, this place is really lacking.  My boyfriend and I ordered a cheese burger each and shared curly fries after hearing they weren't currently doing their monster fries. And it was just not good. It wasn't even that the patty wasn't convincing (which it wasn't), it just overall wasn't good in terms of taste, texture, and appeal. Even their curly fries didn't match up to similar fast food chains that their trying to emulate, and neither their sauces. The house made ketchup, v-mac sauce, and chipotle were weak or tasteless. Everything I tried here was just undoubtedly inferior to their non-vegan counterparts.   I just think this place is trying too hard to be something it's not. I know that's the concept, but the only way I can imagine someone enjoying the food here are vegans who've completely forgotten the taste and texture of meat, cheese, and butter. And it's not because this place is vegan, because this is coming from someone who hasn't eaten meat in almost 3 years and enjoys vegan food. It's just because its just not good in terms of food in general. Plus one star for the friendly service, minus three for one of the worst veggie burgers and, flat out, worst meals I've had in a while. This place doesn't do vegan food justice.

bU_6huq5c4v3wo8cu0Oomw.text: So Vege-way opened just after I turned full on veganesque.  I'm not hardcore vegan, but it has been neigh unto 2 years I have been meat free.  At that time this place was wicked good.  And, it became my go to "fast food" place to hit when I felt like a burger and not cooking.  So I've eaten Vege-Way no less than 20 times.  Recently, not sure if the recipe changed, but the "burger" is different.   Here's a few more observations over the 20 times I've visited.  First, I pretty much always hit the drive through and my conversations with the person over the speaker system go like this, I kid you not:  hey what can we get for you?  I'll have 2 cheeseburgers 1 order of French fries and 1 order of curly fries. Ok so do you want sauce with your chicken bites and zucchini? Um no. 2 cheeseburgers 1 order of fries and 1 curly fries.  Ok so I have a wrap, a double burger, you want cheese? And 2 fries.  Um no, I want 2 cheeseburgers 1 French fry and 1 curly fry.  Oh sorry do you want cheese?  On my cheeseburgers?  Yes I want cheese on my cheeseburgers, please.  Ok so I have 2 burgers with cheese and 2 fries.  Hmmm no. 2 cheeseburgers and 1 fry and 1 curly fry.  Oh ok got it.  Frustrating to say the least.  Second, when I first started going here the fries were great! And you got a decent portion for the $2.75 they cost. The last 4 times, the fries have been different cuts, different styles and different quantities. I got home and found I only had 20 fries in my order, yes I counted and I didn't eat them on the way home.  Third I've never seen the same person working there, ever.  And the drive through conversation is virtually the same each visit and the quantity and quality is different as well.  Hmmm.  Because of the fry issue I actually stopped ordering fries here and will stop somewhere else for fries which, takes all the air out of the sails of "fast convenient" food, when you have to hit 2 places.  Also makes me have to choose which item I wanna eat cold.  Another gripe, is cost.  Eating out is a luxury, but when you're eating fast food and never leave a place for under $20 for two and have to hit a second place to get sides and have to go through the painful drive through, you gotta ask, how convenient is it and why am I still gong and why am I spending the same for a burger and fries as say a nice sit down place with linen napkins?   Well I do love the place and love the concept even though I have to work to eat here.    Vege-Way compares itself to In-N-out. By design- In-N-Out  for vegans!  Here's what the difference is and what In-N-Out does right that Vege-Way does not.   In-N-Out limited menu and secret menu. They limit what they produce so it's consistent and good every time, and the secret menu is genius.  Maybe there's a secret Vege-Way menu and why the drive through person never understands what I order.  In-N-Out is fast and convenient locations all over and you don't have to hit a second place unless someone in your crew wants chicken or something. The fries are always the same, always. And they are over flowing from the paper tub and I've never gotten cold ones, not ever in like 20 years of going there.  It is also cheap.  I mean the price has been virtually the same for that 20 years.  For less than $10 you can walk out full.  Vege-Way is no In-N-Out replacement, it is good if not inconsistent, and I love that I can get vegan eats on the go but some of the issues need to be ironed out.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The first double cheeseburger I got here!  It was awesome!

Ey-uS7AlK-PmNTOU4BN7Jw.text: Food is good but the service is awful. Not sure if they're high while working but they constantly get my order wrong and they take forever to make the food. If they hired better people I would go back.

7h8hF_fnXzBrl2pxqgFxlg.text: Plant based options with the joy of fast food options combined and vwala! Vege-Way! The food is prepared fast and it is easy to access.

J0f5TI2t7Z8zl35GjRgm6w.text: Medium food, medium environment, medium enthusiasm. Wouldn't pick it for lunch again but if someone was like "let's go there!!!" I'd be like "uhmm ok". Its like fast food for vegans with all the charm of your average jack n the box (except much less food variations).

NMXvmFob2V7Zt28T_IBqew.text: I think it's unfair that vegan places always have 4-5 stars just because they are vegan. Vege way is definitely one of those places. Imagine going to a McDonalds drive thru dealing with the rude workers as they take your order and then on top of that waiting 20 minutes longer than you would in the McDonald's line for a burger that is sometimes 10/10 and occasionally 6/10 and chewy on the edges.  Chef Kenny's restaurants are all some of my favorite but it does not translate well to Vegeway. The food is phenomenal, and when the service is friendly it's a great time, unfortunately with Vegeway it's very rare that things align for a 5 star experience.

Ag_7iQxeFf4il81uWazflw.text: I really like Chef Kenny's take on vegan fast food. The Vietnamese sandwich was delicious and the burgers were way better than expected. vKqRz245I2gYKkUKUw7wSg.text: Ordered burger meal thru uber eats. The patty was bland and tasted like cabbage. The sauce is way too sweet and was glopped on. The buns were soggy. Only decent thing was the curly fries.

rbYyu5OjfZx0pd1U5Ly_0w.text: It was okay for fast food. I tried the Hawaiian burger with soy free burger popcorn chicken monster fries and curly fries. It kinda reminded me of fat burger. The burgers were sloppy and greasy if you like sloppy and greasy. The best we're the monster fries. The buns were soft I guess we all like our own ways of food. The pop corn chicken was good to for being vegan!

olsL0pnspMrGjjpRVWf6rA.text: Veggie House is my go-to vegan restaurant in Las Vegas, so I was ecstatic when I found out Chef Kenny was opening up a plant based drive-thru burger place. A vegan food drive-thru spot? Twenty something years I've been waiting for this moment. I got off work early and knew today was the day. The whole way over I was giddy with anticipation, I couldn't get there fast enough.        The hardest part of hitting up a new spot is what to order. What if what you order sucks?Do you come back again in hopes the next thing you order won't? So I always get like three things(which is always way to much food) but my feeling is it's worth it to go a little nuts the first go because if all three things suck, chances are, I'm not coming back. I went through the drive thru which could have been a little faster, but it's quality food so it was worth it, and the employees were super friendly.  My order: Single Veggie Burger: I really wanted to love this, but I'm not a fan of daiya cheese(the whole boogery/gritty consistency, lack of flavor/pungent tapioca flavor isn't my thing). The patty itself was delicious though, so next time ill opt for it w/o cheese. Now for the good part...the Vegan Beef Sandwich. This is up there with one of the best sandwiches I have ever consumed. A delicious buttered bun (caramelized just on the edges so the bun still hold the chewiness without overdoing it), amazing veggie Beef, shredded carrot/daikon, jalapeno, Mayo and cilantro. I can't say enough good things about it. For years any time I would get a Vietnamese sandwich I'd order it w/ tofu, but the flavor and texture was never there. The Veggie Beef in this things is incredible. The texture and marinade are spot on. It's like the sandwich I've always dreamed about. My only complaint, next time I need to bring my bottle of hoisin sauce. Soo good on Vietnamese sandwiches.      Fried zucchini was delicious. Not too greasy and the ranch was good.      Vegeway is definitely going to be seeing more of me. Next time I want to try the veggie chicken wrap, milkshakes, tacos, etc,etc, etc. Eventually I'll make it through the whole menu. Thank you Chef Kenny for bringing such delicious food to Las Vegas, and especially one with a drive thru, for those nights when I'm craving that sandwich and don't feel like getting all dolled up.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan beef sandwich. Up there with one of the best sandwiches I&#39;ve ever had in my life.

eJCCf-r5_N38WUCT05Oyaw.text: Disappointed. First off it's SO COLD inside. Hard to enjoy your food when trying to keep warm.  Their options are greet, zucchini fries, orange chin-n, hawaiian burger.. But the shake was so gross!  It tasted like finely crushed ice and almond milk, not thick like other vegan shakes I've been had at fast food places.  The burger was okay, the fries okay.  The bathroom smelled like rotting fish or sewer.  Sooo gross.  I'm thankful we have a fast food Vegan option but they need to step it up in my opinion. Just because they're the only ones doesn't mean it's ok to slack.

WIIaklpsuVD4yZoD2vLvVA.text: Their "fish" tacos are ahhhmazing! Love their greek cilantro salad also. Try their "chicken" wrap with chipotle sauce, its heavenly! photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZV30ir1OsRRTpoIQuwQD2Q.text: Amazing fast food option for a plant based diet. The drive thru line took a little long, but it was worth the wait! The gentleman helping me at the drive thru window was so friendly and helpful! I'll definitely be back when I'm craving a burger and fries.

PFeZ-REnRe3w9rX40Dq7Ig.text: The absolute WORST vegan resturant in Las Vegas. Staff is oblivious to what customer service is. Purchased a chicken wrap and it was obvious the cook was different. Requested a refund and the manager said she couldn't so I requested my matter be escalated to her supervisor. A phone conversation took place between the two and the conclusion was the same. What pissed me off was the young girl in the drive thru who talked shit about me to the manager; I allowed her a pass considering she was just a child to me. Luckily the manager came back and apologized, offered to recook my chicken wrap and add additional seasonings however I was concerned it would include a "special sauce". Kudos to the manager Ness who tried to salvage my experience (I bet she's the only reason this place is still in business) however I will NOT be visiting this resturant again and I'll be sure to tell all my vegan friends about this experience. Customer service is hideous and Kenny (the owner) should invest into some customer recovery training for his younger staff members. And to the young lady in the drive thru....... adjust your attitude because it's just as bad as the 1st chicken wrap.

OqSrvlYeEPfao_TOetl6DQ.text: My fiance and I recently moved into this part of town and I was dying to try VegWay. Their menu is an interesting selection of in-n-out type burgers, as well as orange chicken, curly fries and salads. I got the single burger with monster fries and my fiance got a double burger with curly fries. My burger was good but my fiance and I both decided that the patty was very plain. It didn't taste seasoned or anything, but that's not to say it was bad. The monster fries were definitely too much for me. The vegan cheese didn't really melt and I could see the oil residue sitting at the bottom of the container. I stopped about halfway through because the fries were just drenched in oil.  We will be back just because it is close and I want to give them another shot on their other items. I know they've only been open for a year but they have potential! I wish I could give them a 3.5, but unfortunately Yelp doesn't let me.

tfTiSyViD7JMbLY4z-DQmw.text: The place itself felt like a cheap, greasy fast food joint. Not something you would expect from a Vegan place. The cheeseburger left a really disgusting taste in my mouth. It was over cooked. If you want battered zucchini soaked in oil-they've got it! I don't be returning.

LHdXeGcw-HV9Hgpetg7VPg.text: Been here twice and the food was delicious! First time was inside the second was drive-thru! I always get a vegan burger, curly fires and a chocolate shake. Perfect for everyone, even meat-eaters! Good till the last bite!

iEwos14iDjnzSZ118wGD9w.text: Awesome food. Got the double burger with jalapenos and an order of monster fries. Sauces were excellent. Shared some with a few coworkers who are not vegans and they asked me to bring a burger for them next time I go. Best place in town to take care of your fast food cravings. Going back this weekend.

pJ7te52HS2FnhOy0ltEMLA.text: I hate to give this place such few stars but this experience left me confused and disappointed.   For starters I went to the drive through, with one car ordering ahead of me and another waiting at the window for their order.  I ordered the burger meal with curly fries and a vanilla milkshake and the total was $12.88.  It took 6 minutes from the time I drove up to the window to place the order over the speaker.   The girl in the car behind me got out and asked me if this was normal waiting time for this restaurant, I'd never been here before and drove a long way to try it out based on reviews.   She then went to the car in front of me which was at the window and asked the same, only to calculate the first car had been waiting 20 minutes from the time of their order. The people at the window were acting as if it wasn't a long wait or that there was a problem. By the time I got my order in hand, it was a total of 22 minutes, if you include my wait time to order, 28, so that's not fast food drive through. There were plenty of people working inside.  The girl who took my money took 3 minutes to count out my change . The whole thing was frustrating.   As for the food, the burger was not hot, the cheese needs to be revisited, I like vegan food, this just didn't work well, it was a dry burger. The curly fries were semi warm and tasted fishy. The milkshake was great.  Chalking it up to a bad day, but customer service was substandard and the food wasn't up to par. Also the building looked dark and uninviting.  Hoping this helps the business

wjlH7u4wuHjZY88kJNWTow.text: PROS... Hallelujah for a vegan drive thru in Vegas.  Friendly staff but didn't get all the sauces we requested.  The popcorn chicken's texture is good (don't expect it to taste a lot like chicken...as with the burger & any vegan substitute.)  The breading on it is a great texture, like tempura but not quite as light.    The meat sandwich is pretty good, especially the yummy fixins and sauce.  NOT actual cons but not pros... Chocolate shake is barely sweet and pretty watery but has a pretty good flavor.  More sweetness would bring out the chocolate flavor more.    The zucchini breading is tempura like, a wonderful texture, but like the chicken & burger, the ranch dressing, & much of the food here, it falls under the unfortunate and unnecessary vegan stereotype of bland or not enough flavor. There are many who make vegan taste good, this place, not so much.

BNA-TlN4iEbJ2_1tCVuzwg.text: So I love the food here and love hitting up the drive thru when I'm in the area.  Today though we dined in and the dining area was filthy. When they first opened it wasn't this way. Today the floor was sticky and ketchup splats were on the cabinets where you get the condiments, dust on wall ledge and wobbly tables. Garbage cans were gross too. Hat happened???

XlAQ0mvX5VG5tb3VlDzoRg.text: I'm not vegan, but I really did enjoy it ! It was really good! I ordered a burger and sweet potato fries and although it was pricey it was really good! I thought I was eating an actual burger! A lot of people come here and I can see why.

I would've been better off going to A regular fast food place and altering it like I usually do. BUT I'm sure a lot of X Meat eaters like this place.

I heard about it through a friend and hadn't looked at the website prior to going.   It truly is a vegan version of In-n-out or Smashburger and I will definitely be a regular here. I hope it becomes so popular that he opens a Henderson location.   I had the burger & curly fries. My daughter had the popcorn chicken and sweet potato fries. Everything, including the ranch that came with the popcorn chicken, was so yummy.   Thanks for opening! I wish you great success!

tAPx7M0obb_4SQ8IvmqVNA.text: I have come here twice since opening and I loved it both times. The food is hot when served, the staff is friendly and quick, and the burgers , wraps, and fries are DELISH. The milkshakes are delicious and creamy, I love the strawberry and chocolate. Please come here and eat !!! The only thing I wish is that they would use Chao cheese instead of daiya ! None the less TIS TASTY!

B54Flfociz00Yl8oOqwcbA.text: Very best American Burger in town. I got to try their Popcorn Chick'n as well and they were delightful and so filling. The food was made quicker than I expected. (Approx. 5 Min). I walked in and out of there happy as can be.

e_RG0E9B1yxwkkvxbBydmQ.text: This place is a vegan's paradise. The burgers are comparable to those being churned out at some of America's most well-known fast-food chains, and I have no problem saying the fries (especially the recently introduced "monster fries", which are a vegan spin on a popular competitors' "animal style fries") are better than any other fast-food joint. Everyone working here obviously enjoys their job, as my girlfriend and I have never dealt with a snappy employee. We're slowly becoming regulars here and we have absolutely no issues with that! Vegeway: transcendental idea; flawless execution.

m1Z0TCOCXCdqW1Bl34O6pw.text: Fantastic vegan option, great food and service, and an actual drive-thru that's quick. The double cheeseburger is my go-to; it satisfies like a Five Guys burger minus the greasiness. Love this place.

bSj10Kh9_D116XXJ4xBhEQ.text: This was the best veggie burger I've ever had. So yummy! It's clear across town from us but it was worth the drive. We are a family of vegans that actually miss the taste of meat so this real scratched the burger itch. Try it! You won't regret it.

m7yNLW8Dv6os033myMetVg.text: Ugh. I'm so sad! Drove 15 miles to my sisters house (she lives close to Vegeway) JUST to have some delicious vegan food from this gem. We ordered from uber eats since we had our hands full at the house. We ordered a double burger meal, curly fries, chicken wrap, a milkshake and specified on the order that we wanted ranch with the meal. When our ordered arrived, there was no drink, no fries, no ranch. We tried to call and let them know, no answer. So we had to drive over and pick up the rest of our food. They were nice about the mistake but this ruined the rest of our meal. When we got home, the burger was cold. I love Vegeway and as a vegan, I fully support their mission but guys, make sure you check to-go orders before they leave the restaurant. We paid $32 for a cold and late meal. Ugh. Im so sad, I was looking forward to this meal all week! Ps. Keep the ranch consistent, sometimes it's super runny.

JiMXlJSFM1Wn50zP44DQxQ.text: The vegan popcorn chicken bites were very good. This place surprised me in a great way. I didn't know meatless meat could taste so good and have such a good texture. Warning though on the burgers, if you've never had vegan cheese just know it doesn't taste like cheese. It has a completely different flavor. I like the burger much better without it! The service was great too.

Finally came inside to see what was going on with my order  and there were at least 6 employees in there and one customer. I told them I had been sitting at the drive thru waiting and the girl at the counter asked me what my order number was. How would I know??? _0KAUcvWxM22yQEnURDroQ.text: I've only had the veggie burger here and I'm a bit on the fence about it. It's nothing extraordinary but I sometimes randomly crave for it. The burger has a nice crunch texture then a gooeyness on the inside that ends up sticking to your teeth.

DLDhMmXyh0jJbhM7aFOzPQ.text: I just ate two vege burgers from there. The best  I ate after long time.. Everything was perfect. And its next to my house. I hope they get lots of more business..as they are new opened

cAZoOtm6E4B_uniNy4ABEw.text: My friend suggested VegeWay so we decided to run out and try it. I am so happy that we did. The food was excellent.  We both had the veggie burger.  She had one with the works and I had one with only lettuce, grilled onions and BBQ sauce.  I have been a vegetarian over 20 years and this was hands down the best veggie burger I have eaten at a restaurant.  The fries were excellent and the service was amazing. We also tried an order of the popcorn chicken. The sauce that came with it was delightful and the popcorn chicken was excellent. I am not crazy about fried food but this snack was good. We called in the order and zipped through the drive thru to pick it up. I will definitely be going back.

i7reSYRoRMDqb-WxfOpBjA.text: Although I am not vegan, it is nice to see more vegan restaurants sprouting in the Las Vegas area. The concept is good, and there are not a lot of choices, but it I just thought the preparation of the food could have been better. The cheese is absolutely disgusting, but the veggie patty itself, is not bad. I may have try the other stuff on the menu, but the first time trying it with the vegan burger, was not the best experience.

zjI0mGYglJUk4U0olLHIMQ.text: Some of these reviewers are so full of themselves, it makes me laugh!!  If your idea of a yelp review is trying to emulate New Yorker, believe their every word.  If, however, you want a vegan example of an InandOut Burger, go to Vegeway.  The pickles are on the condiment counter (duh, to the reviewer who missed them).  We got the double burger, a regular burger, and the sweet potato fries.  Everything was excellent.  There, a non-clever review that actually tells the truth.  Both of us ate for $16.  We enjoyed it.

W9uMxPi5P_1Z-6J6Q2JH6g.text: I LOVE this place! Everything is delicious and my non-vegan friends are addicted! Will definitely be back soon!

dhxNV3rXXj0ol2_ChhiHPg.text: The staff is friendly fun and the store is clean. These are just cool points in top of really good food. The curly  fries are better than jack in the box and the regular fries are real potatoes. The cheese is so cheesy...not that daiya crap. My favorite item so far is the ranch dressing, yes the ranch lol It has been way tooo long since I've been able to enjoy that flavor, but vege-way brought it back to my plant based life and I'm so happy they did. This makes me have to try vege house now. Thanks vege family!

wGyCVk_bsJPyP7w34kdPbw.text: OH. MY. GOODNESS...  I have found my happy place, seriously!!  First off, the place itself: They sell the most awesome vegan stickers, which I urge you to check out!  Secondly, the staff here seems far happier than the staffs at any nonvegan restaurant, go figure! Always friendly, cheerful, helpful, and genuinely passionate about the meals they serve, which brings me to the food!  Everything I've tried here has been fantastic!  Like a vegan In-n-Out with more options, I loved the animal fries!  That's right, vegan sauce and vegan cheese (not a huge fan of Daiya, but it was still great! Learning to like it), and grilled onions over french fries.  YUM!  My favorite, however, was the chicken ranch sandwich, which was exquisite!  Definitely have a weakness for ranch, so thank goodness for vegan ranch!  Another gem on the menu is the chocolate peanut butter milkshake!  Oh man, I didn't think I'd ever have a good milkshake again after going vegan, so a big THANK YOU to VegeWay for proving me wrong on that thought.  I've also tried a few other things on the menu, like their double cheeseburger and their chicken poppers, which were equally delicious.  I consider myself a big fan.  Fast food has never felt better, or tastier.  My only complaint, hence the four stars (If I could only remove a half star I would have done that) was that on one occasion that I was dining here, the TV was set to a Food Network type cooking show (not sure what show exactly, not big on watching TV), which was displaying the preparation of a steak.  I found that to be bothersome, since I was eating in a vegan establishment.  It was a bit hard to eat and maintain an appetite while watching cow flesh being cut apart and prepared :/  However, in terms of everything else, Five Stars easy!!

VT1d93MjmxLUAm5Nn5V7QA.text: The food is good. And I love that there is a drive-through. However, what kind of place doesn't have high-chairs? or even boosters? Do they hate children? Very disappointed in this. I'll just hold my 1 year old on my lap while we eat ;)

VLDgURjabcWXXK1yEPI1AA.text: First time here and wow I am impressed!! We ordered the double veggie burger, french fries and fish tacos, and everything was delicious!! Can't wait to come back soon!! I am really happy to have found this fast food vegan place!!

rEGOYVv5-koL53Igo6J0uw.text: BEST VEGAN BURGER! The double burger was great. Personally im not a fan of the cheese but everything else was great! If your a picky eater i would order the burger with no cheese and sauce on the side :)

o5ooiPk-zY0oNIsfpMUSUQ.text: the food is decent but not my favorite when it comes to vegan options. The best things at the restaurant are things that can pretty much be found anywhere like the curly fries and the Chocolate shake.

eqrCvGJqDHVBbO49rRCK-w.text: I was disappointed with this place, slow service even though I was the only one there. Messed up my order and did not even get it correct :(

KRU25X9x283-EBJWcBdPMg.text: Honestly heartbroken.. this used to be my FAVORITE vegan restaurant, and would come on every single one of my days off, as they are closed before I start work, and are closed again when I get off.  Anyway, the past four times I've been here, I have been unable to eat the food I got. I'm incredibly allergic to raw tomatoes, and always make sure to ask for them to not put any. They used to be great about this, but with this new wave of hires, they're now putting tomato in every single time, no matter how much I emphasize my allergy. Since these were To go, was not able to catch this before taking it home. Ended up having a severe reaction the first time they put tomato.  Today we stopped by to grab sandwiches.. my chicken ranch was TINY, with only the patty, some super witty, almost bad lettuce, and the sauce tasted so expired I had to spit it out and could not continue eating. Never experienced this here, but now very hesitant to return, as these past 4 meals have had to go to waste

Ud6RW-Q8HUFlYs4eHIUThQ.text: Everyone needs to come eat here ! The white chocolate peanut butter shake is amazing . The vegan burgers , taste like in and out! Nom nom

hMXcNyalQdoz9tgGpDq4vw.text: Chef Kenny does it again! I was so excited about the news that this place was opening and I was not disappointed by the food and experience. Walking in I was immediately greeted by the staff behind the counter. I asked the cashier what she would suggest and she told me everyone was getting down on the burgers, sweet potato fries and "milk" shakes. So I went with that and it was all delicious. I inhaled that whole meal with a quickness. I let it digest a little while I kicked back on their free wifi and enjoyed the atmosphere. Will definitely be coming back regularly between my Veggie House visits.

thKnK-eupIcjY55Je-TA6A.text: Soooooo good! Was so excited to have a vegan fast food place in town! I've been three times and am in love with the burger! It's absolutely delicious and savory. I also really enjoyed the chocolate shake (the mango is okay) and the curly fries. Can't wait to try everything! I would love to see a grilled cheese on the menu for kids.

mY1iVU-JIrFRelYf7yOTaA.text: Im not a vegan nor choose to be one but Dam that's a good Burger!!! Good Job Vege Way!!!! Highly recommended the double cheese burger. Happy Eating!!!

N_HJAd2d3MC-8bGsYJZslg.text: Really happy to have been told about VegeWay. Good service, good food, affordable. I'd recommend it.   It's a burger joint, so I'm not sure why someone made a comment about a ton of grease, what did they expect with burgers and fries? It goes with the territory.

WNKolmVtAUP6uK5Cd1n5bg.text: Already a fan of Veg house, now fast becoming fans of Vegeway! Everything on the menu so far is delicious and impressive as always. Still a bit higher prices than the non-veg alternatives, but great atmosphere, enthusiastic, friendly staff and clean, clean tables and facilities.

cgImdyTlTgAPuJj-UoQ8GA.text: Good "burger" and fries.  Fast service. Got to talk to The owner. Great guy. More locations coming!

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great burger and fries.

2mvosbnBM_pXOvi_llV_Eg.text: So unbelievably delicious! The popcorn chicken doesn't need any sauce... you can't stop eating it! The milkshakes are the best I've had! The wait is long... be prepared but it also speaks volumes about their food. Long overdue and WORTH IT

gf2Mw7VDkp-vvetTSgNymw.text: yummyyyy so good! i'm so glad there is a fast food for vegans :) burgers are good, but the popcorn chicken and the strawberry milkshakes holy crap they are SO YUMMY!!! love this place, i hope they open up more all over!

MQmXMBk9uo7jknR95s52SA.text: Really enjoyed this place! Excellent food, customer service, and a very friendly staff. The Beef sandwich and popcorn chicken are outstanding. They have a special shake now for the holidays called made with peanut and white chocolate which is delicious.

J7rE3bCGtwSSu3O-YtvZdg.text: 2 stars because this is an easy vegan meal that's fast. But the food: I had the cheeseburger and it was so bland I had to load it with ranch, but that too was bland. The curly fries tasted like Arby's, good but had higher expectations. The zucchini was terrible and bland. The popcorn chicken was thrown out after one bite. I wouldn't choose this place again, very greasy (I know it's fast food) but way greasier than average in n out. Worth a try, but not anything special. Has so much potential if they learn how to use some seasoning.

QDur_nfTBMi1VBmCLGauRg.text: Not fast veggie food. Not the best service!! Ordered something through drive through and they gave me a total. Drove up to window and proceeded to wait 13 minutes and no one came to the window or noticed me at all. After that I honked and waived to get their attention and after 2 minutes some guy came and said "what do your Want" really. I told him that I've been waiting for aver 10 minutes he said "I just got here so I don't know what you ordered." No one else inside knew either. Come on. I was really looking forward to giving this place a try! Sad

a6--9DLTSR47gmBsuYu_nw.text: We had the " Burger" and fries meals and absolutely loved them! As budding plant based diners we still every once in a while have a craving for meat and this squashed that really quick! The "Burgers" were really moist and flavorful, the fries were crispy and hot. Could not ask more of the food. The environment was exactly what you'd expect from a burger joint. I, my husband and 15 year old son loved it! We will be back!

42zkdSBtlFBDh5WNe_KGxQ.text: So, so gross. I purchased a Groupon and completely regretted wasting the $8, even though it was at a discount. Food was extremely bland. I asked what  the sugar content was in the milkshakes and she told me they did not have any nutritional information, which is absurd. I felt gross after eating here. Fries extremely greasy. Chocolate milkshake not tasty at all. Burger thrown together. No ketchup given on my "to go" order. Very, very disappointing.

kuBLY493Eo3InGcIVeB3BQ.text: This is my go to spot on this part of town. Amazing. I eat so much when I am here, cheeseburger, curly fries and a shake! they are so light and refreshing because they are dairy free. Must try this place.

qlFF6qbq7itJPjKgFKB_JQ.text: My first visit, I was very pleased.Already a regular and fan of Chef Kenny's  Veggie House, I'm adding this to my faves list! The Vegan beef sandwich or as others call it the Vegan Bahn mi sandwich is the bomb!! I'm not much of a sandwich or burger fan but this sandwich with a side of sweet potato fries and a drive thru? Yassssssss! Love that my fave cilantro salad from the Veggie House is on the menu too. Yum.  My 2nd visit is the reason why I can't give them 5 stars. I ordered the vegan cheeseburger with a side of sweet potato fries of course, and the fried zucchini. The burger was good, but I've honestly had better. I added some hot chipotle sauce to add more flavor.   I was very disappointed with the fried zucchini. It was greasy and overdone - some of the zucchini were soggy, and the batter just doesn't work. If chef could fix this and get inspired by Farmer Boy's fried zucchini   I'll definitely be back - but not for the fried zucchini.   Chef, please bring in your veggie ramen bowls here and my fave salt & pepper Tofu as a side on this menu!

pM4I1Jjgs9oNIWDRH6m9sw.text: The food was okay.  It was very inexpensive for a vegan restaurant that says a lot as most tend to be on the pricier end.  I had the single burger,  regular fries, curly fries and a vanilla shake. I preferred the regular fries, but I am not really a big fan of curly fries so I gave them to my husband.  I just wanted to try them because of the reviews.  He liked them, but he is not vegan YET.  The shake was very good, but I couldn't finish it because it was too much food.  The burger reminded me of an In N Out burger that I ate before becoming vegan.  I have had better vegan burgers at vegan fast food restaurants in California and in Arizona, but I was pleased to find a quick, inexpensive vegan burger while visiting Las Vegas.

ARf8jIKPydCDDO-gKYwzzg.text: I have had my share of vegan burgers, and Vege-Way's are top-notch. The patty itself was not stiff and did not fall apart like so many others I've had. The vegetables were crisp and fresh. I would definitely recommend this place to any vegetarian/vegan looking for comfort food.

mj6LcgkKLBz0H2wEwkiBcw.text: We  Veggie House and we're stoked to try Vege Way. We set out with high hopes for this meal, but it face-planted very quickly. While the young lady behind the register was friendly, helpful and knowledgeable it wasn't enough to save this experience.  Atmosphere: Uncomfortable. The 3 employees in the open kitchen were blasting some super explicit music, audible to the entire restaurant. I'm no square but it was SO inappropriate. I shot a side eye and the gent at the line reached up and turned it to something else, but as soon as we sat down he turned it back.   It's a very small dining area (totally ok with that) but we tried 3 tiny tables and they were all wobbly.  It just wasn't welcoming or comfortable at all.  Food: Pass. The burger patties were mush with an odd unidentifiable flavor. Iced tea was watered down and tasted like it had been brewed a few days before. The fries were good, but nothing we can't get anywhere else.   We really wanted this to blow our minds and it did, but only because we couldn't believe how bad it was. I'm giving 2  because it's a great idea, just very poorly executed.

OhfvK84pyKPVn4oRfARIuA.text: DIRTY Resturant!  OLD food!  Everyone who ate here got sick under 30 min after eating!

6GunL6XNZybmYDgnr0Oifg.text: Soooooooooo happy I found this place. A vegan fast food place with a drive thru. And it taste like in -and-out , minus the nasty meat. All plant based. The flavor is amazing. And I'm so happy they have a soy free patty. The curly fries are so good too.

-5HBTCE0o1bY-Olg8Y-AQw.text: Sometimes, a vegan just needs a delicious "milk"shake and some greasy, fattening fast food. And this is just that. It's great for being junk food.

Riewzx6Fmo3cj_SGdaOwLw.text: My friend is a vegan and when she comes over she loves to order from here. The food is always yummy and very filling, even for meat eaters. Must Try!

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Popcorn chicken

Wxl1wukZXK-5r5KMlVTETA.text: The best vegan food ever!!!! Beyond Burger is their star - has no soy and looks and tastes almost like real burger.

ndxDpmCaPyEgYwpNZyuN6A.text: I love this place, it's definitely like an in n out style burger.  Of course it won't taste like what people are used to when eating animal flesh burgers.  But hey, this is junk food for the more conscious humans.   It's delicious, but still junk food.    Come here once a month

Hr1vNXBOkjJGaOxZDLhdMw.text: We came here last night right before they closed. They were still busy and happy to serve last minute customers.   Menu is very simple and short. We ordered a single cheeseburger, a double cheese burger combo with sweet potato fries, chicken turmeric salad, and a chocolate shake. Everything taste great! The burgers has vegan thousand island sauce that makes it so flavorful and delicious. I personally was IN LOVE with their vegan milkshake! I can't wait to go back and try the other flavors.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burgers, sweet potato fries, chicken turmeric salad, and chocolate milkshake

mBpljjYsvH6uwhmaIqfRhw.text: Wow - I'm not vegetarian but I'd be vegan everyday if I had access to this place where I currently live! A friend and I stopped in for some fast food during our Vegas trip and wow, just wow. The Hawaiian burger with sweet potato fries were amazing. So flavorful, healthy and delicious! You wouldn't even know you were eating vegan. My friend had a vegan milkshake and she said it was the best milkshake she'd ever eaten. Can this place become a chain so I can eat there in Texas??? Props go to Chef Kenny, what a nice guy who knows his way around the kitchen!

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sptZ-U025LHAMDtrVjofYA.text: I love that VegeWay has catered to their customers, offering soy and gluten free options.  Their burgers are super affordable, delicious, and there's a drive-thru!

T1KCdbojpag0h8umct7SPw.text: I'm not sure what happened to this place, but I saw other reviewers had complaints recently. I came here before and thought the service and food were amazing. Today however, was different.   I ordered in the drive thru for just a burger and curly fries. I said my order twice. I come up to the window, paid, didn't bother for a receipt, got my food and went home (which is like 5 minutes away). I take out my order and the fries were regular fries, even though I said curly. I shrugged it off. Then the bottom of my burger was cold. Not the middle, but the bun on the bottom. It had grill marks, but it was cold. Like they grilled it in the morning and put it in the fridge or something. Then, my cheese wasn't melted all the way through. Really disappointing.   I called, after reading some reviews on here, to talk to the manager because I really liked this place. Girl who answered puts me on hold, then comes back to say the manager won't be in till 2:30. I asked for the manager's name and she said Claudia. I asked for the last name and she didn't know. Hmm... Don't know if she's being shady, but she said she'll ask. So she comes back on the phone and says Gonzalez. So I'll be calling back at 2:30 to speak to Claudia Gonzalez who I hope is the manager.

w9MSX8Pkl0Fl9CiaHMG4hA.text: I ordered a double vegan burger over the weekend, and I'm not sure what was so different this time over the other few times I've ordered the same thing... but the burger was not good. It was extremely chewy, the tomato was really slimy and it ruined the entire burger for me. I ended up just finishing the fries and throwing the burger away in disappointment. Probably won't be going back here anytime soon. The soggy tomato was enough to ruin everything here.

hIJ9z3HqfN6f7kGoBlHReA.text: We have tried their jalapeno burger, the Hawaiian burger, double cheeseburger, monster fries, and the best fried zucchini's ever! Price is great! Portions are great! Just wish they were open later at least on weekends. (Pls make this happen!)  hands down the best! Can't wait to try there breakfast and other items in the menu!  my favorite so far is hands down The fried zucchini's and the jalapeno burger!

CQgNsT92Q1YgJ1LngZhRJg.text: So I guess I will write my review while I wait in the drive thru... I've been waiting in the drive thru for 15 minutes and still haven't gotten my food. What's the point of even having a drive thru if you cannot provide quick service? It might have been better to just park my car and wait inside instead... Other times I've gone through the drive thru, it wasn't as bad.  But besides the horrendous 18 minute wait with no apology, the food really is good and it makes me keep coming back for more! I love their vegan burgers (without cheese - vegan cheese is weird to me) and popcorn chicken. They have so many other options that I want, I mean need, to try!   I deducted one star for the terrible service in the drive thru, but the yummy vegan junk food makes me a regular at this place!

o7iI4LI3Jjn3prcKPNtjQg.text: This place was really good. I ordered the Hawaiian burger with curly fries and a chocolate milkshake. My bf who isn't vegan really liked the double cheese burger. I'm not a big fan of strawberry milkshakes but it was really good!  I will definitely be coming back next time I'm in Vegas again.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JULu1VL5qfkMcvKwHCcI2A.text: Meh. That's all I can say. I saw the reviews and wanted to give it a try. I went through the drive thru (which is pretty cool for a place that sells healthy food), but I will admit I was underwhelmed at the double and my wife said the single was Meh too. Don't get me wrong, I like the concept and maybe other things on the menu are better, but not what we got.   Redeeming grace though are the curly fries. Curly fries make anything better and they at least did them right.  Work on your veggie burger though.

tQS25FnZH9EAZwDtwOIiQA.text: This is the closest (to original) vegan version of fast food I have ever tried. While 'Leaving Las Vegas' (like the infamous movie), we decided to stop by.   Of course, the cheese burger and popcorn chikc'n are a must!! Paired with fries and milkshake, makes the experience whole.  Although these are not in the healthy side of the spectrum, my palate and bud sensors transported me back in time when junk food used to make me happy. This time, was no different. I used to have this type of combo, after a night of partying...   Yes, bye Vegas!!! I'll miss you much!

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yes, it&#39;s vegan and it&#39;s a freaking good cheeseburger!!
Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries with &#34;popcorn chicken&#34;, best vegan fast food I ever had.
Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5E4tF7DvmseBZQN28ZsMFQ.text: Vegan cheap fast food at it's finest!  Though this spot is a bit far from me, I was able to try it conveniently through a Yelp pickup order the other day.   The prices astonished me, (everything was less than $5) so I ended up ordering a bunch of food for later too.   I tried: - curly fries - popcorn chicken - buffalo chicken burger - vegan beef sandwich (banh mi spinoff)  I really liked the popcorn chicken! It was perfectly crunchy and fresh. The buffalo chicken burger had most of its sauce concentrated in the middle, so the majority of it was not recognizable as 'buffalo' style.  The vegan beef sandwich was solid, but would have been better with crunchier bread - like those usually made with banh mi. This bread was soft and crumbly; it tasted cheaper than its price.  The curly fries were pretty good.  I'd be back again, but it would help if there was a location closer to my house in the Southwest.

Fjq9QYC4uli4TUh9r3y1pA.text: If I could give them 6 stars, I would.  Parking was easy to find, the woman who helped us was super nice and explained what came on the burger, and the place was clean.  The burgers....o.m.g. Yes. Best Vegan burgers we've had. Fries (curly & regular) were bomb. But the stars of the show were the milkshakes!!!!!!! Totally worth the upgrade.   We're from San Diego, California so the price for all this felt like a steal!

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger combo with curly fries &amp; strawberry milkshake. Double burger combo with regular fries &amp; vanilla milkshake
Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu 4/4
Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu 3/4

E7e3jHZ1ETZTBVY7RO1A0A.text: It's not an Impossible Burger, but variety is the spice of life!   This burger patty is a bit soft, but very flavorful and with an interestingly chewy texture that you can definitely sink your teeth into.   Once you add it all together in your mouth with the lettuce, tomato, bun, sauce, and fries, this will satisfy a burger craving without the meat! I'm not vegan but still transitioning, and I'm so happy this place exists. Vegan fast food! Can't wait to come back and try some of their non-burger options :)

1yx23c9d04Ms22saEz6JZg.text: Dirty and Disappointing! This place is horrible! We came in with a whole group of people because of the review and were very disappointed. The house burger was not good and the beyond meat burger is just barley okay. The way it's prepared and sauces are blah! Oh and speaking of the sauces... the ranch is runny and the house dressing is not good. One of the group ordered the "orange chicken" and reported it was not good.  Also the restaurant is very dirty! Tables and floors have food and a layer of dirt... We will not be back and we would not recommend.

T_i0DquozVlSTvXfBkrhPQ.text: UPDATE TO MY UPDATE:  It gets worse!!! So I bring up to them whats with the price of the burger and why its not up front on the menu. Bla bla whatever 'thats just how it is' Honestly if the guy who took my order gave me a heads up it would not have been a big deal, but I wasn't told that it would cost more. Again, ridiculous.  The onions were cut too thick to eat so I picked them out. The lettuce tasted poorly washed, or like theres dish soap on it, I don't know! I'm starving (after waiting in the drive thru for 20 minutes) and pregnant and have a sleeping baby in the car, so Im just taking the L and eating it. And then right towards the end of my burger, i bite plastic. I originally think its from one of my ketchup packets but it isn't, its clear ( see photo attached.) I want to go back in there and complain and get my money back but I already ate the burger and its a battle I don't feel like having. The fries are crap by the way and I only ate one. I will definitely never ever be back, and if I see Chef Kenny again I feel compelled to tell him what a disaster of an experience I had here despite trying my best to be a forgiving customer. I never get this horrible service at his other restaurant, but like I said before this one seems to be ran by teenagers who don't value their job.  Update: Came back to give them another try. $14.99 for a Beyond Burger?! It doesn't say that anywhere on the Drive thru menu. I got no warning either about the price. That's just RIDICULOUS. Changing my review to one star. Originally the guy charged me twice for a burger and then a meal, so in the confusion I didn't notice the price of the burger and wasnt warned a beyond burger with fried and a milkshake would cost $20. -------------  Old review: Food is ok but unfortunately seems to be ran by a bunch of kids. I always eat in because the drive through is always ridiculously laggy when I try it. I swear I've had to wait 40 minutes before. Last time, I ordered a hamburger. They gave me a cheeseburger. I took one bite thinking maybe I could get past it, ONE little bite and I couldn't stomach it. I told them I didn't realize the hamburger came with cheese because I ordered a hamburger not a cheeseburger. and they said they can't do anything just cause I don't like it. Well it wasn't what I ordered. So make sure you specify.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Piece of plastic found in my $15 Beyond Burger mea combo

gtAs8YO2mGJMQn89HIey6Q.text: This place was really good, I had one of their burgers, the vegan Hawaiian burger and it was amazing! Really recommend this place super good and their animal fries are really good! All vegan!

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan Hawaiian Burger

OzlurJGPAqF12bhIO7Fbfw.text: I want to like this place so bad. It's right around the corner from where I work, plus I'm a wanna be vegan once or twice a month.   Every time I order my burger I request "NO SAUCE".... I usually have to tell the person this on the other end of the speaker 2 or 3 times. When I go to eat the burger it has SAUCE, yuck! xlyez9nZAYodtHKnqYT_Gg.text: This is more of a fast food place, everything seems clean and they were friendly! The burgers are a piece of art, they make them look so good, but I'm not a big fan of the taste, it felt a bit off, couldn't really tell what I was eating and the cheese, I believe it's vegan, because it didn't taste like any other normal American cheese, anyway, I loved the curly fries, so delicious and fresh, absolutely my favorite, I would definitely go back for the fries!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan Double Vegan Burger, Vegan Spicy Jalapeno Burger with curly fries and French fries ( sooo fresh!!!)

wOqR1djCyPiXGmatcNM0oA.text: Ever since I tried this place, I've been craving eating here so often.  Double vegan cheeseburger is around $5 and super filling and delicious. I love the soft bun they use. The patty is a bit chewy with a tapioca or rice texture and even though it's not similar to meat in any way, it still taste really good. It's good in a different way! Lol I love the sauce. It makes the burger even better.   Their milk shakes are pretty good, just a little pricey at $5 for what im guessing is 12oz cup. I can make the same thing at home for much less.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two double vegan burgers &amp; curly fries

N0UJryvqWafFGsthVAlM2Q.text: Honestly this place is so overpriced to me! I've come here several times and every time I tell myself I'm never going again. The burgers aren't even very tasty and the veggies they put on them don't even seem that fresh. The other week I got a spicy jalapeno burger and the cheese wasn't even melted. It was like a thick slice off a hard block or something. I don't get it. Cheeseburgers should have MELTED cheese on them.  I do enjoy the Beef Banh Mi sandwich tho and the only other item I liked, they got rid of, Fish Tacos! Boo! I would rather purchase a two pack of Beyond Beef burgers and a pack of Follow your heart cheese and make a much tastier, less expensive burger at home, with MELTED cheese!

k8Ohp0nfIXQxS6TLMWPipA.text: I love this trendy concept of plant based fast food. Drive thru avail as well as dine in. Restroom ok at best. I'd like to see other locations in Los Angeles, California.   STAFF: welcoming, great at explaining the menu. MY ORDER: spicy jalapeno burger with "cheese", monster fries, chocolate milk shake. DELICIOUS!  CONCLUSION: I will return here.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love this.
Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chief Kenny

E2NxQbyCjBaJAzfPspQd1Q.text: Every time I'm in Vegas, I go out of my way to eat at this amazing place. It's affordable vegan classics that we all miss at some point. You can get two sandwiches (I take one for the road and one for there) with fries for under 20. The shakes are also really great, and honestly more no fuss places like this should pop up on the Vegas vegan food scene, because they would do well. Take that In-n-out, I can eat animal fries again!

zmIjewUpRZOgiJcJpfuYHg.text: Not a fan. The veggie burger is like eating a glue burger. Literally everything gets stuck to your teeth or lips.  Had to spend time cleaning after every bite.  Side salad is pathetic too for a vegan restaurant.

CfVeCaHfh3Bsh1FzTXAICw.text: As I have been transitioning to more of a plant based diet, it's awesome to know Vege-Way exists! Went here for my birthday because I was craving a burger and I had the Beyond Meat meal with the yummy vege-way fries! Yassss! So delish!!! I went back again 2 weeks later with my picky eater Daughter and I ordered the same thing. She ordered the chicken! I tasted it and it was so good! So happy to have this place in the area!!

9g9zWpjs8Z8GpYjH5tAzkQ.text: Chef Kenny's vision was to create a vegan In-n-Out.  I vote that he's succeeded.  I got the double vegan burger (modeled after I-n-O's Double Double), and it was wondrous.  Good flavors and no guilt.  The only thing missing from the I-n-O experience was the line put the door.   (for now)

Pr7tWnWFfJC8Du0tMonaWg.text: After my barber told me about this spot, I decided to give it a try at around 4:30p, January 7, 2019.    Zuchini fries and orange "chicken".  The mere thought of how sick I became at 4a is still sends a cramp through my stomach.    The food poisoning I received is unspeakable.  I'll never forget the experience and I most certainly will NEVER eat food from this place again!

VWDVN47WLlvnufFugE5Qng.text: Delicious burgers especially the Hawaiian and the milkshakes are so amazing I ended up ordering one more for the drive back to my hotel. Great service and I love the idea of a Vegan drive thru. Definitely will be coming back for more on my next trip to Vegas!
