jB-FkGVE7LeUbFzKaHsc4A.text: Vegan fast food.  I give this 3 stars because the drive through service is pretty slow and the food is a little to greasy for me.  The staff is always nice but the wait is pretty long.  It would be nice if they added things to the menu.  I have been here 4 times and each time it has been less and less appetizing.  Vegan food doesn't have to be basic it can be better and continue to be better and that's my only grip with this restaurant is that it needs to update its menu to keep my coming back.

SKIf1t1tcveCxGDdNVh5yw.text: So good even my "which dish has the most meat?" husband loved it! He asked me half a dozen times if I was sure it had no meat in it.  We had Hawaiian burgers and orange chicken. Not only healthier, but the burgers are better, bigger, and, in most cases, cheaper than any "regular" fast food burger. Chef Kenny is a magician with vegan food!

njmklwqCx1_76AUWv1-_0A.text: The food is amazing. It's like a vegan in n out but better. Been there multiple times and we always try something new. Everything has been delicious. I definitely recommend this place to vegans and non vegans alike. My non vegan family approved it and they're super picky.

v3OLJ32A5FuzKGUN8eVMoA.text: I have been here a few times because it's close to my house and I don't feel as guilty as I would going to another fast food joint. The service and food is usually so good! Today I came in and while I was waiting for my food I noticed the workers wearing gloves. First thought "awesome! good for you vegeway!" But then I watch this food handler take out his cell phone, use it and then go back to handling food while wearing the same gloves. I also watched him use the register while wearing gloves. GROSS! Management should take time out and explain the importance of food sanitation and safety to their staff.   Vegeway also changed the fries to a thinner cut fries that aren't nearly as good as the old ones. I don't know if they're cutting back on portions but the fries I received with my meal only filled about half of my basket when it used to be overflow.   I don't know if I will return based on the glove issue alone and I probably wouldn't spend the extra to get a meal if my fries are only going to be filled half way and taste generic.

BilSVigKCxllGyNCRRd9BQ.text: I tried this place out with pretty high expectations. I wouldn't say that it was a disappointment, but considering the circumstances, I probably wouldn't come back here. For one, the drive is very far from my house and the food wasn't necessarily worth it. The service wasn't the best; we waited quite a long time for the food, and there weren't a lot of people in the restaurant. The staff wasn't the nicest, either, BUT...I only went one time. They could've just had an off-day. The burgers were personally not my favorite, but the chicken was amazing. I also loved the fries and the vanilla shake.

3Zhz3FsgAE3G4hm7UzRQfQ.text: Very disappointed with my current visit to vegeway. I went to the drivethru and that was the initial issue. Their order speaker is old so I couldn't get my order taken properly so I had to get to the window to fix my order than I was told they didn't have a sweet potato fries but shows you can order them off the app. I'm glad I didn't place an order ahead of time because I would've been even more upset. So I ordered curly fries and my double vegan burger. I get my order after being told to wait on the side because the person behind me their order was ready before mine. And when I get my order my curly fries aren't that they're fries that are curved. Not even whole curly fries. Just a lot of nonsense and dissatisfaction with this stop at vegeway. And this is all without even trying my burger yet

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tVyPaJbkGcSmVtsqxVbXJA.text: Me being a meat eater I was curious to see how a vegan burger would stack up.  I ordered the:  Vegan Burger - Honestly really surprised me with the flavor, had some char to it and was done well, however it doesn't really fill you up and the price point for a vegetarian product is pretty high ($4.69 for a burger that doesn't fill you up).  Curly Fries - ehhhh not bad not good just fries...  Zucchini Sticks - Ok not the best but def not the worst  Milkshake - Again not the best but def not the worst...  OVerall the prce point of everything that I got would have equated to three #1's at In-N-Out...while the burger was intresting and flavorful I can not warrant a strong recomendation at that price point. Being a vegan must be super expensive...

SFEvqWCFtVMBh9kP1pmMVA.text: Vegeway has many of the quality trademarks one would expect from the chef of Veggie House, one of Las Vegas best Vegan restaurants. The food is delicious, which is terrific news for any and all vegetarians and vegans looking for a casual bite. That the new place has a drive thru is also good news, and rather unique for a place like this. I would recommend this burger joint to anyone, even though I myself prefer the "beef" sandwich to the burgers. Another stand out  here are the wonderful milkshakes. Do yourself a favor and try them.  I must say that the location itself could use some improving though. There are few tables, all of them small, and it is utterly uninviting the way they have set it up. They all but encourage you to just use the drive thru or place your order to go on account of the poor interior. It may look new but the floorplan is doing them no service here.

TdPfhogt__ObCjB9AswDAg.text: The food is great. But the service.... every time I've come here I've had to wait an incredibly long time for my food. Each time I've come here there's maybe one or two people dining already so it's not like they're slammed or super busy. What's worse is the drive through. Takes even longer and the order is generally not fully heard by them. But either way whether I'm inside or outside, my order is generally wrong when i receive it. I'm still coming though cause the food is good. But it would be great if the manager could fix the annoyances....

NEKElr3iSAUy2X9mvfjrlw.text: Vegeway is a perfect take on vegan fast food. My friend and I ordered the Hawaiian burger, curly fries, popcorn chicken and orange chicken. The popcorn chicken was sooo delicious! It was fresh and crispy and tasted just like chicken; that was probably my favorite thing. The ranch sauce they serve with it is amazing, definitely the best vegan ranch I've had. The Hawaiian burger and curly fries were also delicious. The only thing I wouldn't recommend is the orange chicken, I'd go to veggie house for that.

pLdRONTAAuwa9KZtHT2p2Q.text: Really good Hawaiian burgers. The popcorn chicken is so-so. Good priced items. I'm not a vegetarian, but went with a friend who is one and I thought it was just as good as meat, but it's not :) Recommend this place.

_Xu_NfZKI5JoOutu8h5UiA.text: I tried VegeWay for the first time yesterday. I ordered a Vanilla shake, fries and a chicken wrap. It was delicious. I was actually impressed with their food. I love that is vegan and super healthy. I didn't feel full or overstuffed. The drive thru service was friendly. I would come here again. A+

vCB-VmsOgUhf827n_TjAeQ.text: Not only was the food great, the serviced I received from the lady that answered the phone (and my NUMEROUS questions) to the Manager that helped me with a completely wrong order (ordered through a 3rd party, not vegeways fault) was nothing short of impeccable. I know we don't all have the same experiences but they definitely made my day and helped me beyond measure.   The monster fries were to die for, popcorn chicken  and the spicy jalapeno burger was . I will definitely be back, not just because the food was great but the customer service .   Thank vegeway for taking care of me and making it right.

cs4Ym3Eg7BQa31uFL-nWQw.text: This place is great for a quick stop for burgers and fries that are vegan! I especially LOVE their zucchini fries. My only issue, which is small, is the cheese. I'm weird about vegan cheese, but mixed with anything else on the burger is still delicious. I would recommend this place to any vegan or nonvegan too!

P__7OthXoaS22bWN3w6w8Q.text: Wow! I am thoroughly impressed. So much so I felt compelled to leave a review which I seldom do. Let me start by saying that I am not a vegetarian, pescatarian, vegan, etc but I would definitely come here again. We had the chicken nuggets, beyond burger, and beef sandwich and all of them were great! Don't knock this place until you try it. The food speaks for itself. The staff is great too.

I would not recommend this place to anyone.

YsEiW1I5bRWnA8RPY15Nbg.text: Great spot of a quick meal. I'm not vegan by any means, but I do my best to cut back on meat. I had the beyond burger and curly fries which were both great. I'll definitely be back to try third other options.

nBs6ptgHK-Hz74d9kZrlKA.text: First time eating here. Food was not that great for 24 dollars to feed two people. No justification for value and price. The employees had little to no professionalism. It's a sketch place to eat. I was hoping for a great experience, but I've had better vegan food in a better environment.

17m0jO41JkDTZrJihgNbNQ.text: This is vegan junk food for people who don't care about their health and people who like to sit around.  Because - if you participate in any high energy activities (dancing, martial arts, yoga, meditating) after eating this crap - you will be drained energetically.  Burger patties are WAY INFERIOR to Gardein burger patties found at good quality vegan spots. Obviously those places charge more. BUT even when compared to other 'fast food vegan food', vegeway sucks.  You are literally poisoning your children when you bring them here. If you don't have time to go somewhere else, just fast. Seriously.  I tried the breaded deep fried Orange Chicken and this hit my throat really hard. Total filth.  I like the option to get my burgers wrapped in lettuce, but found the lettuce to be semi-fresh and somewhat stale. Not crisp and fresh.  Food here has the power to make you sick, especially if you have a clean system from eating a clean plant-based diet.  If you want a high quality 'fast food' vegan burger -- go to The Habit! Quality of that burger is much better and the lettuce was fresh and crisp. They also have more choices for fries at The Habit.

XbljJcTHaqtBDTUkveEbKQ.text: Surprisingly delicious! I would definitely recommend to all vegans/vegetarians. I hope they plan to open more locations but if they do, I wish they'd let me redesign/decorate for them lol That would be my only complaint here is that for a restaurant that's only been open for two years, it looks like a 70's/ early 80's establishment. I didn't understand that. Will definitely come here again though. Where is their social media? I don't think they have any yet.  FOOD: Very tasty! I had a cheeseburger meal that came with fries and a refillable drink which is perfect for the hot Vegas weather. There wasn't any ice in the fountain drinks machine but the beverages were still cold enough.   AMBIANCE: it's Kind of dated and it's very odd to me as a designer. The restaurant and menu board seems as if it should be more hip & contemporary and with the times of the vegan craze.   SERVICE: Decent service, nothing that I was blown away by but The front cashier was very pleasant   DRESS CODE: Very casual

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan Cheese Burger

7E5sAnS4QwaKQZi4GR97iQ.text: if you're looking for saucy similar to in-n-out, MAKE SURE TO ASK FOR EXTRA V-MAC SAUCE (on the side or on the burger)   Came here to try out their burgers since I saw that they have their own v-Mac sauce. Soo delicious!   I got the vegan burger with monster fries and a vanilla shake. YUM!   My boyfriend got the double patty began burger with monster fries and a strawberry shake. DOUBLE YUM!   Burger- needs more sauce so make sure to ask for extra to make it extra saucy. The cheese was melted to perfection. They make their own patties in house and it was delicious! It didn't take bean-y or like multiple ingredients were mashed together to make a vegan patty! (They do offer beyond meat now so if you like that better, it's an option for you)   Monster fries- get them! They are soo good. Again, the cheese was perfectly melted, which is sometimes hard for vegan cheeses. The onions were grilled to perfection. There wasn't enough sauce on there so make sure to ask for more if you like it saucy.   Milkshake- GET THEM! The most popular there is the strawberry. After tasting it I understood why! I'm not usually a big fan of strawberry milkshakes (which is why I got vanilla) but after tasting it, I wished I got strawberry instead.   The price of everything was pretty ya there (total came it to $40ish with tip) but you know it's hard to find good vegan burgers for cheap anywhere.

HLh-_64mtwtkk-PYjMr_5g.text: 3.5 stars  I ordered the beef sandwich (similar to a banh mi) and the fried zucchini to go.   The fried zucchini had too much batter on it for my taste. I was expecting more of a tempera like crunch but it was much thicker.   For the beef sandwich, I would rather have it on a baguette than the bun they had it on. With the sauce and the pickled veggies placed on top, the bun gets soggy fast.  I know there isn't very many vegan options of there so this place isn't bad. I'd give it another try.

XX8v7NFDJ5ESVNqsmXjrTA.text: Bottom Line: Writing this review makes me sad. :( Sad because we don't have this in LA. I'D BE HERE ALL THE TIME.  Food: Man, listen. I'm just glad I can get "in-n-out" style food vegan still. It just makes me happy. In-N-Out, I can NEVER go to you because of my change in food choices and it SUCKS. Get the beyond meat burger with all the fixins and the "monster" is what I think they call them... fries. It's like "animal style" and it's really good! Oh and the shakes!  Service: It takes a minute to get your food, especially when they are busy, but I believe they also have a drive through.  Atmosphere: Fast-food casual, nothing fancy.  Overall- I would make this your first stop before going to the strip in Vegas! Always something to look forward to.

nf6J0oLOJYqZQ8jrWTCZuw.text: As satisfying as their meaty counterparts, these vegan burgers pack in all the flavor of anything you'll find at your local quick service burger joint.   The Hawaiian is recommended. Topped with pineapple, carmelized onions and BBQ sauce it's a sweet and savory mouth fiesta.   If you aren't a meat eater, this place will take care of any burger cravings you have. If you do eat meat, it's a great place to try to prove to your taste buds that alternatives to animal products exist that still feel decadent.  This ain't health food, but you can still feel good about eating it. Curly fries were tasty too!

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Hawaiian. A delicious mess of pineapple, carmelized onion and BBQ sauce.

0hqI36y85QZiUMMUqLvWRg.text: Oh my gosh, I came today to get a couple meals for lunch. When ordering I asked them to make one of the fry's, monster fry's.   Got home, tried the fry's and they are the best dang fry's I have had in a long time. The fry's remind me of In n Out Animal Style fry's but WAYYYY better.   I ordered the spicy jalapeno burger and my girlfriend LOVED it. She said there was a jalapeno in every bite, Just the way she likes it.   I also ordered the Hawaiian burger and while that was super delicious as well, it had just a little too much BBQ sauce in it, but still five stars.  We have been here many times before but this was a first for these items. My girlfriend asked me probably 5 times if I was sure that everything was vegan. Lol everything was so good!    Highly recommend Vege-Way for vegans and non vegans!!

jeOHVFRqQ5Ytn5bJ3tW6iA.text: Vege-Way = Vegan Fast Food!!  I have been a fan of Chef Kenny's for a while now. I frequent his Asian restaurant regularly because it's very near to my work and the food is amazing.   Today I felt like something different so I took a trip down to Vege-Way. The twenty minute drive on my lunch break was totally worth it.   The burgers at Vege-Way are phenomenal. The burger and curly fries here prove that vegan food can be tasty and flavorful.   I wish there was one of these closer to my work or home. As for right now, Vege-Way boasts on being the only Vegan Fast Food joint in all of Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan Burger

q8bANbULhiBf2B4AEpsbLA.text: Pros: nice selection of vegan items. Banh Mi beef sandwich and chicken wrap (huge) are worth trying. Curly fries are similar to Jack in the Box. Worth trying this place at least once. I eat pretty much anything when I'm stressed out. Love to pig out here!  Cons: omni friends complained about the after effects from the burger. I realized I don't feel the best afterwards either. It's only with the burger too - maybe a preservative or oil they use. Most of the food here is way too oily, but that's to be expected from a fast food joint. A bit pricey for what it is. Drive-thru wait time can be hit or miss. Decent spot to drop by if I'm in the area.

WaqADci0gH2wjjnIQogv_A.text: Vege-Way has shown me the way (oh so corny)! If I still lived in Vegas, I'd be here on the daily, but for now, I get my fix every few months. Their plant-based burger patties are cooked to perfection with crispy edges that I can't get enough of. The cheeseburger comes with a slice of vegan cheese, V-mak sauce (similar to a tangy Thousand Island salad dressing), and a fresh assortment of your typical burger veggies (lettuce, tomato, onion). The price ain't bad either and won't set you back a ton: $4.75 for a cheeseburger that doesn't make you feel horribly guilty after eating it.  On the occasions that I have used the drive-thru, service has been quick and efficient. Compared to the vegan fast food joint I frequent in San Diego, Vege-Way's wait time is minimal and service has been consistently friendly.

W6rFHYC_K2Pra2jcuu461A.text: Vegeway is a vegan fast food joint with a very simple menu offering vegan burgers, fries, milkshakes, and a few specialties. It operates similarly to classic fast food places like Burger King and it even has a drive-thru window. The staff is friendly and the overall experience is a unique one for a vegan who wouldn't normally be able to order a burger and fries from a fast food restaurant.   The Hawaiian burger seems to be the specialty here. It is not on the menu, but it was recommended to me by the cashier. it was basically the standard burger but with grilled pineapple and possibly some other things added to the sandwich. It was sweet, salty, and delicious. The standard vegan burger was also very good. They now offer burgers made out of Beyond Meat, which has a much different consistency and flavor compared to Vege-Way's own burger patty recipe. The house patty is very tough and chewy, whereas the Beyond Meat is softer and fluffier.   The seasoned curly fries here are excellent. The strawberry milkshake was out of this world good. It was so smooth, creamy, and sweet, and went perfectly with the burger and fries.   Vege-Way offers up simple but high quality vegan fast food at an excellent price and is definitely worth trying for vegans in the area as well as meat eaters who wish to decrease their meat consumption.

xlua85QN9myqe1pxl6wzKQ.text: Try the spicy chick'n sandwich if you like spice!! it is not on the menu but they do have it. As always, add jalapeno to make this Om nom nom chompsky pop.    Go Veg!   #vegan #AnimalRights #OneLove #vegetarian  there's a WiFi called soy based 666. Heil Seitan!!

1Kk2FD67-PX_huxZKIYLRQ.text: I'm not Vegan nor Vegetarian, but I actually enjoyed the food!  The burger was good & filling, and even after finishing the entire burger, I didn't feel bloated or guilty for eating an entire burger! Lol  The shakes were good too, but after a while, the soy milk has a unique after taste  Curly fries reminded me of the ones I ate in my High School cafeteria, but less greasy.  Popcorn chicken was okay, and I'd be okay not trying that again.  I'd definitely come back to try their Banh Mi & Fried Zucchini

8Zn0QbUYK2kTh7BM01wvBA.text: First vegan fast food restaurant in Las Vegas. I got the "cheeseburger", curly fries and a strawberry milkshake. The burger was good but the ingredients seemed to be upside down (lettuce on the bottom with the patty on top) but that's minor. The curly fries tasted like regular curly fries. The milkshake was made with a mix of almond and coconut milk and it was thick, creamy and super strawberry-y. My only complaint about the visit was that it was super slow. The restaurant was empty so I don't know what the hold up was but our milkshakes took 20 minutes. Maybe it was the drive-thru holding things up?

v2zb6mkLoVS8J8Br6dJfIA.text: This review is so hard for me because Vege-way could be  such a hidden gem. However, unfortunately due to inconsistency & several negative experiences they only get a star from me.  POSITIVE: Super awesome friendly staff.  Great Concept. Quick service/Drive thru Amazing vegan fast food [which says a lot considering I'm not even vegetarian at all]  However...  Negative:  I found mold spots on & in my burger bun once. Don't get me wrong.. sh*t happens & the manager was super nice & offered me a free meal. But then the next time I came in the zucchini in my zucchini fries barely ceased to exist. My last straw was this week when one of my zucchini fries were literally rotten inside. I tried, I gave Vege-Way several chances & I give up. I hope you all have a better experience :(

g1fEdSAw8OrfoWGL4LZ_Bg.text: First time here.  Went with a friend/co worker who claims he would be open minded to try the food but when we got there, he ordered fries and got scared.   May as well have brought my ex.     The fries were good he claimed.      I had a Vanilla milkshake made with coconut milk and it was good...the cups are small for a large but most places are like that these days, the small cups are now the large cups except at Tropical Smoothie where large is actually a large.  I was a bit sad because I had to order the Beyond Meat burger, I have had that a lot and I wanted to try their burgers but every one is made with mushroom powder and I am HIGHLY allergic to mushrooms and so I decided to just try the Beyond Burger + orange chicken which comes with brown rice.  The Burger was juicy and had vegan cheese which is nice, no Mayo which surprised me but it didnt need it, it was very good, like eating an unhealthy burger at a fast food place.    But healthier and delicious!  The orange chicken was not to my liking, chewy, almost rubbery for me...  Super crispy...  Would I return just for a milkshake?    I dunno, probably not, the burger was good but you can get that a lot closer to my home/work locations so...but I am glad I tried it.  It was super clean, you can see what the cooks are doing (No hidden kitchen)   and they were super friendly and patient with me on my allergies, checking the ingredients and such....  We'll see.   I will update of course should I go back!

WOZANzdeUSYqxjkoNndgLQ.text: Vege-way is a vegan restaurant...with a drive-thru window!  The other day I had the Hawaiian Burger (see photo). It was fabulous! I've also had the "chicken" nuggets, sweet and sour "chicken", the cheeseburger, and vegan milkshakes. All are just as good or better tasting than their meat and dairy counterparts.   The staff is very friendly, and the price point (around $5 per item) is a great value. Thanks for making vegan food delicious, affordable and convenient, Vege-way!

wH0LFyriFu6PJaCiFMRqrQ.text: I know that Carl's Jr & other places have started carrying the impossible or beyond burger. But at Vege-Way I know that my burger is 100% vegan with no cross contamination. Plus supporting our own local vegan chef. Chef Kenny succeeds in having the first vegan In & Out burger in Vegas. I had 2 burgers protein- style : jalapeno burger with fresh sliced jalapenos (2 napkins needed) & the Hawaiian burger with cheese, tomato, pineapple & sauce making it a full 4 napkin burger. Yummy & they were only $4.99 each. I definitely don't need to go to a restaurant to pay much higher prices for the Beyond or Impossible burgers. Chef Kenny's creations are tastier.

1ef-kDbDGlbQ6e-VgDYRJQ.text: I love Vege-Way hamburgers, they're my sons favorite. The milkshakes are great!   Here's the disappointing part.   Food literally takes forever to get, even to go or in the drive through. My average wait is 20-30 minutes. So disappointing. Also the food is hit and miss, cold fries, under or over cooked hamburgers, soggy scarce monster fires.   The staff seems lackadaisical, and honestly confused half the time. They're are a few great employees that keep us coming back.   Vege-Way needs to get down a solid system to pump out the food far more quickly and efficiently. I'm begging you guys to improve! I want to be a more frequent patron but shouldn't have wait so long for fast food.

hE8rYdRWGgyoXawUg0dN1A.text: So I've been trying to eat better. For me, "Eat better" means less meat, more veggies, less bread. But of course, I won't stick to that 100% of the time. That's where vege-way has been coming in. It's fast food, less guilt. I don't have to think of inhumanely sourced beef or chicken. Instead, I can just bite into whatever I'm eating with less guilt.   Their burger is pretty darn good. It doesn't taste like meat, of course. It has its own kinda earthy taste. I'd like if they had a different patty style, like how jack in the box has a few different types, but I understand that they are new to fast food, so it's a ground up learning experience. I'd also like if they added pickles. I don't really understand this one - pickles are just good.   Their chocolate milkshakes are perfect. Change nothing. The monster fries are pretty good, as are their curly fries. However, my order has now been messed up twice on the fries in two visits, so maybe get that checked out.   It's all worthwhile. A bit of expensive if you upgrade things, but I think it's definitely worth trying.

-4pXetLYqZhhnZ5F0wkcMg.text: I had to try this, after loving Veggie House. And I was not disappointed! The cheeseburger tastes so satisfyingly meat-like, it almost puts you in shock!

jy4tA2d4B2r3_3DpHhlWLg.text: Love the food.  Just not so keen about the prices.  The sizes of the shakes have been downsized since opening day, while the prices hasn't.  Drive thru is extremely slow, faster to park and go inside to order.  Small (maybe about 10 tables) so gets extremely crowded when busy.

LQjJoK6zEs2E5KVw8D4AAw.text: This place is amazing. Worth a cab ride off the strip, some of the best vegan fast food I've ever had.

KcJyPehn-La6ZoYOk8Mckw.text: Great vegan food, but the young people behind the counter keep the gangster rap, hip-hop, grunge metal, and punk-rock music turned up so loud that it ruins the dining experience.  I suggest the drive thru.

q4G7kzGJZ-lgy9RC1D6Yzw.text: Initially upon arriving, we thought the food was decent. First few bites were delicious. The more we ate of our burgers though, the worse the meal seemed to taste. Next couple days, 2/3 of us felt incredibly sick to our stomachs and had some serious allergic reactions. We had contacted then for ingredients to our food with a promise to receive an email within 48 hours, but the email never arrived. As someone who eats healthy vegan 24/7, this is not the way to go. Vegan does not mean healthy, and it shows.

XtqrXHXDl-tuMoGAAlN8xg.text: The popcorn chicken was chewy, and the fries were cold. The wrap I got was really more like a burrito. I was quite confused by it all, and I'm vegan.

bgeAW9XIq8e5e_dwRCPBtw.text: i wish their menu was more inept, but even with as simple as it is it's so good. with it being made by the same dude as Veggie House - i wouldn't expect any less! try their buffalo chicken sammich :) so yum

cE-FP9bqRhEls41_1ORFKg.text: I wish I could give 5 stars because the food was great. The service, however, was not. I ordered 2 meals and a side of popcorn chicken. I waited 20 minutes for my food, and after seeing people who ordered after me receive their food first, I went up to the counter to ask. There were no cars in the drive thru and no other customers and the employees were just standing around talking. When I asked the reply that I got was an "oh, sorry". No further apologies or anything, which was pretty disappointing.

B1W4j4xa6NW5_J_VgbKVvA.text: Best vegan burger I have ever had! Zucchini strips excellent too.  Now two great restaurants from Chef K.  Thanks for brining such excellent vegan food to us.

i8RxqYYHnvtmwwNDpLNfSA.text: This is an awesome place to eat for any Vegan/Vegetarian or even for people who are just looking to cut back on their meat intake & try something new! All of the food tastes GREAT and the customer service is always good. They have a pretty good menu selection, which is nice for Vegans who are used to being limited in what they are able to order when eating out. I highly recommend this restaurant, my fiance & I eat here at least twice a month and have never had a bad experience!

1QmaT6uMRdVb1hZLaQBqGA.text: It's pretty good, I want to come back to try it again. Is it the same as animal meat? No, but much of the same sensation of eating burgers is there. I wasn't too impressed by the French fries and think that could help make it better overall. I will be back again

bMru7oniqo5yFPxCCA2gBA.text: Food is great but service leaves a lot to be desired. If it's your first time going I recommend going in down time because it seems if there are more than 2 or 3 other groups/customers the staff can't handle it. This is the second time I've ordered vegan burgers without cheeze and have gotten cheeze both times. This time the person taking my order didn't repeat it back to me and rushed me through it, and of course things are wrong. Stop by if you don't see any cars in the drive-thru or customers in line.

21_xqAueKkwZsKJqgK3Ufw.text: Went to the VegeWay restaurant and had a very good experience with the food.  it had just opened.  there was a large rush during the lunch time push.  The staff there was working very hard behind the counter to get everything out in time.  There is a really small menu.  They offer a single and double burger.  You get lettuce and tomato.  You have to include your own pickles which are off to the side.  You can get fries and coke to make it a meal.  its approximately ten to 12 bucks per person. There are some other side dish things like fake nuggets.  I have no idea about those things.  They also offer shakes and I didn't have one of those.  Regarding the hamburger, It was one of the better vegan hamburgers I have ever had.  I liked everything about it including the bun.  Each person I was with liked the burger.  We had about (between the four of us) more than 60 years experience combined in eating meat and dairy free.  I don't think it will take me that long to come back.  This is a good place and I will continue to support it.

COvovD0_VcoVtccxWQ5keg.text: Amazeballs !!! I have discovered the Vegan In-N-Out... The burger is very good for vegan. Tastes like a regular beef burger. Curly fries were seasoned perfectly & crispy.  And we also had the white chocolate peanut butter milk shake. Delish! Not overly sweet & tasted like a regular milkshake. All in all, great food, great service. My only complaint is I read about vegan cheese & I had asked for no cheese. They mistakenly added the cheese & it's the only thing I do not recommend on the burger. But the owner offered another burger without the cheese (very nice of him) but I wasn't that hungry. I will definitely return again and again. And a second location to open soon (early next year) so I will definitely frequent the new place. Go Vegeway! Loved it!

SPOJ2sKyme4S9gk-6VFPoQ.text: I am not a vegetarian or vegan and I love this place! Yes there are things on the menu that are not my favorite but there is nothing I would not eat there. The fact that there is a place to pick up a quick bite to eat, on the go, and not be a meat protein based, is awesome. Some other reviewers complain that it's not healthy, but what fast food restaurant is, if you want healthy you should hit up a salad bar or smoothie place.

oR_OJh1nQPezJeWUNjC1oA.text: OH MY GOODNESS! Best vegan burger EVER! I'm so stoked I found this place. I can't describe it you gotta try it yourself.

IZxRrjofReADXHwCnOs5_g.text: A drive-thru vegan restaurant? Not only is the food here amazing, it comes out so fast. The nice lady who took our order was very patient and accommodating. The Vegan Beef Sandwich was one of the best Banh Mi I've ever tasted. Everything here is good and you don't even have to get out of your car. Can't wait to come back!

dzwfMKcESIGeoslW_o0yYw.text: My husband literally found this place today and we just HAD to try it out, especially after reading all the positive reviews. So the whole family headed over to try it out and we were all extremely satisfied. We ordered a single burger meal, double burger meal, popcorn chicken, fried zucchini, and a chocolate milkshake. As someone who isn't a vegetarian but has been trying to make healthier choices like cutting out meat from my diet this place made me want to go full on vegan if I could have this everyday. The burger as many others said in their review was the veggie version of In-N-Out and not lacking on taste. The cheese as a few have said left a sweet after taste that I didn't like but my husband who likes sweet stuff didn't mind at all, at the end it depends on your taste, maybe have different vegan cheese options? I could sit here and rave forever about the food but why do that when you could just go and try it out for yourself? That's right, hurry and go try it out now! Last but not least the place was very clean as well as the bathrooms. You will also see chef Kenny the owner in his white chef's coat walking around greeting people and cleaning off tables after customers leave. Also it's a small dining area so when it's busy it can be hard to find a spot to sit and eat, not to mention if you have a little one like myself there are no highchairs, so be prepared to hold them on your lap as you eat. Other than that excellent place!

7zCoXc3SOj6Fm6CFLTeVhg.text: Absolutely delicious!!!!     My partner had the double cheese burger just as I did. He had a mango shake which was sweet, but not overly sweet. The shake was smooth, silky... and just fabulous!  We also had zucchini and sweet potatoes...they were good, but nothing out of the ordinary. The main star, the burgers, were THE BEST VEGAN burgers that I have ever eaten ...I have been a vegetarian for 22 years.   I know that VegeWay is brand new (I showed up on the 2nd and 4th day)...so the drive through was a little bit slow. However, I have worked in restaurants in the past and know that when one opens a new place, it takes a good week to iron out the kinks. So, I didn't factor that into my review.  I will be taking meat-eatering family to VegeWay!

HqBZ-aCwEYvsza-0B3tKdg.text: This place's burgers are fantastic! The fries and other items could use a bit more in the consistent quality department. The service is a bit erratic, and do NOT go to the alternate location (it is under different ownership.   This is definitely a welcome niche market for those looking to support cruelty free fast food that hits the spot.

0zmY0jNzN3n9pUIKHmANrA.text: Update: just reading threw some of these reviews it's insain that some people find the need to nit pick this place for every last detail! People not used to vegan cheese saying it tastes funny, complaining about it being busy ??its the 1st vegan drive thru in Vegas hellloo  it's going to be busy. Can people leave constructive critisism? ....having an opinion  is one thing but knocking a place that's promoting compassion to animals that's just asking for bad karma. Seriously let's appreciate the fact that we have a vegan drive thru in our city....if u dont like Vegeway take your wining to McDonalds!   And fyi... The burgers are freakin bomb here! Chef Kenny is bomb, and the customer service was bomb!

LQ0g1EY__FekPXcnFnmfkQ.text: This place is amazing!  It's hard to find vegan options in vegas let alone a place that's entirely vegan!   DO NOT pass up any of their vegan milk shakes!! They are all amazingly clean and crispy and super refreshing and it doesn't make you feel like shit like a normal milkshake that comes along with a stomach ache!!  If you are going to get their burgers make sure you order ur with out their vegan cheese because they do use Daiya which isn't the best vegan cheese option! I cAn put up with it but most people can't! I wish they would switch to something from field roast  their vegan cheese is way way better!  Their Curley fries and sweet potato fries are off the hook! Bomb and they def use clean oil because you can taste and smell the fries when they come out!!   Customer service is pretty average for a fast food  joint! But to say the least awesome quick stop for the vegas vegan!!!  Shout out to the owner for opening up this place it's  awesome wish there was one on the north die by Durango and the 95

i0kjefBb-28DPPvPRBGXQg.text: Long story short, VegeWay delivers exactly what is promised: vegan fast food.  I love love LOVE when new vegan restaurants open up! It made me even more happy to see a line around the corner for their drive thru on opening day. While I usually don't like when vegan spots use soy to replace everything meat-like (yes, soy is in everything here), I had to give this place a try. I tried their fish tacos and a burger. I thoroughly enjoyed all the toppings on the taco, and the "fish" did taste exactly like fish to me. When the burger came out, I was a little disappointed that I didn't get any lettuce or tomato. I told the cashier, "I ordered mine with everything." He then lifted the bun to show me that, indeed, there was a thin slice of tomato and a little piece of lettuce inside my burger. I was then reminded that this is fast food. If this were a nice sit down restaurant, I would have had a problem with this. You cannot go to this place and expect great restaurant quality meals. Do not go to this place and expect healthy vegan meals either. Vegeway is fast food, as it advertises itself to be.   That may or may not be your cup of tea, but the concept is fantastic! Vegeway is a vegan restaurant that is clearly unhealthy; however, I would much rather have people eat unhealthy plant based food than unhealthy animal based food. This place is a great way for non-vegans/meat-lovers/fast food goers to incorporate some less damaging veganism into their lives!

gbmRQnLRBWqEXGzHYGk_XA.text: I give very few 5-star reviews, but this place definitely deserves one -- excellent vegan food served drive-thru or at the counter with indoor seating, friendly service, all at a very reasonable, actually inexpensive price!  I arrived around 7:45PM on a Wednesday, 2 days after their soft opening & 2 days before their official grand opening.  The drive-thru was busy, and there were a lot of customers inside, but the wait in-line was brief & the counter staff was very friendly.  I ordered a Double burger meal, so that came with fries (I chose curly) & a soft drink -- all for about $10!    A small table had become available after I ordered, so I sat down after filing my cup with Dr Pepper, & waited for my order # to be called.  It took about 10 minutes -- very reasonable based on how busy the place was.  I added ketchup & mustard, refilled my drink with Raspberry Iced Tea & sat down to enjoy the meal.  I've been a vegetarian for almost 30 years, having all sorts of vegetarian & vegan burgers over the decades.   Some people prefer the type that do have similar consistency & flavor of beef, some prefer those made more of a mix of vegetable products & that don't really have the flavor of beef.    I tend to fall into the former category, and the burger was absolutely phenomenal!  The only downside is that it was pretty messy to eat -- the (vegan) cheese product made the two vegan meat patties slip & slide.  The fries were good but nothing all that special, and I learned the hard way that the Raspberry iced tea machine needs to be calibrated better, as the liquid product barely had tea or raspberry flavors (compared to the identical machine at other places).  After wolfing down my food, I was in a feeding frenzy.   I wanted another burger.   Turns out the guys at the table next to me were thinking the same thing.   It's not because there wasn't enough food in our initial orders, it was because the burgers tasted so good!  I ended up getting two more double burgers to go, & brought them home.    It's very tempting to eat one right now at 3:30AM but I'm fighting the temptation.   Even with two Double burgers in my refrigerator, I'm somewhat planning on my return trip to VegeWay.      For better or worse, it's on the opposite side of LV from me & in an area that I just haven't had a need to be in often.  But the food/price at VegeWay is so nice that unlike most other restaurants, this place will be a destination for me & I expect to be a frequent customer.  If you're a vegetarian/vegan that tries to avoid food that has the texture & flavor of meat & poultry, you don't have a need to try VegeWay.  Otherwise though, you should definitely try it.  Even if you're not a vegan/vegetarian, you should give their food a try if you're curious.     On a future visit, I'll give some of their other products a try.  Obviously, as a vegan restaurant, the clientele is rather limited.  However, there are enough of us in the LV area to keep this place fairly busy, even after the newness  wears off.       Think of it kind of like an In & Out Burger place for vegans & vegetarians -- comparatively inexpensive, flavorful food & friendly, intelligent staff.  The drive-thru lines can get kind of long & the strip mall parking lot isn't really set-up for long drive-they lines.   Also the interior seating area is kind of small, so especially at prime-time lunch & dinner hours, the place may be crowded, however based on my experience last night, the wait isn't bad, & very much worth it.  They do have wifi for customers, but it's secured so I guess you have to ask for the password (it wasn't posted).  The only negative thing I can think of is that the vegan milkshakes looked kind of small for the $5 price, but maybe that's just me being a cheapskate.  There are plenty of nice, expensive vegan/vegetarian restaurants in Vegas, but the only place I know for sure I'll show-off to my vegan & vegetarian friends that come to town will be VegeWay, & I'd love to have my carnivore friends give it a try too.

e3Uzn0gGcicqjc-YT9ZbCg.text: Now that I've tried almost everything on the menu, I feel fairly qualified to write a review that may help the Vegeway newbie out, and maybe even the owner, as there are just a couple of tweaks that would make this place a solid 5 stars. To make it more readable, I'll divide by category:  The excellent: 1. Beef sandwich. This is reminiscent of a banh mi sandwich; light, yet filling, slightly sweet and spicy, and refreshing from the cilantro and shredded carrot. This is my favorite item on the entire menu. 2. Chocolate shake. No one would be able to tell this isn't a regular chocolate shake. Perfect texture and chocolaty-ness.   The very good: 1. Cheeseburger. Yep this satisfies all the cravings for cheesy, decadent, filling, and "meaty". It would have been excellent except the cheese isn't quite there. It has a slightly plastic/fake flavor. I know vegan cheese is tricky but I've had better. 2. Vanilla shake. It ain't no chocolate shake but perfect texture. I can tell this is a nondairy milkshake which is fine, but you won't fool anyone with it. 3. Chicken wrap. This was much bigger than I expected, it looks and feels like a huge 5-pound burrito. I'm not sure if it's supposed to be served hot or cold because it looked like it was grilled yet when I took a bite it was room temperature and the tortilla seemed slightly stale. Still, this is another dish that will satisfy that comfort food craving.   Room for improvement: 1. Fries. I tried both sweet potato and regular fries on two different days and they were soggy both times. There is just no excuse for soggy fries and instead of them being a delicious accompaniment to your sandwich they're just a pile of disappointment. Please Vegeway, fix this and I'll come more often.  2. The Cajun sauce. So much potential but not executed well. Not enough zip or flavor. Sauces are easy, come on guys. 3. Strawberry shake. Strawberry shakes can either be amazing or just taste off. Unfortunately this tasted off. Just no. 4. Popcorn chicken. Not terrible but it just tastes like fried balls of dough. I couldn't really discern where the outside ended and the inside began. Nothing "chicken-y" about it in my opinion, but if you like eating anything fried and don't really care what it is, this may be for you.    I also have to add that the customer service is excellent. Always an enthusiastic greeting when you're coming and going. They'll help you choose what to get and everyone is very friendly. There are a handful of tables but it gets crowded at lunch on the weekend, but I can't vouch for other times. I live about 30 minutes away but I will definitely be back. They've hit on a niche market and they've just about hit a grand slam. Go and see for yourself, and I guarantee you'll be back for more.

UdDy0yRMc6zVoiKZ-NETFA.text: It's a good thing I don't live by this place because I would eat there every day!!! Delicious, easy, and decently priced. On this day, I was feeling particularly lazy so I wanted a drive-thru. A rare find for a vegan. I decided to try this place for the first time, it did not disappoint! I had a burger and curly fries and they were yummy. The burger was a little rich, but that's just because I rarely eat anything like this. Good for a once in awhile place!

Sutb3LnGMSeMdl9Ib891aA.text: Came here on a Sunday afternoon with my daughter. We ordered the single veggie burger with cheese, fried zucchini, and the cilantro chicken salad with the tumeric dressing. We both enjoyed it thorougly ans the food came quick. The service was fast and the cashiers were friendly.   I am happy to find this alternative place to eat at instead of the other joints. I'll be making my way here alot more frequently.   We need more places like this in Vegas, everyone needs to come here to support.  :-)

V1CjO5jhN4gqAmKMcjcflQ.text: Chef Kenny did a spectacular job with this restaurant and so far everything I've tried did not disappoint. The vanilla milkshake and vegan burger with curly fries is my go-to and is always delicious. I like their flavored dipping sauces too because they are SO tasty. Still have many items to try from Vegeway but with Chef Kenny's track record of delicious food, I know I'm in for a treat!  As a tip, prices are a little bit more than your average fast food joint. However, when you think about all of the really amazing ingredients that Kenny uses to create these tasty meals, it all boils down to QUALITY OVER QUANTITY! Yes it is still "fast food" but it's got to be better for you than most of the other fast food chains out there.  Love coming here and hope Kenny opens a location closer to the north side of town soon.

JE1EhTbiIgUwW4Vm4TlDVw.text: Taste wise--blah.. not so good. Patty Burger tasted too much starch. Needs to work on service and presentation.   We were not properly greeted. Person took our order didn't appear to want to be there. She is probably an inexperienced cashier. Didn't know how to suggest sales and wasn't friendly.   Their burgers don't look appetizing at all. See a pic I took when it came out. They literally slapped two buns and some patties and veggie (hardly any) and a ton of melted "cheese" that didn't taste right--we know how vegan cheese should taste like.

For a place called VegeWay, there's a serious lack of veggies on the menu.   Tried the deep fried zucchini, it seemed like the oil they cooked it in was too cold or something. They honestly just tasted like grease soaked, lightly breaded veggies. Ick.

wa2u6GfkWHKx32YxENQ0wQ.text: AMAAAZZIING!  When I became vegan I thought I'd have to give up burgers, fries and shakes. Thank the culinary gods for Vegeway because the food is seriously divine. It satisfies that fast food craving like none other! But really anything Chef Kenny is involved in is bound to produce some f-ing awesome vegan food. 10/10 highly recommend to vegans AND non-vegans.

zNHdiMiwrM-0JatXRe8Xdg.text: A friend and I came today and had burger meals. They were absolutely delicious. I've been before, but he was super impressed with how "real" the burgers taste. He's not vegan, but he commented numerous times about how easily the food could pass for non-vegan food.

Wiqrk7cKZqZmLw0x2fR1MA.text: You know, last visit I had here was OK. Long wait time. This time no wait, but the girl serving me was so rude because I questioned the total of my order. I got a veggie burger combo and it was $10.54. No problem paying it, but it seemed a little much. They were also out of everything I originally wanted which really ticked me off especially because my fries were soggy and had zero flavor to them and were cold. But for the most part, the girl having an attitude with me put me over. Didn't say thank you, nothing. Get a personality.

5hpNxyvrqtJpeEpoa3QmEA.text: This is the spot for a yummy fast food experience. I'm not vegan (but considering a shift) and I still enjoyed the burger and banh mi. They are thinking carefully about flavor and texture at VegWay and I appreciate it. I'd suggest that new customers: 1) arrive at an off time, 2) try everything,  and 3) share it with an open-minded friend. It's not healthy food, but it's so yummy and it's nice to have a fast food option that doesn't include animal protein.   Yes, there were issues with mistakes in people's orders (60% of the orders while we were there).  Yes, the food output was slow.  But I still can't wait to return. The food was delicious (I want that "milk"shake recipe NOW), the cashier was incredibly warm and helpful, and the cook came over and talked to us about the food. He took immense pride at having prepared it.   My biggest complaint is that I have to drive so far to get there. I am a fan.

OOll2WQyFB0F38ZJ4Q22rw.text: Yes. 5 stars for vegan fast food. Chickn nuggets and burgers are excellent if you're looking for something on the go. This chain needs to spread all across the states!

H-VDoQ7rEjqs7fktX3I2hA.text: Hi Yelpers. I recently took the trip to VegeWay's Centennial's location. I cannot comment on the decor of the inside, I decided on the drive-thru. I decided to go with three stars on this review, so bare with me and I will explain why. For starters, let me begin by stating for the record, that I was somewhat mislead by the "name" and with that the trouble began.    So let me begin with the food was okay, not the best I've ever had and certainly not the worst I've ever had. I realized very quickly that I wasn't eating from a traditional "vegetarian restaurant", but more so a restaurant that specialized in "meatless options". Two completely different types of establishments. This place in my option is for meat eaters who want to take a break from eating meat once in awhile.   My order:  I ordered the double cheese burger combo, and upgraded to the sweet potato fries and a strawberry tea. The burger was good, and fries were hot and the tea was good. The smell was amazing and I couldn't wait to get my food home to take a bite. During the ride back home, I reached in and grabbed a few fries and they were slathered in "GREASE". Now, I realize that they had to cook the fries which involves frying them, but I could taste the grease and had to blot out the fries. Once I arrived home, I open the meal and dumped the fries out on paper towel to save my save the trouble of blotting the fries one by one. Overall, the burger was good but it also dripped oil and was quite messy. I realized quickly that it wasn't worth spending $12 bucks for a meatless greasy burger, fake cheese and greasy fries. I didn't feel healthy at all, I ended up with a stomach ache.   The review is a honest one, which is my opinion. I would urge everyone to go and try this place. I was impressed with the taste of the meatless burger, and for that reason I gave the place "3 stars" but for anyone who watches what they eat like I do and cares about their caloric intake skip what I had and maybe go with another menu option. I'll pass since I limit my consumption of fried foods, but to each their own.

jajTHZSblWzMRbjIQ0H1yw.text: Just had an experience there that was frustrating enough I had to Yelp about it before we even eat the food. We walked in to blaring EDM music with screaming tracks. As in, 1am downtown bar loud and most of the staff were dancing and head banging to it.   Listen to whatever you want -- I was 18 once too, but it's not the Electric Daisy Carnival, you're at freaking work. Turn it down.   We were going to eat there, got it to go so we didn't have to listen to that.  Not surprisingly, when I ordered, the cashier couldn't hear that I ordered two double combos. We pay and walk over to the right and realize we didn't get cups. I turn around and politely ask "hey can we grab the cups?"  The next minute was like an SNL skit of what everyone complains about millennials.   Rather than just say something normal like "oh, I'm sorry, I didn't hear you asked for combos, let me charge for the difference," (aka: what to do when a totally understandable mistake happens...not a big deal) the cashier starts rudely (and totally unnecessarily) arguing with me on whether or not I ordered combos.  Seriously. I'm having this conversation. Well, trying to, I can barely hear over the music.    Even says "Oh, and like you didn't even tell me what kind of fries you want," like that was his big evidence to make sure I knew I was the one in the wrong. Because, of course, the customer is totally responsible for knowing there are options on that one.   After a little more equally unnecessary back and forth he finally says "uh I guess I can fix it." Thanks, dude. That should have been Plan A.  I've been there before and had everything been fine, but this experience kinda killed it for me. Definitely a lapse in management to have walked into the restaurant looking and being run like that.

2eqUSD7Q6JSXwKOMLg0p_g.text: Decided to give this place a try as a friend had recently changed to a Vegan diet and I had recently stopped eating meat. First impressions when walking in- looks like a old fast food restaurant with old rickety tables, dirty floor.  We were so hungry and were already there so we gave it a try. I had the house made burger with vegan cheese lettuce, tomato and grilled onions and curly fries my friend had the beyond burger along with fries , she also tried the orange chicken. Burger and fries were ok nothing I would come back for. My friend said the orange chicken was ok but needed way more sauce. What was the biggest turn off was that the cashier up front , and the drive thru cashier were handling money making orders  and never once  changed their gloves.  In the areas where the napkins were along with the ketchup you pump yourself the tops of the ketchup was dirty. Eat at your own risk

1_h7BtRm3ryAOhwzdEOsxQ.text: Let me start by saying that I am impressed by just the fact that I found a vegan fast food restaurant! It's a small building, but easy to find if you're not from the area. They don't have a lot of options on the menu so that was kind of a let down, but I still give props for it being one of the only drive thru vegan restaurants.   I ordered the cheeseburger and I was feeling extra hungry that day so I also got 2 fish tacos (odd combination I know). The wait in the drive thru was like 10 minutes so that kind of irritated me, it's supposed to be FAST food right?! Finally came to my turn at the window and it took another 5 minutes or so for me to get my food and I was so hungry after a long day, grrr! I finally got to try the food and the burger was very good! The only thing I didn't really like was the sauce in it because it had an odd sweet flavor that didn't go with the burger at all. And for the fish tacos.......I was so disappointed! And I LOVE fish tacos! They tried, but I've had much better vegan fish tacos and again the flavor combinations just weren't there.  Whenever I go back to Vegas I'll definitely try out this place again and get the burger, just without the sauce!

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan burger! Impressive, but the sweet sauce in it I wasn&#39;t too fond of. $4.49

yCJObRxM_qCg9MeujNiohA.text: Love the soy free vegan burgers, reminds me of an In N Out burger, thanks chef Kenny!!

Vh_TccX-j2-NehiKX7iAhA.text: I waited 40 minutes in the drive through only for them to forget the cheese and pickles on my burger, at that point I didn't even figure it was worth going back to ask where the cheese was. I ordered a milk shake (five stars), fish tacos (five stars), curly fries, double vegan burger, and chicken wrap. The burger tasted like egg foo young but less eggy and the consistency was amazing. The chicken wrap should have just been marketed as an avocado wrap because that's all I could taste. The fish tacos seem to be the best thing on the menu but they were slightly watery, the flavor profile was delicious. I gave it three stars because customer service was subpar and the food wasn't the best I'd had when it came to vegan/veg options. I'd say that aside from Shake Shacks mushroom burger that this place provides the best healthy lifestyle alternatives to eating meat. I just wish the customer service was better.

OlcXKea9WGXLZu6NoPV8jw.text: Ive been vegan for almost 4 months now and this place is really good. I always get the "burger only" and it always hits the spot. But today, i had a bad experience. I decided to try out theyre orange chicken and it was very unpleasant. First off, ive had many "chikn" alternative, the texture is almost like baked potatoes, easy to chew, not grainy and very moist texture. This orange chicken i was eating from their establishment was grainy and tough i had to yank my teeth away each bite i took. Finally, taking a big bite of one of the bits, a string of -watever the fuck - was unchewable, having me to spit it out. Idk if that was a vein or wat but it was discusting. If this was a soy product, this would not have happened. And the orange chicken sauce is gross. Its very bland barely sweet. Dont think i will return, now i feel like this not a real plant based establishment. And im starting to think their dressing and shakes are also made with dairy product.

5XAKjxe_6bx4YzBRg4fzNA.text: I love this place!!!! I was so excited to learn about a vegan place like this in Vegas. Tried it for the first time today. Everything I got was delicious. Vegan burger, curly fries, popcorn chicken and vanilla shake. I liked the cheese that came on the burger. I will so be back!

LTBoJpKpYhM2xd45Q8ZgNQ.text: Everything is delicious!! We aren't vegan but have been trying new options for our diet because we have been eating unhealthy from the holidays. Let me tell you I LOVed it. Total shock it doesn't taste like fake meat it's all made fresh and the owner Kenny is great he actually cares. He says he coming up with a couple more restaurants for vegan option. I can't wait. The food is filling but light I feel like I put real food in my body even though it's "fast food" it tastes like homemade

5yqb0RU3SSJf2zJQYss9ig.text: Today was my first time visiting this place and I let them know. They went out of their way to make sure it was a really great experience. Super friendly Plus the food was so perfect ! I was the only vegan in the bunch but I wanted to eat some fast food with everyone & by the time I got my food my friends were raving about how good it looked/smelled. I tried vegan Ranch for the first time! It was Amazing & I don't even like regular ranch. So glad I found this place on this trip. It's like a vegan in & out,so if you loved that place as an omnivore then you will love this as a vegan!

nzMnAjiD3hKVYG7qajzidw.text: I did feel a tinge of excitement at the thoughts of a vegan burger...like a fast food place with health in mind.   Even though burgers have been off my radar for  at least 4 years due to my more plant based eating it was fun finding one to eat that actually looked and tasted like an ole time burger.  Good JOB!  You should market these big time.  Location is a bit out of  my way. But I take comfort knowing you ARE 'out there' when I get a craving urge.  I have shared your business information with like minded friends.  We should support forward thinking restaurants.

CsGERP3PiA8X3OyQuB8z3g.text: I went to this place for the first time a few days ago. I ordered the cheeseburger with fries, a strawberry milkshake, and popcorn chicken. The cheeseburger was decent, the milkshake was pretty good, but the popcorn chicken was the best and it comes with a side of ranch. The inside of the restaurant had decent seating and they have an outdoor patio as well. I thought that the customer service could've been a little better as the people were blah. I also wish that their curly fries, or all of the fries in general, were made fresh in house, but I noticed that they weren't as the workers were taking them out of plastic bags. Overall, if I'm ever in the area again and I need some vegan fast food I would definitely consider stopping by.

60v5jNy6k7MxMIoWRQ01OQ.text: Enjoyed the burger very much. Chicken nuggets were GREASY and their drive thru was frustrating. Bad intercom. A little overpriced, but convenient for the meatless hunger. I'll give 'em another try.

tVQWr_2uTCxnXfbTPICQxw.text: Vegan Drive thru, milkshake and burger, dank as no other. Better then any fast-food joint you can find. If you are going through Vegas worth the stop!!

j_9fNjhLF4Gp8RQGMpcJjg.text: Nothing special in the looks department, it's  just a basic fast food joint.    But the good is 100% vegan.  And it's all delicious too.  Even grandma thought so, and she's old school meat and potatoes type!  The vegeburgers were good.  The mock chicken wrap was divine, could have fooled almost any staunch carnivore.  Filling too!  The best was the popcorn "chicken".  An absolute dead ringer for the real thing.  Well done, Vegeway!  We'll be back.

Sl2xR6fw4lC_i5topru-Vg.text: We were passing through Vegas on the way home from Utah and had to check this place out.  I ordered a Double Vegan Cheeseburger meal and my companion had a Chicken Ranch sandwich that was not on the regular menu.  My burger was good but really messy.  I also wish I had ordered a single instead of a double but my eyes are always bigger than my stomach.  The fries were good too but I was too full to eat many after that burger!  I would definitely stop again and maybe try the fish next time.

aU7GHn53U-NG1Xv3vfz6pQ.text: All hail Chef Kenny! He did it again with VegeWay! Finally a fast food restaurant for Vegans! He brought the amazing salads from his other restaurant. The burgers, fries and dairy free milkshakes are the best. You don't even realize they are meat free. But Chef, when are you gonna open something for the Vegans in Henderson?!?!

1BOxx5SBODBjCMgQj2tuUw.text: The burger wasn't the best vegan burger I've ever had, but it was pretty good. It was really close to a In-n- out burger.

N5rffaBKmAQSLSk6Ybpb8g.text: I had the Vegan Double Burger and sweet potato fries and was extremely satisfied. Great taste and will need to come back to try the fish burger. All in all, great food and will come back again.

N6q8D-YuAv22aI_2HZqVjQ.text: Ummm. Love veggie house, but this place was greasy. I suppose that's the point? The food was falling apart as we ate it. I wouldn't make a the trek again. Might give it a second try, but wasn't super impressed with the first. Perhaps my expectations were too high.

a4O1MTHJn4Zm-_z7sKVX5w.text: Chef Kenny has really outdone himself !!! Cruelty free, clean food from a DRIVE THRU !! The quality and taste is phenomenal. The burger & popcorn chicken are the stars that I've tried so far. Now I need to work my way through the rest of the menu !! The service was super cheery , especially considering how busy this newly opened hotspot is. This is a great guilt free meal as a treat or if you just don't feel like cooking, I'll be back ! THANK YOU Kenny

hcmFPPFVxSNfVbqBz6QCug.text: Tried VegeWay for the first time today even though it's right down the street from my house... when it first opened I pulled through the drive through and left because the menu looked cheap and outdated... today we decided to go and try the veggie burgers and curly fries.... the fries were great  I dunno what kind of oil the fry them in tho... the burger was pretty good but I would have liked a multi gain bun... really the only down side and what makes me never wanna go inside again is THE SEWAGE SMELL COMING FROM THE LADIES ROOM.... first thing I smelled when I walked in... it was really gross and I hope they do something about that!!

0czbc3yRcXE6YbdZOSYyXw.text: SOOOOO GOOD. I'm not even a vegetarian, but trying to eat less red meat. Honestly didn't even miss the meat. Sweet potato fries and strawberry shake also very tasty.   My only complaint is that this place doesn't have a nutrition facts list for their items. (Is that even legal?) I over ordered so that I could try their food but I bet it's high in calories, so I didn't feel like I should finish it all. Hard to have any kind of idea how many calories or fats are in the food. Nevertheless, a good cheat meal if you're craving fast food.

pR7R8xj5ZF0eDYLmIo-OPQ.text: I got the burger with fried zucchini.  I didn't really care for the burger patty but it was good enough.  I loved the zucchini!  I tried my friend's curly fries which were also pretty yummy.

0cN30CJkJm-WFnZsn_vBEA.text: The food was good but it was also to greasy. Sadly it wasn't good enough for me to return, but the staff was super friendly.

q7g48URGRTBJCEAh4s0kzQ.text: Being Vegan makes this place heaven.   Tad pricey but worth it.  Love the white chocolate peanut butter shake and the Hawaiian Bbq burger.  Epic.

_3Wy8XrygmpwDzu2zMWy9w.text: Oh my Buddha.  I don't know how someone can say that the burgers are bland.  It was so good!  I wanted to just keep eating it.  I got curly fries and a single burger.  The curly fries were AMAZEBALLS.  The burger made me so happy.  I love how they're next to my hair salon.  It was meant to be.  -tear drop-    I'm so excited to try their other items!

mKNfNJAIsUHas2gqueqvAw.text: Best fast vegan food I've ever had. Sweet potato fries were cooked right. Burger reminded me of in n out. The peppermint oreo shake couldn't fail. The staff were very friendly too.

eCX1kD6ROtD_aSmGej8fHQ.text: From California, and wow! Popcorn chicken, burger, fries, zucchini, wow so delicious! (didn't eat each order by myself lol it was all shared)  But i can't wait to try the milkshakes!  I totally need to own one of these in Orange County California...

TBBK71I30ac3eo7PUssOvQ.text: Today was my first time here and I have to say that the food and service really reminds me of my old fave before going vegan at in-in-out. Burger looked perfect and tasted great too. Fries came out hot and fresh. The drive through attendant answered all of my questions and was super friendly. Thanks for bringing vegan fast food to Vegas! I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6gpflV9TWnZUB-8y6Hip9w.text: Not a vegan, but I observe when traveling with my vegan brother. We stopped by this place on the way back home to California. I still eat at In-N-Out, so I hope it means something coming from me that this place is a worthy alternative.  I had their version of the Double Double, which tasted pretty close to the real deal. The texture of the patty was different, but not bad. Their special sauce also tasted much like In-N-Out's, but was a little runny. Not a huge deal, just a bit messier when dipping fries. They also have equally great non-In-N-Out food like popcorn chicken, curly fries, and wraps.  Finally, the biggest deal for me as a non-vegan who still eats vegan food from time to time, the price! It costs pretty much the same as the non-vegan food they're emulating, without sacrificing flavor. So if you're generally on the fence about vegan food because of the price, this is the place for you.  I really think this place could take off as THE vegan In-N-Out and hope to see them maybe open up a place in CA!

JNGq0AfuDOgjuzxDn_9C8A.text: I give them a 3 Star because of the customer service. I've been here a few times and everytime the customer service is not good, the employees sound like they're miserable. The food is really good though. I've tried their burger and fries and the burger is really good! The wait time is long, I spent 5 minutes at the drive thru window waiting to order. And then more time at the window. If their customer service was better, I'd probably come here more often.

0xOFc8ShVIIXTunXADJjug.text: Veggie House is overpriced. VegeWay is overpriced.   Chef Kenny doesn't care to talk to you if you do not resemble someone he's met in the past as an acquaintance or friend or one who is likely to be a member of Yelp. If you are Caucasian with a North Face jacket on and sporting some horn-rimmed Oliver Peoples glasses, then yes, he will banter with you, but if you are Chinese and from a remote mountain village, then expect to be ignored and denied free samples.  But that was Veggie House. That was then, this is now. I will review VegeWay as VegeWay.  Do not order the hamburger. The patty is dry and the cheese, being vegan, tastes like Elmer's glue. The bun may not be Devonshire butter brioche, but it is an insubstantial mess.  The beef sandwich, an obvious take on the Vietnamese-style banh mi is a poor clone of the iconic sandwich. It isn't freshly baked French bread, but store-bought hoagie. The beef consists of diced pieces of dried soy jerky. For the price here ($6.50 or so) you can get 2 authentic banh mi sandwiches at a Vietnamese bakery.  The fried finger foods are mediocre, but proudly presented as vegan. Enjoy.  I do like the place at night, however, as it resembles one of those retro burger dives one would see still operating in places like Flint, Michigan, but with cheerful employees in their plant-based colored uniforms.  Verdict: Overpriced and mediocre

T5-pGbq5oIkbjoMV6rWH4A.text: Love the fish taco cilantro salad Hawaiian burger strawberry shake and reg fries! Love how there's always new items to try!! Would suggest to have rice bowls!

hbIDRK1sQAOMjTLics46RQ.text: Simple menu, basic looking fast food but wow the hamburgers were so delicious. Got all the fries (regular, sweet potato & curly), a cheeseburger, chickn ranch burger & a white chocolate pb shake. Chikn ranch burger was good, but the cheeseburger is much better. Milkshake was very rich & tasty! Service was quick & all the people working there were so friendly. Im looking forward to a 2nd location opening!

xITY-zx-v5f_9mqtSgAdBg.text: I'm new to the no meat and dairy lifestyle. VegeWay is definitely a must! First trip I ordered the vegan beef sandwich which is like a bahn-mi sandwich. So good!! Next trip I had the Hamburger with grilled onions. Burger was delicious! (They both taste  better than the bad stuff) I love their ranch for my fries and thousand island sauce for my burgers. My meat loving Husband even said it was good! Close to home too, lucky me!

cRckmXds2LfICvnTc_F1SA.text: I absolutely loved the location and the drive thru convenience along with the burger. I have been eating vegan burgers for years and it was delicious. I ordered and the cashier was abrupt with some inaudible words so I pulled up to figure out what's going on. He was walking in circles then finally came to the window and his SHIRT was disgusting. It had so many indistinguishable stains it actually turned my stomach. I felt like I wanted to leave but didn't and was grateful because the food was so great. No one offered to upsell me the sauces so I asked what the flavors are and bought a sauce for a quarter and it was so worth it.  I hope they work out the kinks and can only get better. I would beg for the menu to get on My Fitness Pal so we can track our food and tell us what the ingredients are so we can not miss our diets.

ru3iAPHD5lqGKOk3FegbAQ.text: I will NEVER eat here again. I have given numerous chances to Vegway. When someone orders food deliver what they ordered this is the 4th time I have ordered food and not rec'd what I ordered. And your fries are soggy and gross. Thanks for taking away a vegan restaurant that i loved and what's sad is that I love the chef and veggie house that he owns,  this restaurant is wrecking your name and you need to get it together.

BIl2hlP9YOqjnf5PQZVaqw.text: This is our spot! Great tasting food, drive-thru, and vegan! My wife and I love Vegeway. We live nearby, and it quickly became one of our favorite places to go to when eating out. We've had the menu, minus the tacos, and it has all tasted delicious. The popcorn chicken with curly fries is my go-to order! Though sometimes I deviate and get a beef sandwhich :").  Thanks to Chef Kenny for briging this concept to fruition.

VDsjlIb4mS7OPxedX27S9Q.text: Tried the regular burger and the Hawaiian burger. Also the monster fries.. everything was pretty good. The Hawaiian burger was a little too sweet for my taste, but when I'm craving something greasy and fast this is my new go to place.
