en0GU9svjEL85fbgWKjcDw.text: We were excited to find a vegan fast food restaurant near our Airbnb. Made our order, we were the only ones in the restaurant. There were 4 workers behind the counter. They some how managed to screw up and gave away our food to the people in their drive thru. 15 minutes after our initial order, we still don't have our food. Again, they said they gave our food away to another drive thru person. This time, the drive thru people actually came in the store and said they got the wrong order. Guess what?? It was our food. Please hire more attentive workers. The store wasn't even busy, SMH. We will not be coming back.

lysZsmHtXU_0JfK2pFkY4g.text: I came here when they first opened and I remember thinking it wasn't that good. Came back today and WOW!! I'm so glad I came back! Everything was so delicious. Had the cheeseburger, popcorn chicken, curly fries and a milkshake! Highly recommend !!

6FKcw4j_-kMbMbIrX1jwZw.text: I wanted to go back in and get another burger it was so good.  Also ate the orange chicken and it was soft and tender.  I will be  back for sure.

zxvkSL6OOmKgryrLNBWZQg.text: I'm happy and content. I wasn't sure what to expect as I hadn't read anything about it online. I was a little surprised with the small size of their menu- but no doubt this helps greatly in the speed and quality of their food. I got the popcorn chicken, cheeseburger combo (curly fries and upgraded drink to van milkshake). I was happy with everything that came out of the kitchen. Food was warm fast (even tho they seemed busy inside and had a few cars in drive up) and I thought very well priced compared to other vegan restaurants.   My main suggestion would be to have a few more sauces readily available (only saw ketchup, jalapenos and what I am assuming was a vegan chipotle aioli which was a little bland for me).   Looking forward to going back soon - and maybe smuggling a little siracha in with me :)

8HXXBWPsASbSgAo7iBF1nA.text: Since moving to the West Coast from New York, I've been confronted by all the In-N-Outs, and weeping vegetarian FOMO tears.  Enter the next best thing: a crispy, meaty veggie patty (actually, make that a double) stacked with crisp lettuce and tomatoes, squeezed between a toasted bun with a just a schmear of guac (free but you have to request it). I brought my omnivorous roommate here for his first ever vegan burger and even he was impressed.  I'm normally not a fan of Daiya cheese, which has its own not-quite-cheese flavor to it. In the burger however, it just works. It does stick to your teeth a little, but worth a little flossing for the flavor it adds.  Official prognosis: best vegan fast food burger I've ever had. I definitely see myself becoming a regular.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The double with guac... so good!

HdDnyWZcwb1M8Nqm10UYxQ.text: Not the best, not the worst. It's a tall order to make a vegan burger, and it's a valiant effort, but Vegeway misses the mark in my opinion. Maybe I'm just a spoiled Californian with easy access to the Amy's brand's flagship restaurant but this place left a lot to be desired.  First of all, the restaurant itself lacks any design identity or personality. It feels very hodgepodge and thrown together. Not a good first impression.   We ordered the burger meals with curly fries- they were the highlight of the meal, fried to perfection and piping hot. The burger "supports"- bun, sauce, lettuce, onion, tomato were all nice and fresh, loaded on in-n-out style, and the vegan cheeze was also tolerable, but the patty itself was dry, crusty around the edges, and tastes too much like it's central ingredient- cabbage. The proprietor of the business also owns a vegan Chinese restaurant and it seems there's just a bit too much influence from Asian cuisine/flavors to truly call it the "American" style burger it's aiming to be. I love fusion cuisine when it's intentional and both styles of cuisine are complementary but this felt like the Asian essence was competing with the expected burger flavors.   While they have a few other offerings like popcorn chickin and a fysh sandwich, the menu left a lot to be desired, but it was reasonably priced and service was quick.

Vl3JMKnI9Xd-t5RbWhjTUw.text: I really enjoy the food here but EVERY time.. seriously 4 our of 4!! There is an issue with my order.  1) Wrong food all together.  2) Left out nuggets had to drive back   3) Forgot to put in monster fries because I confused him the kid told me.   4) Waited 20 min for my burger because their printer is not working and none of the 5 employees realized I hadn't been served even though there were only 3 people in the restaurant.  I wish the service here wasn't so poor cause I'd like to come back

9q-KBFE0nCXDLVUlGf1QdA.text: Love the Hawaiian burger and strawberry shake! Love chef Kenny's restaurants!!!!! I love that you feel good after eating here. Looking forward to trying more items on the menu.

g2rsI2jEVXt9jgUcAVxgGw.text: A vegan version of In-and-Out. The burgers are amazing!!! Indescribably delicious. I prefer them without cheese because they use Daiya cheese (not my favorite), but aside from that just utterly tasty and yummy. I usually eat 2 though could easily eat 3. And, the burgers go great with the curly fries.  But, as good as the burgers and fries are, the milkshakes are the BEST. Absolutely the best vegan milkshake around. Chocolate is my favorite and each time I go it seems to be the favorite of most people who are in there as well.  Sooo good and even meat eaters will like it.

3BwEChnlfp1x_jOULMuElQ.text: Good prices. Definitely would go again. Definitely had my fair share of options when I went. Can be described as a vegan in-n-out with the addition of things like popcorn chikn to the menu. Cashier was really rude but I will not let that discount the value of the food.

ntK4BlO0y6HNAB82oK2PsA.text: I love Vege-Way in North Centennial. On Jones...no so much. They lack variety and food supply. They were out of The Beyond Burger before 12pm.   I chose the Spicy Chicken sandwich, curly fries and Strawberry Shake. The "chicken" tasted more like a mushy veggie patty. The spicy sauce was lack luster beyond belief, too many thick onions and tomatoes that made the bun wet!!! Not to mention, the paper that the bun is wrapped in was drenched with sauce on the bottom and wet before I even got a chance to eat it.   I would recommend the other location.   P.S.  they close the shake machine hella early...like McDonald's lol (I don't eat there but when I did).

yHjWpIAxO679RvBle6fTqA.text: If you're an experienced vegan who's use to trying all the wonderful options veganism has to offer steer CLEAR of this place! Horrible customer service and probably the worst experience I've ever had since going vegan. Waited almost 20 minutes for fries they left off our order because all the employees were busy with gossip hour. The food was a c- at best. Way over priced, even for vegan food. Sub par vegan food at that. Looks like a lot of people were complaining that they're always out of x,y,z flavor(s) of their shakes which I can attest to because they were out of the strawberry shake. Also, they have a B for a health code rating so there's that. Do yourself a favor and pass on this place. There's way too many other GREAT options in the area.  Also, the wait to get our order was ridiculously long. Nothing fast about this fast-food place. And cashier had a bad attitude. Lastly, it was about 60$ for 3 people.

IsZ4Seae7pmKrpo3N9dnCg.text: My husband is wanting to try the Vegan diet for 6 months.  He found this place on FB actually.  Then I came on here to check the reviews on here to check out the menu and hoping to find more information on what's in their ingredients.  I thought there was a little hope with the signs posted saying if you have any food allergic, please inform them.  I know I can't eat at a lot of vegan, vegetarian place because they are soy and nuts central.  I don't think my husband thinks of it like that besides no meat and healthy diet.  I told them, I'm highly allergic to soy and nuts.  I asked the guy at the counter if it's safe to eat the soy free burger with my allergy.  He's not sure and asked someone else.  The girl gave me a really vague response.  I should be ok, but we have signs up to say you should be careful eating our food.  We don't add nuts in anything, but some of the food does have almond milk in the sauce or part of the recipe.  I personally know 80% of all buns has soy in it unless the make sure they an order somewhere for no soy buns or make it themselves without soy.  They're not sure themselves.  Then my next question is, what oil do they use?  The guy said soybean oil.  How do they make a soy free burger with soy?  It's possible they use their soybean oil for the patties and they might have soy in their buns.  They're not 100% sure.  I didn't end up eating anything here, since I don't want to have an allergic reaction to the food.  I did insist my husband to still try out the food, if he does like it, I can just do a drive thru pick up for him.  He go the double vegan burger with curly fries and drink for $10.71 tax included.  He said the curly fries were good.  The burger itself had no taste, it was very bland.  It's like eating buns with an omelette without any seasoning.  He did add their mayo sauce to it.    I personally don't think it's super healthy spot, it's like In-n-Out minus the meat.  Super unhealthy fried food.    We sat inside the restaurant and it's not ventilated...super greasy, oil feeling, our clothes smelt like oil when we got home.  Plus it smells like sewer in here.  They need to do something about the awful sewer smell.   This isn't for us.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double Vegan Burger with Curly Fries &amp; Drink $10.71 included tax.

BIhahnGsmlbXfzhAhatKug.text: Before I came here I heard sooo many different things. Some friends said its great and some said otherwise- I even heard a rumor that they aren't fully vegan. I ended up trying the burger and regular fries and I wasn't amazed. It was bland and I would not get it again but Im definitely willing to come back and try other things on the menu. The concept itself is already great. I really enjoyed the chipotle sauce, the ranch not so much. I also tried my friend's popcorn chikn and I liked it more than my food. I appreciate the diversity of the menu and the location.

EBPjAwAEc4pO4H32u45UdA.text: Subjectively speaking that vegan chicken wrap was the most disappointing $8.00 that ever became of my money.   Objectively speaking though it was the most amazing transaction to have ever happened in human history, Vegeway gave me a pile of mouth turd and I gave them 8 of my precious currency.   I typically like to go to Vegan places once in a while in a ditch effort to save the animal kingdom one more human life's worth of food in meat (that thought was a lot to chew) ((as was  the vegan chicken wrap)) , and thought "hey who better to ask what to get at a vegan place than the workers"   For 1: dude was so annoyed I  asked.  For 2: dude was so annoyed I even existed.  For 3: dude made me legit sad I even came here For 4: who tf hire dude???  Honestly, trashiest customer service from any one employee I have ever met. Rest were really nice and pleasant though. (Thats why I gave it 2 stars, go them for having a nicer rest of the staff)  Got my food at which point I gave them another chance. Just like my father's that second chance was for naught. Sucked so much it hurts to even give a writeup. I almost never picked up my phone in an effort to forget this moment of my life ever happened.   But I really couldnt help feeling guilt for all the lives I could possibly save by writing this up (that parallel convergence with saving animal lives tho), so here I am. Save yourselves, it's too late for me.  *reaches up towards camera* *slowly loses grip* *pan camera away from lifeless body* *wow im a nerd*

DsoMrtPfjqFQp2soK24VAg.text: It was ok. I'm not a strict vegetarian, but I'm not a big meat eater either. Veggie burgers/parties are right up my alley. Bubs and I both got the Hawaiian burger, and though it was pretty flavorful the texture of the patty was mushy. Every bite felt almost like veggie paste that got stuck to the roof of your mouth. If they were more dense then it probably would have been more enjoyable. They didn't taste like meat which I kind of liked (Bubs did not). We also got the side of fried zucchini. Lightly battered and thick pieces, but no flavor. For the price I wasn't satisfied, but if I'm in the area I might give them another try.

TTixxCxINlN1j3nwmKGCEQ.text: Drive through takes 8 minutes per vehicle. I have waited 28 minutes with 3 vehicles in front of me at the S Jones Las Vegas location.  I observed one of the female employee's scoop ice cream and proceed to push the ice cream into the blender with her index finger multiple times with no food prep gloves on. Sanitation in the kitchen appears dirty from the drive through window. The female employee's all look like they are wearing fitness pants and have no hairnet's, aprons, food prep gloves when preparing shakes, and are often preoccupied with talking about what appears to be non work related stories. This all adds to the increased wait time customers can expect at the S Jones Las Vegas location. The food is decent. Although they uses frozen packaged food for fried menu options - e.g., curly and regular fries, orange chicken, ext. Vegan but not healthy in my honest opinion.

Xd7qmu6kHH85BVeIBkQFOw.text: Manager is very rude. I asked if she could repeat my order at the window because I knew it was incorrect. She continued to roll her eyes and sign. When I told her I didn't want two monster fries she gave me a death stare and said "well what fries do you want then?!"  Completely rude. This will be the last time I support this business.

A1cKeVyjy2A4HvGqvO8_WA.text: While the angry vegans of the internet are demanding that In N Out create a veggie burger for them, VegeWay is already doing it- the vegan burger here legitimately calls to mind an immediate comparison to the fast food franchise, with fresh veggies, a soft bun, a flavorful patty, special sauce, and fake cheese that miraculously tastes good!  The burger is the star of the menu, available as a single or double AND patties can be purchased to cook up at home- the owner is open about his ingredients and even meatatarians should find the flavors palatable.   Other menu items are a little less successful- the "beef" bahn mi sandwich didn't do anything for me and was tossed after a couple of bites, and the fish tacos are best described as mediocre.  I've yet to try the popcorn "chicken", because it's always sold out.  Counter service is fairly friendly. They could use a speaker to announce order numbers rather than scream them. Also, there were multiple issues with confusion over the restaurant being closed or open, some customers being turned away, then others being welcomed- it's not a great feeling when it looks like they are picking and choosing who to serve, but it appears to just be confusion.

Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheeseburger!

0BZwT4vcb5dWo5p3Mz3ncA.text: Comparable - to me - to The Loving Hut or Veggie Grill, this fast food joint is worth stopping by for. Although I was surprised that the chicken wrap I ordered was grilled (as opposed to the non-grilled picture on the menu) I wasn't disappointed by the taste. It was a good size for the price. We ordered 2, and split curly fries and two sides of ranch and it came to about $20. Considering Vegas prices, I happily shoved them my card. Definitely a good experience.

sbWcjUSCGTtbksF_EdahGQ.text: Fantastic vegan fast food joint. If you have been to Veggie House (Chef Kenny's other restaurant) than you must try it out too! Me and hubby's first time here after trying out Veggie House 3 times, and we were delightfully surprised on how good the food and service was.   Environment: Very clean, new place. Not a huge place because you can drive thru and order!  Staff: Extremely friendly girl at the register and the rest was friendly saying goodbye.  Food: Selection isn't huge but you do have a selection of burgers, tacos, vietnamese style sandwich, milkshakes, fried sides (fries, sweet potato fries, popcorn chicken).   Price: Decent. Burgers are pretty cheap for vegan food. Good deal with the meals (upgrade to a milkshake for $2.50)  1. Double burger: Burger was huge with cheese, 2 patties, onions, tomato and sauce. The patties were moist and flavourful, you can see the plant based ingredients. Wasn't dry and grainy. The only thing I didn't like was the cheese, it stuck to the roof of my mouth in a "fake cheese" feel. Overall the burger was fantastic and flavour was there.   2. Sweet potato fries: Tasted like any other sweet potato fries. A bit soft but have a crisp.  3. Popcorn chicken: Fried perfectly. No seasoning on it but it comes with a dip and there is ketchup and sirarcha sauce on the side. Soy was moist but a bit stringy.   4. Mango milkshake: Tasted artificial mango, like a gummy mango candy. I'm not a huge fan of that as a drink but if you like your candy/sweet then the mango is for you!  5. Strawberry milkshake: First sip tasted artificial to me, like syrup but there was strawberry seeds in it. It's not a pink color at all, more white. After a while it's pretty good, and VERY less sweet than the mango. Thick too, just the way I like my milkshakes.   Overall, great food and price for vegan fast food style. Don't bee too picky, remember this is ALL VEGAN.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

ccsCY2eCV3zMsJ70kaIXLA.text: Sometimes being vegan is tough when you pass a Mc'D, JBOX all these fast food places where the amazing smell of grease and burgers saturate the air. An right around the corner is this little place where you can satisfy your fast food craving but still remain a vegan. They have several burgers on the menu, shakes, curly fries all in that little fast food setting that you miss oh so much when swearing off meat forever. This place hits the spot when you want a quick vegi burger with all the trimmings, fries and a shake. The in-n-Out for the Vegans.

CVr6wwvpr1mQUApSkVTBgg.text: I love the food. The drive through is awesome, but expect a decent wait. I've never had a bad experience here, just long waits which I understand and quite a few times my order has been a bit mixed up. They've always been quick to fix my order with no charge and treat you with great customer service. One of my favorite quick vegan bites.

gTgB8Lu9tjgtBIS1bZh7Dw.text: So I've tried VegeWay twice now and once through the drive-thru which isn't what I would prefer since you should be eating these meals right when they make them. By the time I ate my first meal it was soggy and not really fresh so I couldn't enjoy it. I ordered a regular burger & curly fries. The second time I came, I brought a friend and we ordered orange chicken, Hawaiian burger and curly fries. The orange chicken was totally different, but you wish you could add a side of rice to make it go together like a rice bowl instead of on a fries tray. The Hawaiian burger was amazing and fresh so all the juices mixed well together with every bite!   Would definitely recommend if you want to try vegetarian/vegan options, but not in a healthy way.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian burger, Cheeseburger, Orange Chicken &amp; Curly Fries

xMJfN7a6bB6KVqX7WkvZag.text: I love their curly fries and nuggets I haven't tried the burgers but I know they serve vegan so I will expect the flavor to be bland. I've been a vegan for 4 years and it's a challenge to find a restaurant that serves one so I am glad that one exist here in Vegas that is like a fast food. I always support local businesses and I love that this one has a drive thru.

2dtiej7ZTsG4O2XDXZS-7Q.text: Always drive past VegeWay on the way to a friend's house so I decided to try it out. VegeWay is a fast food restaurant that serves vegan food aimed towards people that have a particular diet/lifestyle or want to try something new. Its location is small, but does have a drive-through.   I wanted something light for a snack so I went with their popcorn chicken. For the price I paid I was expecting something a bit bigger. The popcorn chicken did taste like chicken, but I thought there was a bit too much breading. The side dressing or sauce that came with the popcorn chicken was definitely not ranch and tasted like it was watered down.   As of right now I'm not a fan, but may come back to try their burgers and other food.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Popcorn Chicken&#34;

B56dg4JdS0vgn_7o62ZDgA.text: So, I went to Vege-Way after a long absence, and was really dissatisfied with my meal. I feel like they've changed some things, and it's not the same quality I used to get. The burger was ok but the fried zucchini were awful, the batter was HARD and since when do you not get a side of ranch when you order zucchini?? Also, the strawberry shake that I used to adore... well... it tastes odd, like those wafer cookies that come in chocolate and strawberry flavors in the center, all dusty. Left a strange aftertaste, too! Very disappointing.

IZ84mG1mdyqewGUtvbNumA.text: Finally! Let's all admit it after spending a weekend in Vegas binge drinking sometimes all you need is a fast-food style burger and fries (greasy and not particularly healthy HAHA). And being vegan and trying to find this is close to impossible.... until I was brought to VegeWay!   My girlfriend had told me about this spot multiple times but we hadn't been to Vegas so when we finally got the chance to come out here you already know VegeWay was on our to-do list! I will start off by saying if you're looking for the normal healthy, low caloric, etc style of meal turn around lol this is the closest to a Big Mac/In-N-Out style of burger that you can get being vegan and I personally LOVED IT! Now I wouldn't eat here everyday but stopping by on our way out from Vegas is just perfect!   When we arrived the first thing that caught my eye was that they have a wide selection of food. Ranging from burgers, "chicken" sandwiches, fries, popcorn chicken, zucchini fries, Bahn Mi, fish tacos, shakes, and salads. When we came we got two burgers, regular fries, curly fries, zucchini fries, popcorn chicken, and a bahn mi for the road (yes we like to try everything!). Here is what the consensus is:   Burgers - 10/10 I'd definitely recommend getting the burgers here. They allow you to get a single patty or even a double. They also have a new burger with guacamole which we didn't do but based off how the burger alone tasted I'm sure guacamole wouldn't be a bad adder. The meat had a really good flavor and the sauce they add is the closest you can get to tasting like you're eating a Big Mac.   Popcorn chicken - 10/10 I would say these are a solid choice to get. The pieces are pretty thick with a nice layer of breading and deep fried to perfection. The sauce that comes with the chicken is really good too (it was this Cajun sauce).   Bahn Mi - 9/10 this had a lot of potential to be great but I think it was a bit dry in my opinion. They do put a sauce on it that tastes really good just not enough.   Lastly of course the fries are good (like all fries are) and the zucchini fries were decent. I would just recommend getting fries unless you're in the mood for zucchini.   So overall I would recommend anyone looking for a nice cheat meal to come here. Again don't come here looking for anything healthy lol and just a word of caution be ready to fork out a decent amount of cash as the prices are a little steep considering it's fast food.

photos.caption: Photo of Vege-Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HqFp9g9vpN-u3fsYsLeRsg.text: I am impressed.  It's was Soo good. Everything is delicious.  I'm not a vegetarian and I ordered two more burgers after the first one because it's taste good.  I really recommended go with the jalapeno burger.

BnFg3rx19sHFlWN6--rpOw.text: Only issue: they are ALWAYS out of milkshakes!!!! I love to enjoy one once a week but usually they are out of the flavoring and "only have vanilla." Firstly, I wasn't a big fan of the flavor of the burger, but I think that was because I made the mistake of ordering a double, instead of a single; flavor was too overwhelming. dQTtI__26LUhWbkhW6ITiA.text: I like their food but their service annoys me. They always act like you're trying to steal if you ask for ketchup or a fork at the drive thru. Recently I purchased 2 $14 Groupon vouchers and was given problems about using both. The Groupon btw says one per visit, and I said ok if I can't make 2 transactions I'll use this one then run to the store down the street and come back and use the other, and was told no that's not allowed...so somehow their vague description of visit means not the same day? I was like ok I'll use one and my husband will use the other, again I was told no because I own both and can't give him one. Dumbest policy ever! I was on that side of town and tried to use both with separate transactions and they wouldn't let me. A nice manager allowed me to a eventually because the Groupon was about to expire and I live far away, and I was poking holes in their policy wording.  But a Groupon is like a gift card in my opinion, and I can only buy from this business every so many months therefore it's not like I'm scamming them. Who cares if I use them both on the same day or different days???

ahFsPRrKLtMlwBSpDSGh3A.text: I am not impressed. The french fries tastes like dirty oil and the popcorn chicken was inedible. It was gross.

p1BJY1HVKVnDJugdzPRrkg.text: I really dislike long reviews, but indulge me if you're so inclined. I gave ** as I just don't have it in me to rate it a *.   *I really LOVE Veggie House and I love Chef Kenny so I am really bummed that I am rating VegeWay as low as I am. I was really expecting a better tasting experience.   I am huge fan of vegan food and love veggie burgers, so naturally I make them pretty darn amazing. I was super excited to give VegeWay a taste as I do lot of vegan hopping around Vegas and have my regular favorites.   My experience here, however, was as bland as it can possibly be. For $9+ you will get a small veggie burger of your choice (light or dark patty - some like to call it "chicken" or "beef", which drives me CRAZY that Vegan people would use animal references AT ALL when it comes to foods they eat. It's illogical and ridiculous), a choice of curly or French fries and a small drink. The combo is just way too expensive, considering that making a veggie patty is a lot cheaper than meat, unless you are a shady eatery that buys the cheapest industrially raised meat :(  I could look past the price ($11 with tip), if the sandwich is actually delicious beyond reason, which, sadly, it wasn't what-so-ever. The "chicken"  patty is bland just enough to make you regret the purchase, but not enough to toss it. I finished it and can call this the least memorable food experience I've had recently. Which, again, makes me super sad because everything at the Veggie House is delicious (I was there again this week).  When I ordered I asked if they have a spicy chicken patty and the cashier said they do and it's a buffalo chicken patty. I thought, GREAT! Love it. But when I bit into it it was just a plain bland patty, topped with the (also) bland Sriracha aioli. When I took the first bite, that aioli.... squirted out of the sandwich all over the tray, my clothes and my phone. I was really expecting a nice piece of (maybe) deep fried "chicken"  with a super zesty, infused crust or a buffalo (red hot) sauce topping, but it was just the stuff they have at the condiment counter. Also, as I kept eating everything was falling out from between the buns. It was a huge mess and I just could not keep it contained. The buns, however, are very good and soft.   This was not a tasty experience, it was a huge disappointment. I've definitely had way Way WAY better vegan "fast food" in Vegas, where flavor, quality and quantity are major highlights.   Chef Kenny, please, try better. I'd most definitely recommend spice and herb infusion for the patties. There are a lot of great vegetable powders that can make these patties taste super delicious. Until then, I shall stay a regular at my regular vegan joints.   Sorry.

soBSgyd26w9cWwH6B8pnSw.text: Vegeway to me is like in-n-out (but way better because it's vegan)  I've tried almost everything on the menu and I've loved all of it, it's great

6AnAKlJOvVPf1azzlZ6wdA.text: Had the popcorn chicken (YUM!). It was even better cold.  Had the chicken wrap. DELICIOUS  Had a chocolate shake. Worth it!

JE_EcGOXfoqyWjIShUcF5A.text: Friendly staff, drive-thru, vegan food! This place is great! My sister is pregnant  and was really craving a cheese burger but gave up meat and dairy. We both decided to finally try this place and it was worth it! We had a great experience. My sister absolutely loved the double vegan cheeseburger. She said it tastes like In-N-Out burgers. But better. I let her try my fish taco and she ended eating the whole thing "omg. I could live off these tacos and burgers" she said. With a thumbs up. My 2 year old nephew loved the popcorn chicken and sweet potato fries. I wish we had more places like these. I saw the owner walk around talking to the other customers. Everyone's so friendly here. Food was quick. And prices weren't so bad either. Try this place. Take your "carnivore" friends I'm sure they'll love it too.

JESHmVHJRQxyWT0jYVWEGA.text: Vegan in n out, and the smoothies are better! Awesome that they have a drive thru as well. Prices are awesome too. Im transitioning my Fiance to stop eating meat and he legit cant believe its a vegan burger and not in n nout!

90tZrSBHKkOc3ynRuA2rKg.text: I'm a big fan of the owners vegan Chinese concept "Veggie House," so I've been wanting to give Vegeway a try. I really wanted to like it, but it just fell short on every level. Drove up and the cashier over the intercom was super nice. I began to give my order and she seemed a bit confused and I figured she was training, which made sense, no big deal. A young man took over the order and I stated again that I wanted the single combo with regular fries, a Diet Coke and popcorn chicken. I pulled up to the window and the guy was nice, but he seemed confused as to what I ordered and asked again if I wanted something to drink, I said yes, a Diet Coke. It was a pretty short wait for my food. While waiting I started noticing some of the signage on the window about allergies, hours etc... but everything was posted on printer paper and taped up like something you'd find behind closed doors, not out front where the customers can see it. This is a little thing but it's a sign that the owner/manager doesn't take much pride in how communication is is conveyed to the guests. He handed the bag over and said thanks, I asked "what about my Diet Coke?" He said sorry and gave me my drink. Again, he was super nice but both staff members I spoke to seemed confused and there was only one other car in the drive through. I didn't think much of it and figured this could be just a random circumstance and didn't get bent out of shape over it.  Ok, now the food. The burger was good and I liked the patty, interesting flavor and texture. Bun was good, special sauce was good and fresh lettuce and tomato. Now the fries, they were undercooked and soggy, bummer. The popcorn chicken had zero seasoning in the batter and it tasted like plain tempura batter. The fact that there's no seasoning in the batter and the fries were soggy leaves me to believe that there may be a quality control issue.   Here's the deal, if you're going to do a vegan version of In n Out Burger, you need to nail every order, every time. That's one reason why In N Out is so successful, great quality control and great food. Again, I really really wanted to like this place, but it just didn't hit the mark. I think a lot of people give it a pass because they are stoked about a vegan fast food place, but it's just not executed as well as it should be. Someone is gonna come along someday and open a concept just like this and do it right.  One last thing. I spent some time reviewing the negative reviews and I didn't see one reply from the management/owners addressing the issues. If you want to improve, you must engage with customers and learn from criticism. It's super important to read bad reviews and address common issues.

PoyZgiS0qwYr-1loId-7MQ.text: I'm obsessed with Veggie House and when I found out that's Chef Kenny was opening Vege-Way I flipped! The food is so bomb! I ordered the double vegan burger with curly fries and a mango milk shake and everything was delicious! The mango milk shake was super sweet, but I still loved it!

io6lUSk2yBZwv7fEd_WR_g.text: I am so excited that we got to try VegeWay on our trip to Vegas from Chicago. It was refreshing to see the tables full of people enjoying cruelty-free food. My husband got the beef sandwich which was more like a bahn mi sandwich than an italian beef one. I had the burger, fries , and shake. The burger patty was crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. Very spot on!! The popcorn chicken was amazing- no difference at all to me from my chicken eating days. The milkshake was good, but we have Chicago Diner here which is crazy good. The entire time I was thinking about bringing my kids here as vegetarians the choices on menus are boring and/or abysmal. The salads looked good, but we were on vacation and were eating like fat vegans at food eating contest. Chef Kenny is doing something revolutionary- he's making vegan food fast, approachable, and affordable.

zvMg_WZBkEsaOjJJ58zoww.text: Very yummy! Great service also, they added avocado FOR FREE lol and grilled onion! Other places would charge extra. It's definitely the little things. They also provide this sauce that's kind of like a spread, it's really good (:

Z4VqcT56ZLQDdX8XFqI1fA.text: I'm so sad because I love this place. On my third visit here I noticed (for a second time) people eating behind the counter where they prepare the food. I mean I know people are going to touch my food but I don't want to see them eating fries and dipping them in sauce while they're getting my stuff ready. Other than that, this is a really fun vegan spot!

P99pASYyOSgQiT5uWCpGBg.text: This place is one of my favorites in town. The food does not taste like other vegan's restaurants it actually taste like real meat. The cheese in the cheeseburgers are to die for, so good. The service is always good and the people there are always smiling. The food is so delicious. I highly recommend this place.

JSUTJZTlK_iCtyb5fiv-KA.text: I went to the centennial one. I read a lot of people complained about grease on their fries so they must have changed it because now they are dry haha. They were hot though which was great. The burger was pretty good. Definitely a place to go to get healthy food, not necessarily delicious food aha. Great service though. Friendly staff.

r3tCtm44wgJAHD8HriglpQ.text: This review is based on a Groupon take out order. I enjoyed the 'chicken' turmeric salad. They put the sauce on the side, so I actually didn't use it and enjoyed the salad without it. Everything was fresh and tasty. I also got the 6 burger patties, but have not tried them yet, they do look very good. One thing that was disappointing, the staff needs training, they didn't not know how to apply the Groupon, the person working my order was wearing gloves, but then touched the register,  phone, food and back and forth...never changing the gloves. Sometimes I think using gloves is worse, because people don't get that cross contamination is the problem. If they have been trained, maybe they just don't care enough to change gloves, it's too much trouble, but that is your business. I would recommend, just watch the food handling.

L5JMK1aqk157cZSMcFTKQg.text: can you say NEW EARTH !? how heavenly is the thought of vegan fast food... where vegans can have a guilty pleasure without feeling guilty at all. its really good and they're always adding more to the menu which makes me want to cry ! I've had the popcorn chicken, the cheese burger, the hot buffalo chicken sandwich, the curly & the regular fries, tried the milkshakes too. ALL bomb dot com with no animals mistreated in the making;) i actually dreamed of eating here last night lol

t4J3OG8Lt-TnEGn1oBv04A.text: It was my first time eating here. The food was good. The only thing I didn't like is the crew blasting music. I like music loud in my car but not blasting while I am eating. Loud yes but not blasting.

M-9xit1MtKk6CisWMEsVrg.text: I was excited to try some new vegan food, but left very disappointed.   The place was super dirty - no one had cleaned the tables or the floor in quite some time. I hate it when eating means I need a tray and to avoid touching the table at all costs.   Almost everything was fried and the menu was very small. I guess that makes it easy to make a choice except that the menu is so small that you feel limited to the best of bad choices. Super unhealthy - I guess here the term vegan only means no animal products but not healthy.   I personally won't be back, but it was obvious that this place has its following. So if you really want a simple vegan McDonald's, have at it. There were plenty of customers, so they must be reaching their own niche which is fine.

zKpcdIMFGjvL0XZHQNg9pA.text: The food here is phenomenal, love the burger and fries which is all I've tried so far. But the drive thru takes forever which is some what understandable since it's not really fast food that's being microwaved. My biggest problem is that that seem to ALWAYS be out of the soy-free patties and the gluten free buns. Doesn't seem to me like they're ready to be open. Because they don't have a distributor that can keep up with the demand. Now I find myself having to call ahead of time to see if they have them available :/

vj0YhCtStW5eENL1WP11FA.text: Great concept - love that there's a fast food plant based restaurant in town. Would be great if there were more items identified as non gmo and organic on the menu. Also, not a fan of the daiya cheese that they use on the burgers. Would love to see an in house option or another brand. Not a strong choice to use in the plant based community as it's one of the least favorite options out there. Keep up the good work and thank you for now 2 yummy restaurants in the Vegas community.

cUvJZI07IJnzZLM513EeyQ.text: Amazing! Small menu but done well. Banh no was amazing and the Hawaiian burger was fabulous! Plus the Groupon was a deal!!

JxB37H0PY1iIxla2ySe8pg.text: The mango shake was delicious  husband ordered a vanilla shake.. he loved it.. we also ordered burgers and fries it was good.. the drive thru lady was nice.. I'll definitely be returning for another mango milkshake LOL..

JwN__D1gkGASjBo3OMyqCw.text: Very clean, friendly, and fast. I enjoyed the faux fish tacos. Delicious.  I wish I had more room to try the other dishes.  I'll have to return to try the tasty looking burgers.  So happy to have found this place.

Q3f7qUWwkrBVKbpDvqKzmQ.text: I give it 3 out of 4 plus an extra star just for being vegan. My boyfriend and I are big fans of veggie house so we were excited to find out vegeway is their sister property. I got a burger strawberry milkshake and zucchini fries. Zucchini fries not worth the money. Burger was ok. Wouldn't order it again tho. Strawberry milk shake was delicious. Taste just like the real thing. Excited to try fish tacos next time.

lBGWknT2H9Sd1HsEs54Zug.text: Yummy! I wish they open another location around Trop n 215. We probably go more often.

LiH-HPmyKfbQmDvD4LRiyA.text: I've eaten here a couple of times, and it is great vegan food for an affordable price. Some vegan restaurants will charge a lot of money for the same thing. I recommend trying your next vegan meal here.

U6nmLOj2Sd_he05iCyBdyw.text: I think this kind of food is great and many different neighborhoods need and want more of it. However, when I actually ate the burger, the vegan cheese stuck to the roof of my mouth and really affected my experience negatively. I thought that the patty tasted yummy on its own. It was very well seasoned! Overall, I would not crave nor try to come back again unless a vegan or vegetarian friend wanted to try this place again. Service was friendly.

cpxrLsfTdgPb44PCgV9JMQ.text: I had a double plus chickenless pieces. Very good, and s choco shake. Ill go back when i visit vegas again.

X_-UH5GyIcZjqXClhfMchg.text: I've been looking forward to this place opening for a few months now. Came today for the soft opening and I was not disappointed! The vegan patty in the burger tasted and felt like real ground beef, which is no surprise coming from the culinary genius, Chef Kenny. The cheese was delicious and oozed from the burger. Even the Dr. Pepper was superb! I wouldn't be surprised if carnivorous patrons came over from the bar next door and thought they were actually eating meat. I'll definitely be back, and highly recommend this place to vegans and meat eaters alike! Let's make it a chain!

GVe7wgrpKrPchaX9jOs8ww.text: AMAZING vegan burgers! I was so excited to eat here, and was not disappointed! We got a couple of free burgers for their soft opening; the patty was so tasty and had great texture! I'm glad there's a fast food option for us vegans now ;)

xBENIRLrduNfsI6gm9NEBQ.text: A Vegan fast food restaurant is just what we needed in Vegas and Chef Kenny is just the right genius to do it.  Amazing burgers! Vegeway did not disappoint!

oborX8ECWn2yoEhU8nry5w.text: Very poor quality. The cashier barely knew the answers to my questions. I ordered a chicken turmeric salad. They forgot the chicken. When I went back in and asked for it, I saw him reach into a case by the floor and throw a handful of chopped vegan chicken which I discovered was half ice cold when I started eating. I also asked for a side of guacamole when I ordered which they also forgot. I will not go back here.

MVTWQmfPbCgMEo5hD9szfg.text: Had a vegan burger meal and a double vegan burger meal and they were amazing! They only took about 7 minutes to complete the order, the the fries weren't super salty which I loved.
